loans.use: To buy more merchandise like ceramics, sweaters, blankets, shirts, and many other items.

loans.name: Elena De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Elena de los Ángeles es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una refresquería y se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace 15 años. Este negocio lo inicio su madre y ella continúo con el negocio en el cual invertirá el crédito en cosméticos, pollo y verduras.
Ella con el crédito anterior logro comprar un exhibidor y empezó a vender gaseosas.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena de los Ángeles is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has been managing a refreshments stand and selling cosmetics for 15 years. This business was started by her mother and she continues to manage it. She will invest this loan in cosmetics, chickens, and vegetables.

With her previous loan, Elena bought a display case and was able to start selling sodas.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, chickens, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jimena Xirey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jimena kirey lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rebeca Patricia quien inicio hace tres años vendiendo verduras con las ganancias empezó a invertir en azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, chiverías y pollo hasta tener una modesta y pequeña pulpería. El crédito lo invertirá en carne, granos básicos y verduras.
Las otras integrantes son Fátima quien tiene comideria y vende sopas y nacatamales; Azucena quien vende productos Avon y ropa; y Raquel tiene una venta desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The "Jimena Kirey" group is made up of four hard-working and enterprising individuals. One of them is Rebeca Patricia who started selling vegetables three years ago. With the earnings she began to buy sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, snacks and chicken, until she had a small, modest grocery store. She will use the loan to buy meat, staple grains and vegetables.

The other members are Fátima, who has an eatery and sells soups and nacatamales (Nicaraguan stuffed corn tamales), Azucena who sells Avon products and clothing, and Raquel who has been in sales for five years.

loans.use: To buy meat, staple grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Rubia Lastenia

texts.es:
La Señora Rubia es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que le da el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con varios lugares para visitar y la belleza de la naturaleza, tiene una gran variedad en la gastronomía la que cautiva a propios y visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Rubia tiene 45 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 24, 20, 15, 7 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y la ayudan económicamente, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Rubia goza de muy buena salud al igual que se encuentran todos los miembros de su familia. Ella es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos de varias marcas y también de embutidos, se encuentra en el negocio hace 5 años.
 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando mercadería para continuar en el negocio, en el pago de dicho crédito no ha tenido ninguna dificultad  y realizo la cancelación a la fecha. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y ropa para tener una mayor variedad de mercadería. La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que existe en el grupo y por los créditos que le dan la oportunidad para continuar con el negocio.

Su meta es tener un local propio para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Rubia is a member of the communal bank "Renacer Uncovia." She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its architectural beauty, for which it has been named a World Heritage Site. It has many places to visit and beautiful landscapes, it has a large variety of cuisine which interests both locals and visitors. The people are friendly, kind and still maintain the culture and traditions of their towns. 

Rubia is 45 years old, is married and has had five children of 24, 20, 15, 7 and 5 years old during her marriage. Her first two children work side by side with her and help her financially. Her third child is studying at college and her two youngest children are studying at a school in the city. She does not have her own house but is renting. 

Rubia enjoys good health, as do all the members of her family. She is a shop-keeper and earns her living selling clothes, cosmetics of various brands and also sausages. She has been carrying on this business for 5 years. 

She invested her previous loan in buying merchandise to continue with her business. She has not had any problem in repaying this loan and repayed it by the due date. She will invest this next loan in the purchase of cosmetics and clothes so that she can have a larger variety of merchandise. She likes the communal bank because of the cameradery which exists in the group and because of the loans which give her the opportunity to continue with the business. 

Her goal is to have  her own shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Herminda, tiene 76 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen nueve hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes, aunque viven muy cerca de ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja por enfermedad.

Ella realiza el crédito para invertirlo en un taller de cerrajería que tienen en su casa con uno de sus hijos, nos cuenta que este negocio lo tenía su esposo pero que por motivos de enfermedad tuvo que dejar y ahora su hijo se hace cargo del trabajo y ella  recibe parte de las ganancias por la inversión que hace en los materiales y es con esto ella y sus esposo salen adelante, allí realizan muchos trabajos con el metal el aluminio y el vidrio, construyen pertas, ventanas, estructuras y varias cosas más, este taller lo tienen hace mas de 20 años en los cuales su esposo trabajaba y gracias a Dios siempre les ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar hierro, soldaduras y pinturas para su taller. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado  a lo largo de este tiempo.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Picoaza is recorded in books as one of the indigenous towns that is part of the Manteña culture. This urban parish is situated only 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabi province. It's a place full of history, where the members of the communal bank Maria Asuncion meet twice a month.

Here we meet Herminda, aged 76.  She is married, and has 9 children from this relationship.  All of her children are now adults and are independent, though they live quite close to her.  Her husband no longer works because he is ill.

Herminda is taking a loan to invest in a metal shop that she has in her house with one of her children.  She tells us that her husband had this business, but because of his illness he had to leave it.  Now her son is in charge of the work, and she receives part of the earnings based on the investment she makes in materials.  This is how she and her husband get by.  In the workshop, they do a lot of work with metal, aluminum and glass, building doors, windows, structures and a variety of other things.  She has had this workshop for more than 20 years.  Her husband worked in it, and thanks to God it always has done well.  

This loan will be used to buy iron, welding materials and paints for her workshop.  She has been with her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because of the help that they have given her over all of this time. 

Her dream is to continue to move forward.

loans.use: to buy iron, welding materials and paints

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta tiene 42 años, es una mujer trabajadora que luchó para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, todos ellos menores, a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Carampa.
Hace 13 años comenzó con su tienda de comestibles, la cual se ubica en un espacio de su vivienda. Ofrece todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como carne, comestibles y bebidas de todo tipo. Gracias a las ganancias que obtiene por su negocio, su producción de papa, maíz y alverja; y también la crianza de cerdos, ovejas y caballos; pudo obtener una camioneta, la cual le sirve para trasladar su mercadería, pues en los meses de mayo a julio comercializa verduras y tubérculos en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Benedicta espera consolidarse y poder brindar a su familia la calidad de vida que sueña.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente tranquila por el apoyo que recibe, además de agradecer la confianza que depositan en ella. Por lo que promete cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, pues no defraudará a su grupo, conformado por personas solidarias y responsables.
Benedicta invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de bebidas para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Benedicta is 42 years old. She is a hard-working woman who has fought to get her three children ahead. They are all minors who she cares for in her own house located in the Carampa community.

13 years ago she started with her grocery store which is located in a space in her home. She offers all types of basic needs products like meat, food and drinks of all kinds. Thanks to the profits her business obtains, her produce of potatoes, corn and peas; and also the breeding of pigs, sheep and horses, she could get a truck which she uses to transport her merchandise.  So in the months from May to July she sells vegetables and root vegetables in her city's wholesale market. Benedicta hopes to consolidate and to be able to give her family the quality of life she dreams of.

This is her first loan with MFP. She feels calm because of the support she receives, moreover she is grateful for the confidence it gives her. She promises to comply with her payments in a punctual way, so she will not let her group down, which is made up of supportive and responsible people. Benedicta will invest the requested money in the purchase of drinks for her store.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her store

loans.name: La Margaritas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Margaritas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora es la señora Mayra Rosa quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, cosméticos y calzado entre otros productos. Este negocio lo inicio hace 7 años y su meta es lograr poner una tienda surtida con variedad de productos.
Las otras integrantes son Rosa quien vende mechas de lampazo y Margarita quien vende gaseosas, frito, moronga, chicharrón y cerveza y su meta es volver a poner su panadería.
texts.en:
The "Margaritas" is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women. The coordinator is Mayra Rosa, who sells clothing, cosmetics, footwear and other products. She started this business seven years ago, and her goal is to manage to set up a store stocked with a variety of products.

The other members are Rosa who sells mop heads, and Margarita who sells soft drinks, fried foods, blood sausage, deep-fried pork rinds and beer; her goal is to set up a bakery again.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.name: La Sagrada Familia - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
HAYDEE de 49 años de edad, es socia de la alcancía comunal La Sagrada Familia de la localidad de El Tambo y en la fotografía es la segunda de la izquierda viste con una casaca blanca y azul, es madre soltera, trabaja muy duro para poder sacar a delante a sus 02 hijos desde muy joven, logrando así que ellos estén estudiando en un Instituto Superior.
A ella la caracteriza el hecho de ser muy luchadora y trabajadora ya que ella tiene un pequeño negocio de postres (pasteles, mazamorras, etc.) y desde muy tempranas horas realiza las compras de sus insumos y los ofrece en el mercado de su localidad.
HAYDEE va invertir el préstamo obtenido en la compra de más insumos ya que como expende hace mucho tiempo sus productos, tiene muchos clientes que siempre le van haciendo pedidos especiales.
*En la parte superior derecha de la fotografía se encuentran la Sra. Sofia con casaca roja y la Sra. Miluska con chompa negra.
texts.en:
Haydee, 49, is a member of the “La Sagrada Familia” (The Holy Family) communal bank located in El Tambo.  In the photo she’s second from the left wearing a white and blue jacket.  She’s a single mother and has worked very hard since she was very young to be able to move her two children forward succeeding in having them attending an institution of higher learning.

She is noted for being very tenacious and hardworking since she has a small desserts business (cakes, 'mazamorra' [made from purple corn], etc.) and starting very early she makes her purchases of ingredients and sells her products in the local market.

Haydee will use the loan she’s gotten to buy more ingredients because she sold out long ago and she has many customers that always make special requests.

In the upper right part of the photograph, Sr. Sofia is shown with a red sweater and Sra. Miluska with a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es:
Son cerca de 6 años que la Sra. Julia se dedica a la confección y venta de uniformes. Ella recuerda que desde muy niña le agrado la costura hizo cursos para aprender todo acerca de la confección, pero no lo ejerció  por dedicarse de lleno a su familia, ya después de algún tiempo se separo de su esposo y tuvo que empezar de cero endeudándose para comprar una maquina esto le costó muchas privaciones hasta que pudo montar un pequeño taller en su casa. Julia confecciona todo tipo de uniformes para diferentes colegios con su trabajo puede costear algunos gastos de la casa y ayudar  para que sus hijos tengan una buena educación, lo que más desea es comprarse un local en gamarra (el centro de la moda en Lima Perú) para confeccionar ropa de mujer y vender directamente y de esa manera expandir su negocio, Julia es la presidenta de la alcancía “ LAS AMISTOSAS” con su préstamo quiere seguir invirtiendo en la compra de telas para la confección de uniformes.
*Julia es la primera de la derecha viste polo negro y lleva un maletin.
*En la imagen adjunta al lado derecho de la foto aparece la Srta. Karen.
texts.en:
Julia has been making and selling uniforms for about six years.  She remembers that she has liked sewing since she was a little girl.  She took courses to learn everything about making clothes, but she never practiced because she devoted herself full-time to her family.  Sometime later she separated from her husband and had to start at zero, getting in debt to buy a sewing machine.  She suffered great hardship until she was able to set up a small tailor shop in her house.

Julia makes all types of uniforms for different schools.  With her job she is able to pay for some of the household expenses and help her children get a good education.  What she most wants is to buy herself a store in Gamarra (the fashion center of Lima, Peru) to make women's clothing and expand her business by making direct sales.

Julia is the president of Las Amistosas Communal Bank.  With her loan she wants to continue to invest in buying fabric to make uniforms.

*Julia is the fifth one from the right, wearing a black t-shirt.
* The image on the right hand side is Sra. Karen

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana tiene 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que cuidó sola de sus dos hijos: Iván y María; a los que educa y alimenta en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Azapampa.
Comenzó en la agricultura, pero con el tiempo aprendió el oficio del bordado de faldas y mantas típicas que utilizan las mujeres en las festividades. Su trabajo se incrementa los meses de junio y julio, aunque comenta que desde ahora se encuentra recibiendo muchos pedidos, por lo que ya no viaja a diversas ciudades a vender sus bordados. Además, en la actualidad se encuentra estudiando para aprender a realizar blusas y pantalones. Comenta que es una de las alumnas más aplicadas y responsables, ya está practicando, y dentro de poco comenzará a confeccionar y vender, pues hay mucha demanda de las prendas en la localidad. Aún no posee todas las máquinas que se requiere, pero poco a poco y con sus ahorros podrá completar su taller.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Azapampa” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo brindado, además de prometer ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, pues las integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables y solidarias.
Valeriana invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una máquina remalladora y telas para comenzar la confección de sus nuevas prendas.
texts.en:
Valeriana, 34, is a hardworking woman who raised her two children, Iván and María, by herself; she feeds and educates them in her own house located in Azapampa.

She started out in agriculture but in time learned the occupation of embroidering skirts and traditional fabrics women use in festivals.  Her work load increases in June and July although she comments that she’s been getting many orders since now so she doesn’t have to travel to other cities anymore to sell her embroidery.  In addition, she’s currently studying to learn how to make blouses and pants.  She comments that she’s one of the best, most responsible students.  She’s already practicing and in a short time will start to make and sell because there is high demand for the articles of clothing in her locality.  She still does not have all the machines she requires but little by little and with her savings she will be able to complete her workshop.

She belongs to the “Azapampa” group and this is her first MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support provided and promises to be punctual with her installment payments because the members of her association are responsible, supportive people.

Valeriana will use the requested money to buy an overlock sewing machine and fabric to start making her new articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and more fabric.

loans.name: Marjorie Raquel

texts.es: Marjorie de 35 años vive junto a su familia en la ciudad de Milagro. Angel el esposo de Morjorie tiene 22 años desempeñándose como electricista en un taller. Tiene 2 hijos pequeños que asisten a la escuela. Antes de tener su negocio trabajaba como dependiente pero el sueldo que recibía no le alcanzaba para cubrir sus gastos, por ese motivo decidió abrir su tienda de abarrotes. Se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio y como nombre le puso “la Económica” vende productos de fácil distribución y que se consumen diariamente. Marjorie abre todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, abre temprano ya que tiene cliente en esas horas. Con el préstamo espera comprar arroz, azúcar, productos de limpieza etc., esperando mas ventas para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 35, and lives with her family in the city of Milagro. Angel, Marjorie's husband, has 22 years experience as an electrician in a workshop. She has two small children who go to school. 

Before having a business, she worked as a sales clerk, but the salary she received was not enough to cover her expenses. For that reason she decided to open her grocery store. It is located in her home, and she named it "La Económica”. She sells convenience products for daily use. 

Marjorie opens her store every day from 7:00 in the morning to 8:00 at night. She opens early as she has customers at that time of day. With the loan, she hopes to buy rice, sugar, cleaning products, etc., hoping for more sales so that her business grows.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cleaning products.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 59 years old and married with six children.

Shirley works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Shirley has taken out and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years, and also earns an income from farming sugar cane.

Shirley aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Medrina

texts.en:
Medrina is 46 years old and married with three children.  With all of her children in school, Medrina works very hard to provide for them.

Medrina runs a sari-sari Store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Medrina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, bread, sugar, soap and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Medrina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es:
Felisa tiene 34 años, está casada con Jhony y tienen tres hijos de una anterior pareja.
Ahora se siente contenta de haber encontrado un buen hombre, Jhony trabaja en una mina y como es lejos, vuelve a casa cada 3 meses. Mientras eso, ella se dedica a su tienda de comestibles, ya tiene 6 meses, sabe que es poco tiempo pero no se amilana, pues ya tiene buenos clientes. Pero su principal ingreso económico es la crianza de cerdos, los que compra de la ciudad, después los engorda y cuida hasta poder venderlos a un mayor precio a los carniceros del mercado más grande de su ciudad. Es por ello que espera aumentar su capital de trabajo para adquirir más animales y obtener mejores ganancias.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Azapampa” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo brindado, además de prometer ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son personas responsables y solidarias.
Felisa invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de comida balanceada para sus cerdos, además de más ejemplares.
texts.en:
Felisa, 34, is married to Jhony and they have three children from a previous relationship.  She’s now happy to have found a good man.  Jhony works in a mine and since it’s far away he comes home every three months.  

In the meantime, she works in her grocery store that she’s had for six months.  She knows that’s a short time but she’s not discouraged because she has good customers.  

But her main source of income is raising pigs that she buys in the city and then fattens up and cares for until they can be sold for a better price to butchers in her city’s largest market.  This is why she hopes to increase her working capital to buy more animals and obtain higher profits.

She belongs to the “Azapampa” communal bank and this is her first MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support provided and promises to be punctual with her installment payments because the members of her association are responsible, supportive people.

Felisa will use the money requested to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her pigs as well as more pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a retail tobacco business in the Philippines. Natividad requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more tobacco to sell in her stall.  She has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Natividad would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

* This picture was taken during market day.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is taking out another loan of KES 50,000 to expand her existing business. She plans to use the loan to purchase bales of maize and wheat flour, and sugar. Since Mwaka's last loan, her business has been doing well and she dreams of expanding it further and establishing another business. Mwaka relates that her family’s living standards have improved and that her children are attending good schools.

loans.use: to purchase bales of maize and wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros, 60 years old, is married and has 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Milagros has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines for 10 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as canned goods, soap, detergent, etc. In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as canned goods, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. Juliana has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. In the future, Juliana would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Harry

texts.en:
Harry, 54 years old, is married and has 6 children, 2 of whom are in school. Harry is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. He has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and feed for his livestock.

Harry has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has taken out 12 loans from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Harry would like to save money to expand his business and to continue sending his children to school.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Ii Group

texts.es:
ANGÉLICA, es una mujer entusiasta y muy trabajadora, tiene un negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet  donde también vende dulces;  ella es madre de un niño de 6 años por quien tiene que trabajar para poder mantenerlo, ya que su conviviente y padre de su menor hijo tiene que trabajar fuera de la ciudad para poder sostener a su familia, visitándolos cada 02 meses, ya que su trabajo así lo permite.
Ella pertenece al ALCOM  LAS TRIUNFADORAS II conformado por  10 integrantes, ella es una de las socias que siempre demuestra esa alegría que le caracteriza como se puede observar en la foto. Ella piensa invertir el préstamo en la compra de golosinas, piqueos y bebidas para venderlas dentro de su negocio de cabinas de internet.
Angélica es la primera de la izquierda, viste un polo color marrón y falda de lana ploma.
texts.en:
Angélica is an enthusiastic and hardworking woman.  She has a business renting out Internet stations and also sells candy at the same location.  Angélica is the mother of a six-year-old son, so she works in order to support him.  Her common-law partner, who is the father of her son, works outside of the city in order to support their family and only comes to visit every two months or as often as his job will allow.  

Angélica is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Triunfadoras II" (The Winners 2), which consists of 10 members.  She is one of the members who always appears cheerful, as seen in the photo.  Angélica is the first person on the left wearing a brown pullover shirt and a gray wool skirt.

loans.use: to buy candy, snacks and drinks to sell

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
Rigoberto pertenece  a la alcancía comunal  Sarita Colonia compuesta  por siete integrantes que se dedican a  diversos comercios  pero teniendo en común el deseo de superación y de salir adelante por el bienestar de sus familias. Rigoberto de 53 años de edad casado y con tres hijos de los cuales  dos son independientes y  uno aun esta a su cuidado. El se dedica al negocio de cabina de internet hace más de siete años, El cual inicio con alquiler de juegos de video,  con el negocio de cabinas de internet a logrado mejorar su casa y dar mayores comodidades a su hogar así también  cubrir gastos como alimentación y estudios para sus hijos. En el futro le gustaría expandir su negocio a otros lugares para así poder generar mayores ingresos. Con el presente préstamo  piensa en hacer mantenimiento a todas sus maquinas. Un grupo con el solo objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones económicas es lo que caracteriza a esta alcancía comunal Sarita Colonia. el Sr. Rigoberto es el tercero de la derecha viste un pullover plomo y camisa manga larga blanca.
*En la parte inferior izquierda de la fotografía se encuentra la Srta. Kathy.
texts.en: Rigoberto belongs to the communal bank Sarita Colonia which is made up of seven members working in various businesses but they have in common the desire to succeed and to get ahead for the well-being of their families. Rigoberto Dionisio is 53 years old, married with three children, two of which are independent and one still in his care. He has been working in the Internet booth business for more than seven years. He began by renting video games, and with the Internet booth business he was able to improve his home and provide more comfort at home and also cover expenses such as food and education for his children. In the future he would like to expand his business to other locations in order to generate better earnings. With this loan he plans to do maintenance to all his equipment. This group has the sole objective of improving their financial conditions, and this is what characterizes this communal bank of Sarita Colonia.

loans.use: to maintain his computers

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña katupyry es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Luque, ellas son 12 mujeres de esa ciudad, todas ellas amigas y vecinas que se unieron con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma poder tener un mejor estilo de vida.
La Sra.Marcelina se dedica a la venta de lenceria prendas de vestir, cosmeticos. Ella esta casada con el señor Ruben con quien tiene  1 hijo todavia pequeño. Marcelina se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, su mayor sueño es que su hijo se convierta en una persona de bien, que pueda estudiar y ser alguien en la vida.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de ropas, calzados deportivos, lenceria, cosmeticos y demás productos para la venta. Marcelina tiene como meta ir avanzando en el negocio teniendo mas productos para vender y mas clientes.
texts.en:
Kuña katupyry is a group formed in the city of Luque; They are 12 women from this city, all of them friends and neighbours that got together because they wanted to help each other and that way be able to have a better lifestyle.

Marcelina makes a living selling lingerie, clothing and cosmetics, she is married to Ruben with whom she has a small child. 
Marcelina thinks of herself as a hard-working person and a fighter, her biggest dream is for her child to become a good person, that he will be able to study and be someone in life.

She requests this loan to buy clothing, sport shoes, lingerie, cosmetics and other products for selling.

Marcelina's goal is to make progress with her business having more products for sale and more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sport shoes, lingerie, cosmetics and other products.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is taking out another loan of KES 50,000 to expand her existing business. She says that the previous loan has enabled her to increase both her sales and her monthly income. Rukia hopes to establish a slaughterhouse in the future. She plans to purchase more cows to sell at the market. Rukia says that she can now cater for her family's basic needs without any burden. She gives thanks to both Yehu and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to sell at the market.

loans.name: Jesus Miguel

texts.es:
Jesús es un joven emprendedor de 23 años muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona; en su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y también en algunas ocasiones le gusta comer acompañado de sus amigos y familia uno de sus platillos favoritos como son los "Tallarines Rojos"; con mucho empeño Jesús terminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recuros no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera universitaria de Ingeniería Mecánica. 
Con mucho entusiasmo y dedicación, Jesús trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 40 clientes; Jesús piensa que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con sus clientes y sobre todo muy respetuoso.
Jesús está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar un televisor que le servirá para ir acondicionando su hogar, de esta manera cuando regrese de su trabajo podrá compartir gratos momentos con su familia, lo cual le favorecerá de mucho para seguir luchando cada día y poder conseguir su gran sueño de tener una mototaxi y su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jesus is an enterprising and hardworking youth who is 23 years of age.  He lives in the city of Ica, in the Parcona district.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends, and at times he also enjoys eating his favorite dishes such as "Tallarines Rojos" (spaghetti) with his friends and family.  With a lot of effort, Jesus got his high school degree.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources he has not been able to enroll in a university, but he would have liked to have been able to study mechanical engineering at the university level.

Jesus works as a mototaxi driver with a lot of enthusiasm and dedication.  He works in this business about 10 hours each day, during which time he can serve about 40 customers.  Jesus thinks that his business is doing well because he is very friendly with his customers, and most of all, respectful.  Jesus is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support he will be able to buy a television set to furnish his house with.  In this way, when he returns home from work, he can share some great moments with his family, which will encourage him a lot to continue to strive each day toward achieving his greatest dream of having his own mototaxi and his own house.

loans.use: to buy a television

loans.name: Vicki

texts.es:
Vicki tiene 29 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el caserío Pedregal, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, ubicado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de camino al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La zona tiene una calidad de vida bastante precaria y sólo cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

Vicki se dedica a la comercialización y venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo. Ella ofrece los productos por pedidos a sus clientes y también los adquiere por su cuenta para contar con un stock permanente. Su clientela se encuentra en la zona donde vive, generalmente camina trayectos largos en busca de nuevos clientes de caseríos cercanos. Ella tiene más de dos años de experiencia en el negocio. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. Con estos ingresos apoya a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Ella desea adquirir más productos con los cuales pueda aumentar su stock de cosméticos y así poder satisfacer en mayor cantidad la demanda de sus clientes. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo. Ella es una persona bastante conocida y respetada por sus vecinos de la zona en donde reside.
texts.en:
Vicki, 29, lives with her husband and minor son in Pedregal, a rural part of the Tambogrande agricultural district located in Piura Region more than four hours away to the north of the city of Chiclayo.  The zone has quite a precarious quality of life; the only utility it has is electricity.

Vicky sells cosmetics via catalogue.  She sells all her products based on customer orders and also buys some herself in order to have some permanent stock on hand.  Her clientele is found in the area where she lives.  She generally walks long distances seeking new customers in adjacent settlements.  
She has more than two years’ business experience.  In addition, she raises barnyard fowl to sell.  She helps her husband support their home with her income.

She wants to buy more products to increase her stock of cosmetics and be able thus to meet greater customer demand.  To reach her objective she’s felt it advisable to request an 800 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternative with which she feels she car reach it.  In the zone where she lives, she is a quite well-known and respected person.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Lagunas del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su vivienda es de material rústico.

En una pequeña habitación de su vivienda, Violeta ha instalado una pequeña bodega en la cual ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes diversos abarrotes, bebidas gaseosas y artículos de primera necesidad. Su negocio es uno de los pocos que existen en la zona por lo que es de bastante ayuda para sus vecinos. Con los ingresos de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar. Su esposo trabaja como chofer de una línea de transporte que une su caserío con la ciudad de Chiclayo. En su familia se aprecia bastante voluntad sus actividades laborales y  cooperación con sus vecinos.

Violeta se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Dicho préstamo será invertido en compra de abarrotes y ropa aprovechando la posible demanda por la cercanía de días festivos. Gracias a esta inversión ella espera mejorar sus ingresos y dar una  mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Violeta, 37, is a mother living with her husband and son in Lagunas in Mórrope District, an agricultural zone located in Lambayeque Province an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.  Her house is made of insubstantial building materials.

In a small room in her dwelling, Violeta has set up a small store where she sells her neighbors and customers a variety of groceries, carbonated beverages and basic staple items.  Her store is one of the few that exists in the zone so it’s of great help for her neighbors.  With income from this activity she helps her husband support the home.  Her husband works as a driver for a transportation firm that connects her settlement with the city of Chiclayo.  Her family exhibits quite a bit of willingness to work and to cooperate with her neighbors.

Violeta is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan that she will use to buy groceries and clothes taking advantage of the approaching feast days.  Thanks to this investment she hopes to improve income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries and clothes.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP through NWTF to purchase more blouses, pants, other ready-to-wear clothing, body lotion and bags for her clothing sales business.  Maricel has been in this business for eight years, and earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more blouses, pants, other ready-to-wear clothing, body lotion, and bags.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 15 years, she has operated a t-shirt printing business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from cosmetics sales. Mary Jane has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her t-shirt printing business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a 39-year old married woman with 5 children living in Panduma, Tukuran. Her husband is a fisherman. In order to bring additional income to the family, Jocelyn started a fruit and vegetable business 7 years ago. She usually earns 3,000 PHP per month. With the help of this 4,000 PHP microcredit loan, Jocelyn is able to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. She joined GDMPC in 2008. Jocelyn hopes to someday have much greater revenue for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 47 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora. Tiene tres hijos, dos ya son mayores y la menor tiene 10 años; con ella tiene la difícil situación de criarla sola, ya que se separó del padre de sus hijos.
Su trabajo consiste en la venta de productos de belleza, trabajo que realiza desde su casa donde espera a sus clientes o sale a visitarlos a sus domicilios. Lleva realizando este trabajo 12 años y está muy contenta de tener este ingreso para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. Al principio, como sus productos no eran tan conocidos, le era difícil hacer su trabajo, pero con el pasar del tiempo pudo superar ese obstáculo y ahora es una de las vendedoras más reconocidas por el monto de pedidos que realiza. Adicionalmente trabaja para una entidad privada donde percibe un sueldo mensual y así genera dos ingresos para su hogar. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro, pero por el momento se está centrando en aumentar de a poco su capital de trabajo.

Este es su préstamo 14 con la institución MFP, pues es parte desde el año 2006 (teniendo un promedio de dos créditos por año), por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Está comprometida con el grupo que conforman los integrantes del banco comunal al que pertenece, y está convencida que será una buena cliente, puntual y responsable en sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles, comprará productos de belleza en grandes cantidades y los tendrá en exhibición.
texts.en:
Natividad is 47 years old, and is a happy and enterprising woman.  She has three children, now two are older and the youngest is 10 years old;  with the youngest she has the difficult situation of raising her alone, since she separated from the father of her children.

Her business consists of selling beauty products, work that she carries out from her house where her clients come to her or she visits them in their homes.  She has carried out this work for 12 years and is very happy to have this income to offer a better quality of life to her daughter.  At first, as her products weren't very well known, it was difficult for her to do her work. But with the passing of time she was able to overcome this obstacle and now is one of the most recognized salespeople due to the sum of orders she carries out. Additionally she works for a private entity where she receives a monthly salary and from this generates two incomes for their home.  She has many plans for the future, but in this moment she is focusing on increasing little by little her capital for work.

This is her 14th loan with the insitution MFP, by which she hopes to continue with her objectives. She is committed to the group that forms the members of the communal bank she belongs to and is convinced that she will be a good client, punctual and responsible in her payments.  With the total requested, 2500 nuevo soles, she wil buy beauty products in large quantities and will have them on display.

loans.use: Comprará más productos de belleza en grandes cantidades

loans.name: Fayez

texts.en:
Seen in this photograph, Fayez is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past thirteen years, Fayez's family has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project but not enough to cover the family’s needs. Fayez’ salary is low as well, and not enough to cover his own costs and expenses.

Fayez is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help his family cover the costs of buying more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will help to increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To buy more sheep.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Sam N°9 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Takku liggey sam n°9" est composé de cinq femmes qui exercent toutes un commerce de produits ménagers.Elles sont mariées et mères de familles. Elles placent leurs produits à crédits et se font payer au bout de deux mois.Elles parviennent ainsi à générer des revenus qui leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins et d'appuyer leurs maris dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles.La présidente du groupe est mère de trois enfants; Un garçon et deux filles qui vont toutes à l'école.Elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine qu'elle place auprès de ses clients. Elle récupère son argent au bout d'un ou de deux mois. Les bénéfices tirés de ce commerce lui permettent de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants ainsi que ses propres besoins. Les membres du groupe sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter des cuillères, des casseroles, des seaux et des bassines.
texts.en:
The group "Takku liggey sam No. 9" consists of five women who are all traders of household products. They are all married mothers. They sell their products on credit and collect payment after two months. In this way they manage to generate enough profits to meet their needs and support their husbands in taking care of the family maintenance expenses. 

The president of the group is the mother of 3 childen: one boy and two girls who all attend school. She sells cooking utensils to her clients. She recovers her money investment one or two months. The profits from her business allow her to pay her childrens' school fees and meet her own personal needs.

They group is seeking a loan of 250,000f so that they can buy spoons, cooking pots, buckets and basins.

loans.use: to buy spoons, cooking pots, buckets and basins

loans.name: Seidy

texts.es: Doña Seidy es una mujer de 54 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su compañero. Es trabajadora y esforzada por cumplir sus metas. Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante de ventas por catálogos. Primero ve su hogar y luego sale a ofrecer su mercadería. Tiene varios años de obtener ingresos de esa manera sin descuidar a su familia. En su crédito anterior fue responsable y puntual. Ahora quiere aumentar sus ventas para superarse como persona y a nivel de negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo. Va a invertir en la línea de zapatos, ya que sus clientes le han pedido y ella quiere satisfacerlos.
texts.en: Seidy is a 54 year-old woman who lives with her common-law husband.  She is hardworking and exerts herself a lot to achieve her goals.  She has a business where she sells goods from a catalog in an itinerant manner.  First, the goods go to her home, and later she goes out to offer them for sale.  She has been getting income this way for a number of years, without neglecting her family.  In her previous loan she was responsible and punctual.  Now she wants to increase her sales so that she can excel as a person and succeed in her business, and to do this she is requesting a loan.  She will invest in a line of shoes, because her customers have requested them and she wants to satisfy them.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comité “Joaju” es de la ciudad de Santaní, y tiene como integrantes a 10 mujeres, madres de familia, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad.
Mirtha es la presidenta del grupo, y comenta que en su grupo están empezando a trabajar juntas y que siempre tratan de ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ella por ejemplo se dedica a la venta de prendas, y gracias a esto ayuda a su familia a salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para abastecerse con prendas de todo tipo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Joaju" committee is located in the city of Santaní and has 10 women members, mothers of families, all friends and neighbors in that city.  The desire of all of them is to help each other in such a way as to improve the quality of life of their families.

Mirtha is the president of the group.  She comments that in her group they are beginning to work together and they always try to help each other.  For example, she sells clothing, and thanks to this she helps her family get ahead.

She is requesting the loan to stock up on all types of clothes and so continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат трудолюбивая и добрая женщина, она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Муж является дехканином. Более 10 лет Шарофат занимается выращиванием лука, ячменя и дыни. Её поливные земли составляют 1,80 гектаров. Шарофат хотела бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и семян. Она надеется на вашу поддержку, которая позволит ей повысить урожайность земли.
texts.en: Sharofat is a hardworking and kind woman, she is married and is a loving mother of two children. Her husband is a member of a collective farm. Sharofat has been cultivating onions, barley and melons for over ten years. Her arable land is 1,80 hectares. Sharofat wants to take out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds. She is hoping for your support which will allow her to increase the fertility of her land.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Coura

texts.fr: Madame Coura  est une femme mariée qui s’active dans le secteur  du commerce et s’adonne depuis plus de 15 ans à la vente de petit déjeuner  de tissus. Elle consacre 8 heures de temps de la journée à son activité de commerce. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs. Une partie du son financement sera réservée  a l'achat de denrées alimentaires pour les besoins de préparation du petit déjeuner qu'elle vend et l'autre partie est  prévu pour l’achat de tissus  a vendre par placement.Son objectif est de diversifier la gamme des   tissus qu’elle commercialise.Elle veut accroitre ses bénéfices ce qui lui permettra de participer positivement a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille et  d’épargner de l’argent. Son plus grand rêve  est de devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Coura is a married woman who works in trade and has been selling breakfast and fabrics for over 15 years. She works eight hours a day.  

As a member of the local U-IMCEC branch, she is seeking a loan of 150,000F to buy foods to prepare breakfast which she sells, and the rest to buy fabrics for resale. Her goal is to diversify the range of fabrics she sells to bolster her activity and increase her profits. This would allow her to play a positive role in improving her family’s nutrition and add to her savings. 

Her biggest dream is to become an important businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Maigen

texts.en: Maigen is single and she works hard to support her family. For the past 10 years, she has operated a broomstick manufacturing business in the Philippines. Maigen has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business. In the future, Maigen would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make broomsticks

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en: Mwenda intends to use this KES 50,000 loan to expand her current business by increasing the stock in her shop. She will be able to purchase sugar, beans, soaps, detergents, and cooking fat. Mwenda's aim is to own a wholesale shop in the future. She relates that her last loan has allowed her to settle her bill and she can now pay school fees for her children without any problem.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, soaps, detergents and cooking fat.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 7 children, Patricia works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Patricia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe works hard to fulfill her simple dream of providing a better living for the needs of her family. She is happily married to Carmelito, who is currently operating a farming business. The couple helps each other in sustaining the needs of their four children. Maria Fe has run her piggery business for almost 20 years. At this moment, she is raising and fattening three hogs. She wants to provide a better way of life for her family. So, to obtain her objective, she is requesting financial support from lenders through ASKI in the amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase hog feed, medicine and vitamins for her livestock. Hopefully, this amount will bring progress to her business as well as to her family living.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed, medicine and vitamins for her livestock business.

loans.name: Claudia Esmerita

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven de 27 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora y ello lo aprendió de su padres quienes le enseñaron de muy pequeña a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente y sobre todo a ser humilde. Es madre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad, el cual va a una escuela de educación inicial y quien le saca canas verdes porque es muy travieso, pero es la persona más importante para ella y por quien ella daría la vida con tal de verlo feliz y libre de peligros, es su más grande motor y por quien sale adelante cada día. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener playas maravillosas, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura  en especial el cultivo de arroz, asimismo se desarrolla la pesca y sobre todo es conocido por la generosidad de sus pobladores.

Con mucho entusiasmo Claudia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa y lencería, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el dia; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad y a precios cómodos.

Claudia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería de temporada de invierno como chompas, pantalones, casacas, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprarse un terreno para construir su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Claudia, 27, is a hardworking young woman who learned everything from her parents who taught her to earn her daily bread with the sweat of her brow and above all to be humble when she was still a little girl.

She’s the mother of a little 3-year-old boy who goes to nursery school and who is so mischievous that he’s giving her gray hair but he’s the most important person for her and she would give her life to see him happy and free from danger.  He is her greatest motivator and for whom she moves forward every day.

Her house is located in the city of Camana, a city noted for having wonderful beaches.  Agriculture, especially rice growing, also takes place here as well as fishing; it’s very well-known above all for the generosity of its inhabitants.

Claudia works in her business which is selling clothes and lingerie with much enthusiasm.  She works about 10 hours daily and can see up to 15 customers per day.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s very kind to her customers and above all because she offers quality products at affordable prices.

Claudia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy winter season merchandise like sweaters, pants and jackets, among others and continue working and striving daily towards making her greatest dream a reality:  to buy a piece of land to build her own house on.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mdune

texts.en:
Mdune is a married man with six children, three of whom are in school. He has been operating a goat meat business for over twenty years, selling at the market. His primary customers are the butchery operators and travelers. Mdune owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His dream is to open a retail shop in the future. Frequent disease outbreak is his major challenge. 

With the loan of KES 80000, he intends to purchase goats and cows.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows.

loans.name: Edith Narcisa

texts.es: Edtih tiene 52 años de edad y vive en Quevedo junto a su familia. Está casada con Luis quien se dedica a la venta de boletos de lotería recorriendo varios sectores de la ciudad. Tiene 2 hijos quienes tienen 17 y 20 años de edad, estudian en el colegio y academia particular respectivamente. Edtih tiene una venta de velas y arreglo florales ubicado en el cementerio general de la ciudad. Tiene 12 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual la inicio por la necesidad de ayudarle a su esposo con la economía del hogar. También nos cuenta que le gusta mucho y como está cerca de su casa se le hace fácil el traslado. El negocio lo atiende sola todo el día, mientras vende realiza los arreglos. Su mayor inconveniente es las lluvias y el sol porque su puesto solo tiene un pequeño parasol que no le cubre mucho. Ella piensa con el préstamo comprar materiales para el arreglo de los ramos como fomix, flores naturales, velas y agua. Espera con esto mejorar sus ventas y su sueño es abrir un local propio en la vendería también medicina natural.
texts.en:
Edith is 52, and lives with her family in Quevedo.  She is married to Luis, who sells lottery tickets, and makes his rounds in several areas of the city. She has two children, ages 17 and 20. They go to high school, and a private academy respectively.

Edith has a stand selling candles and floral arrangements, located in the general cemetery of the city. She has been doing this work for 12 years. She started it because she needed to help her husband with the household finances. She also says that she really likes it, and as it is near her home, it makes it easy for her to transport things.

She runs her business alone all day, and while she sells, she does the arrangements. Her biggest problem is the sun and rain, because her stand only has a small sunshade which doesn't provide her much cover. 

With the loan, she intends to buy materials for arranging the bouquets, such as styrofoam, natural flowers, candles and purified water. With this she hopes to improve her sales. Her dream is to open her own shop, where she would also sell natural medicines.

loans.use: To buy styrofoam, natural flowers, candles and purified water.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 43 years old, is married and has three children, one in college and two in high school. Marilyn and her spouse generate about PHP 10,000 each harvest season (twice a year) from their farming business. They also raise hogs to fatten and breed as an additional source of income.

Marilyn needs to improve her businesses so she is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy urea (fertilizer) and three liters of insecticides and pesticides. In the future, Marilyn would like to achieve a plentiful harvest every season to pay matriculation fees and to save up for times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy urea (fertilizer) and three liters of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luis A. labora en una maquiladora de la ciudad y se dedica a la plomería. Eso habla muy bien de el ya que tiene 12 años de antigüedad laborando y nos damos cuenta que es un hombre trabajador y que lucha por sus dos hijos y por su esposa Ma. De Dolores. El deseo de Luis es colocar una losa de concreto en un cuarto que tiene en construcción para hacer crecer el patrimonio que un día dejara para su vejez y pasara a manos de sus hijos.
texts.en: Luis A. works as a plumber in a factory in the city.  They speak very highly of him, because he has been working there for 12 years, and they tell us that he is a hardworking man who struggles to provide for his 2 children and his wife Dolores.  Luis wants to put a concrete roof on a room that he is building, so that he can expand the property that he will have for his old age, and will someday pass on to his children.

loans.use: to build a roof

loans.name: Mdune

texts.en:
Mdune is 50 years old, married, and has six children who attend school.  Mdune has been operating a goat meat business for 12 years, selling at the market mainly to the people operating slaughter houses. 

Mdune is requesting a loan for 8,0000 KES, which he will use to purchase goats and cows. Theft of animals is his major challenge.  Mdune lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He describes food and school fees to be his greatest monthly expenses. His goal is to own a rental house.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows.

loans.name: Shery Luz

texts.en:
Shery Luz is a 25-year-old married mother of one child. For over five years, she has made a living by operating a general store in Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She sells a variety of food and home-use products, earning 6,000 PHP a month.

Shery Luz recently joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo (malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Rubylin

texts.en:
Rubylin lives in San Esteban with her spouse and four children. The couple manages a hectare plot of land, ample for cultivation. They plant and harvest rice to sell to traders in their village, earning about PHP 10,000 each harvest season (twice a year). Their income is spent on meals and allowances.

Rubylin is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to further improve their farming practices. This will help crops grow healthier and when harvest season arises, Rubylin will be confident of gaining more crop production. Rubylin hopes that she and her husband will become successful rice growers someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 24 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo y de su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad ama muchísimo y por quien da la vida y trabaja mucho por darle mucho amor y sobre todo una vida de calidad. Al lado de su esposo quien le brinda su apoyo y sobre todo es su mano derecha viven en la ciudad de Pisco, la ciudad de Pisco se caracteriza por tener playas hermosas y sobre todo un clima acogedor, encontramos también atractivos turísticos como “Las Islas Ballestas”, las cuales reciben muchos turistas en todo el año. Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo mucho trabajo Ana logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa, cerveza, productos de belleza, entre otros, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque siempre trabaja con muchos ánimos y sobre todo atiende a sus clientes de manera amable.

Ana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le  han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora para su negocio de venta de cervezas, asimismo comprara mercadería en ropa como casacas, pantalones, chompas, entre otros por la temporada de invierno, así de esta manera ella podrá ofrecer  una mejor atención a sus clientes y también podrá ofrecer más productos para su clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia”.
texts.en:
Ana, 24, is a young woman living with her husband and five-year-old daughter who she loves very much and for whom she’d give her life and works hard to provide her with much love and above all a life of quality.  

Alongside her husband, who supports her and above all is her right hand, she lives in the city of Pisco, a city noted for having beautiful beaches and a welcoming climate.  Tourist attractions like the Ballestas Islands are also found here.  They receive large numbers of tourists all year.

With much effort and work Ana succeeded in starting a business of selling clothes, beer and beauty products, among others.  She works about 10 hours daily and can see up to 15 customers per day.  She believes she does well in her business because she always works with much eagerness and above all treats her customers in a kind way.

Ana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy a freezer for her beer selling business as well as clothes like jackets, pants and sweaters among other winter clothes in order to be able to provide better customer service as well as offer more products to her customers which will allow her to continue striving daily to make her greatest dream a reality: to give her daughter a profession and her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and merchandise.

loans.name: Invierno Group

texts.es: Gerardo tiene 46 años de edad, y es originario de un mágico lugar lleno de naturaleza donde la principal atracción de su localidad es el santuario de la mariposa monarca y donde año con año arriban miles de visitantes de todo el mundo a admirar un espectáculo de mariposas monarcas sin igual. El está casado con Carmina y tienen 2 hijos los cuales estudian la secundaria. Gerardo dice  que se dedica a la elaboración de pan de rancho dice que tiene con este negocio desde hace mas de 3 años y dice que le gusta mucho lo que  hace porque hay clientas que le dicen que tiene buen sabor el pan que hace. Dice que emprendió el negocio por que hubo recorte de personal donde trabajaba y para poder mantener su familia su mama le dijo que se dedicara hacer pan y que ella le iba a enseñar cómo hacerlo y decidió hacer el negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios.  Él está pidiendo un crédito para comprar insumos para hacer el pan como harina, huevo, leche, mantequilla, leña, levadura etc. El sale a vender su pan a la calles de su localidad y mucha gente va hasta su casa a comprarle el pan. Dice que el crédito le beneficiara porque tendrá insumos para hacer su pan. La meta que tiene don Gerardo es hacer otro horno ya que el que  tiene es pequeño y no puede hacer más rápido el pan es por eso que quiere hacer otro para hacer mas producción de pan de rancho el cual es delicioso. Los otros seis integrantes del grupo se llaman Teresa, Juana, Imelda, Rosa, Elizabeth y Adela ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de insumos para hacer pan, material para hacer bordados artesanales para vender, artículos para tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Gerardo, 46, is from a beautiful, magical place, a place known around the world for the butterflies that come to spend the winter here.  Visitors, too, come from far and wide to admire the unparalleled spectacle of millions of monarch butterflies together in one place.  Gerardo and his wife, Carmina, have 2 children, both in high school.  He tells us that he has operated a bakery business, making a traditional bread, for 3 years.  He is happy with the business and says that his customers like his bread and always come back for more.  He says that he started the business after he was laid off from the company where he worked before and needed a way to support his family and pay for his children's schooling.  His mother suggested that he start a bakery and agreed to show him how to make the traditional bread that is now the mainstay of the business.  Gerardo is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies--flour, eggs, milk, butter, yeast, firewood, etc.--for making bread.  He sells what he makes on the streets of the city and people come out of their houses to buy from him.  He is grateful for the loan because it will allow him to buy the supplies that he needs.  He says that his goal for the future is to buy a larger oven because the one he has is too small.  The other members of the group--Teresa, Juana, Imelda, Rosa, Elizabether and Adela--will invest their share of the loan in their businesses which vary from clothing sales to grocery sales.

loans.use: to stock their retail businesses.

loans.name: Arin

texts.en:
Arin, 43 years old, is married and has three children. For the past 5 years, she has been running a business buying and selling frozen foods such as hot dogs and longanisa (pork sausages). Arin earns about PHP 4,000 a month.

Arin is aiming to increase her profits, but is facing high electric bills for her freezer use. She is asking for financial support in the amount of PHP 8,000 to buy additional hot dogs and longanisa to sell. She believes that she can improve her income with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy additional hot dogs and longanisa

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en: Anselma is a hardworking entrepreneur. She has operated a native products business in the Philippines for 11 years and earns additional income from her general store. Anselma is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Anselma dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her native products.

loans.name: Nera

texts.en: Nera is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 5 years, she has operated a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines. Nera has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. In the future, Nera would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tenemos Confianza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tenemos Confianza está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Natividad de 33 años, casada y tiene cinco hijos de 12, 11, 5, 4 y 2 años de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio de productos variados desde ropa, cosméticos, perfumes y electrodomésticos por encargo. Este negocio lo inicio con su madre la cual vendía y ella inicio con ropa íntima y poco a poco lo fue aumentando.
El crédito lo invertirá en mercadería en ropa en especial para el día de las madres.
Las otras integrantes son Concepción quien desde muy joven se dedica a la costuras pero hasta hace 20 años que tiene su taller y Jacqueline se dedica al comercio de ropa.
texts.en:
The group "Tenemos Confianza" (We Have Confidence) consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals. One of them is Natividad. She is 33 years old, married, and has five children (ages 12, 11, 5, 4, and 2). Natividad sells various products such as clothes, cosmetics, perfumes, and household appliances by taking orders. She started this business with her mother, who sold it to her. Natividad started out selling undergarments, and slowly her business increased. Her loan will be invested in merchandise, especially clothes for Mother's Day.

The other members are as follows: • Concepción has been sewing from a very young age, but has owned a workshop for the past 20 years. • Jacqueline sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Raul Santiago

texts.es:
Raul es un joven de 19 años, vive en el distrito de Tate, Ica, Perú.  El cual se caracteriza por desarrollarse la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de Algodón, uva, esparrago, alcachofa, entre otros, asimismo encontramos a varias empresas agroexportadoras, las cuales brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a los pobladores de la zona. Cuando Raul tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos de su barrio y luego en algunas oportunidades le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Arroz Chaufa. Con mucho esfuerzo y con los frutos de su trabajo Raúl se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de ensamblaje de computadoras.

Con entusiasmo Raul trabaja en un taller de mecánica, planchado y pintura, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, ya que por las noches el acude a su centro de estudios; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy honrado y porque es muy responsable.

Raul está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales como ladrillos, cemento, fierros para construir un pequeño cuarto en su vivienda ya actualmente su cuarto solo es de esteras, así de esta manera el podrá tener una mejor cálida de vida y seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser un profesional y un orgullo para sus padres”.
texts.en:
Raul, 19, lives in Tate District in Ica, Perú which is noted for agriculture, especially cotton, grapes, asparagus and artichokes, among others.  Various exporting firms are found there which provide many jobs to residents of the area.  

When Raul has spare time available he enjoys playing soccer very much with his friends from the neighborhood and on occasion enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes which is Chinese-style fried rice.  With much effort and with the fruits of his labor, Raul is studying a technical career learning to assemble computers.

With enthusiasm Raul works in an auto repair, detailing and painting shop.  He works about 8 hours daily because he attends classes at night.  He believes that he does well in his work because he’s very honest and very responsible.

Raul is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy bricks, cement and rebar to build a small room in his house because his current room is made from rush matting and this way he’ll be able to have better quality of life and continue working and striving toward making his greatest dream a reality: to become a professional and a source of pride for his parents.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and rebar.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 59 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel. She is married and has three children. Rosalinda has a business selling snacks, earning about PHP 5,000 each month from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase flour, cooking oil, baking yeast and rice. Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, cooking oil, baking yeast and rice

loans.name: Ma Trinidad

texts.es:
La señora Ma. Trinidad cuenta con permiso para vender en la vía pública, es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales actualmente se encuentran estudiando.
Trinidad vende ropa, calzado y artículos de segunda mano. Solicita crédito para compra de artículos varios para vender en su negocio. Ella obtiene un segundo ingreso aparte del salario de su esposo para ayudar a la economía del hogar. Como toda mama el sueño de trinidad es que sus hijos sean responsables que lleguen a ser alguien en la vida y sobre todo que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
María Trinidad has a permit to sell in the public thoroughfares.  She’s married and has two children currently studying.

Trinidad sells clothes, footwear and second-hand merchandise.  She’s asking for a loan to buy the various items she sells in her business.  She earns an additional income besides her husband’s salary to help the family economy. 

Like all mothers Trinidad’s dream is that her children are responsible and someday become upstanding citizens and above all that they complete their schooling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is married and has two children who are not yet enrolled in school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Food is his greatest monthly expense.

For the last 6 years, Nicholas has been selling charcoal to neighbors and people on transit. He sells fuel as his side business. Nicholas plans to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal. He dreams of owning a rental house in the future. Nicholas joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 5 years, she has operated a business selling native bags in the Philippines. Bernadeth has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more native bags to sell to customers. In the future, Bernadeth would like to build and expand her business to support her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more native bags to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Doña Lourdes es una clienta de 54 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Muy trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Ella se dedica a su actividad sin descuidar a la familia. Tiene años de trabajar en la confección de cortinas, set de baños, sobrecamas, cortinas y mas. Además de coser a la medida. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia en las deceisiones del negocio. Su meta es superarse cada día más, debido a ésto solicita otro préstamo para comprar materia prima y ofrecer a sus clientes más variedad de mercadería.
texts.en: Lourdes is 54 years old, married and the mother of two children.  She is very hard working and has a very enterprising vision.  She runs her business without neglecting her family.  She has been manufacturing curtains, bathrooms sets, bedspreads, and more for two years, aside from making things to measure.  Her family is very supportive about her business decisions.  Her goal is to succeed more each day, so she is asking for another loan in order to buy supplies so that she can offer a greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Erika Monserrate

texts.es: Erika empezó su negocio de venta de bisutería gracias a su mamá a quien acompañaba en sus ventas. Le gusto mucho las ventas y con los años fue ganando destreza y experiencia. Ahora a sus 19 años se siente preparada para dar otro paso más en su vida, ser independiente. Su negocio está ubicado en el centro de Manta donde alquila un pequeño local. Lo atiende ella junto a una persona contratada para que la ayude, abre desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Se siente muy feliz ya que a su edad a logrado un éxito personal que lo tiene muy satisfecha. Erika nos cuenta que de momento está soltera y tiene una niña de 2 añitos. El bebe se lo cuida su mama cuando se encuentra trabajando. Con el crédito comprara bisutería para la venta esperando incrementar sus ventas. Su gran sueño es tener su propia casa para dejar de vivir donde sus padres y así sentirse más tranquila junto a su hijo.
texts.en:
Erika started her business selling costume jewelry thanks to her mother, whom she accompanied when she was selling. She really liked sales, and as the years went by, she gained skill and experience. Now, at 19, she feels ready to take another step in her life: to be independent.
