This will increase the taxi's efficiency and enable Doaa's husband to work extra hours in order to improve the family's income and to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to repair the taxi and replace the motor.

loans.name: Jose Evelio

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre y su compañera se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, con la cual procreó  2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad y vive en la Ciudad de Villanueva, Cortes.
Don José tiene un negocio de un taller de Ebanistería, lo estableció hace 6 años con la idea de superarse y generar sus propios ingresos. El servicio que ofrece son acabados de madera como mesas, divisiones, puertas y closet. Esta satisfecho porque los ingresos que le genera  este negocio es rentable y sabido administrarlo muy bien. Trabaja todo el día haciendo los muebles para la venta.  
En ODEF solicito su primer préstamo de 6,000 lempiras, que le ayudara para comprar madera para seguir haciendo sus productos y seguir generando ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Su plan en el futuro es trabajar mucho para que su taller sea más grande y así poder contratar personal  para la fabricación de los muebles.
texts.en:
José is 38 years and in a common-law relationship with his companion who is a devoted homemaker. They have two children, ages 6 and 2, and live in city of Villanueva, Cortes.

Don José has a furniture-making business and workshop. He came up with this idea six years ago because wanted to succeed and generate his own income. The service he offers includes making finished wooden pieces such as tables, room dividers, doors, and closets. He is satisfied because the revenues that his business generates are profitable and managed very well. José works every day at making furniture to sell.

He is requesting his first loan from ODEF in the amount of 6,000 HNL, which will help him to buy wood for making his products. This will continue generating the income he needs to sustain his family. His plans for the future are to work hard so that he can have a larger shop and to hire employees for making the furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casado,  vive con sus dos hijos y el esposa  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar almacigo de café y los insumos correspondientes  como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella tiene pensado comprar el almacigo para su posterior siembra en un terreno de la familia y con los  insumos poder darle el mantenimiento adecuado  y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Maritza is 50 years old, married, and lives with her children and husband. She will use the loan to buy coffee seeds and corresponding materials such as fertilizer, fumigation, and labor. She plans on buying the seeds to sew for this season on the family’s land and use her materials to maintain the crop to increase profits and gain a better quality life and financial stability. This will be her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She has never had a loan in a state bank but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with more ease and much lower interest.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds and corresponding materials such as fertilizer, fumigation, and labor

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Bon's Group

texts.en: Bon, 42, is a widowed mother of two who are still in school. To feed the family, she has been farming rice and growing cassava for nearly 20 years. A main challenge for her is when the price of cassava drops. Bon and her current group members have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and now they are applying for the third loan. As a leader, Bon is planning to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy and cassava plantation. She really hopes this loan will help to increase her crop yield so that she can sell the products when the price is high and therefore have sufficient money to support the family and set aside some money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Luz Marleni

texts.es:
Luz tiene 57 años de edad, pero se considera una joven de 20 en espíritu, es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero a quienes ha sacado adelante sola ya que el padre de sus hijos la abandono y tuvo que convertirse en padre y madre para ellos, pero gracias a ello sus hijos la miran con mucho orgullo y la quieren mucho ya que fue muy valiente. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, así como también se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón. Cuando Luz tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, en especial sus novelas, asimismo le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres, ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Con mucho entusiasmo Luz trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 4 horas al día y puede atender hasta 6 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad  a precios cómodos.

Luz está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como Chompas, casacas, pantalones, buzos, entre otros; así de esta manera ella podrá ofrecer más productos para sus clientes y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una buena calidad de vida y crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old, but considers having a 20 year old’s spirit. She is a mother of 3 who are grown up. She took it upon herself to raise her children since her husband abandoned them when they were young. She had to take the roll of mother and father and now her children admire her for her efforts and love her for being so brave. She lives in the district of Parcona which is characterized as having a warm and hot climate. It is also known for its agriculture specifically cotton cultivation. During her free time Luz likes to watch television, especially soap operas, and indulges in her favorite dish which is “Rice with Chicken.” Since her parents lacked the funds she only studied until high school but would have liked to attend a university.

Luz works enthusiastically every day selling clothes for a living. She works around 4 hours a day and can attend up to 6 clients in one day. She believes her business is going well because she is friendly to the clients and offers quality products and reasonable prices.

Luz is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because through them she will be able to buy merchandise such as sweaters, jackets, pants, shirts, among others. This will allow her to offer her clients more variety and increase profits. She will work hard everyday to make her biggest dream a reality: “Have a good quality of life and grow her business.”

loans.use: buy merchandise such as sweaters, jackets,  pants, shirts, among others

loans.name: Carmen Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que les brinda la institución. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron, los que viven con ella tienen 18 y 13 años de edad y estudian en  colegio. Su esposo es artesano.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual es artesano y tiene un taller en su casa donde realiza una gran variedad de figuras hechas en resina y cerámica, nos cuenta que el elabora llaveros, escapularios, pendientes, entre otras muchas figuras, él realiza estos trabajos a base de pedidos que le hacen comerciantes que luego los llevan  a otras ciudades donde son muy apreciados sus trabajos. Nos cuenta nuestra amiga que su esposo lleva más de 17 años con este negocio y que le va muy bien.

Nuestra amiga está repitiendo el crédito el mismo que como siempre es para comprar resinas colombianas y estuches para el negocio del esposo, nos cuenta que le fue más o menos en esta temporada que paso lo malo fue que su computadora se les daño pero que gracias a las ganancias y los créditos pudieron comprar otra y seguir en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es  arreglar una parte de la casa que aún le falta por terminar.
texts.en:
The Community Bank María Auxiliadora meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the region of Montecristi and the village of Manabita, a community that is full or hardworking people who are dedicated to and proud of their roots and heritage. Sequita is a parish with honest citizens who work hard and are dedicated to their families.

Carmen is a founding member of the Community Bank, and likes being a part of the bank because of the benefits the members receive. She is 43 years old, and is married. She had four children, but two of them passed away, and her living children are now 18 and 13 years old and are in high school. Her husband is an artisan craftsman.

She is requesting this loan for her husband, who is an artisan craftsman and who has a workshop in his home where he makes a wide variety of ceramic and resin figurines. He also makes key chains, scapulars, pendants, and many other figures. He makes items in response to customer orders, and because customers then transport the items to other cities, his work is widely known. Carmen explains that her husband has worked in this business for more than 17 years, and that he is doing very well in his trade.

Carmen is requesting another loan for the same purposes, to purchase Colombian resin and cases for her husband’s business. In the past year their computer broke, but thanks to her previous loan they were able to buy another one and continue their business.
 
Her dream is to finish building a part of their house which is still unfinished.

loans.use: to buy Colombian resin and cases.

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Del Ejido Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Golondrinas” está conformado por ocho mujeres que se dedican al campo son mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables el nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellas comentan que el nombre de Golondrinas se les ocurrió por los pajaritos quien hay en su comunidad y ejido por el lugar donde viven.
Doña María del Socorro pero como la llaman Mari de cariño y quien es la representante del grupo nos cuenta que tiene 37 años  de edad está casada con el señor benjamín desde hace 13 años juntos han formado una familia con 3 niños dos de ellos van a la escuela
Mary se dedica a la crianza de borregos desde hace dos años la actividad la inicio ya que la idea se la dio su cuñada por el momento tiene dos borregos que cuida mucho ya que todas las mañana se levanta a darles de comer pastura, zacate o maíz molido lo que tenga cuando ve que ya  están muy sucios los limpia, también les ofrece agua cuando es muy necesario.
Esta vez esta solicitando el crédito para comparar mas borregos si le alcanza comprara dos y su alimento necesario lo que más le gusta  a Mari es cuando sus borregas le dan borreguitos bebes ya que tiene una borreguita que apenas dio una cría y Mary la recibió con mucho gusto y emoción mientras Mari nos contaba sus experiencia con los borreguitos en manera de chascarrillo dijo “Y lo que menos me gusta es que lloran mucho y no sé porque quizás porque está muy consentida y sabe que se le dará todo lo que pide” también nos cuenta que su dificultad es cuando sus borregos enferman y mueren y casi todas las integrantes del grupo coinciden  también otra dificultad de Mary es que el lugar donde tiene sus borregas es un espacio muy pequeño.
La meta de Mary es que sus hijos terminen una carrera aunque sea corta pero que tengan un trabajo seguro ya que quiere que la calidad de vida de su familia mejore.
Las integrantes de grupo son Elena invertirá en cerdos y pollos, Lura comprara pastura para borregos,  Carmen para comprar cerdos, Candelaria comprara pollos y cerdos, Maribel comprara pollos, Victorina comprara Cerdos y Guajolotes y finalmente Cristina comprara borregos ellas son integrantes del grupo Las Golondrinas del Ejido están sinceramente agradecidas con el crédito otorgado que FRAC y KIVA les dan.
texts.en:
The group “Las Golondrinas”  is made up of 8 hardworking and responsible women who work in the fields.  They say that they chose this name (The Swallows) because these small birds are found in the community and ejido (communal farming lands) where they live.  Maria del Socorro (who is affectionately called Mari) is the representative of this group.  She tells us that she is 37 years old and has been married to Benjamin for 13 years.  They have formed a family with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. 

Mari has had a business raising sheep for 2 years.  She started this business because of an idea given to her by her sister-in-law.  She currently has 2 sheep that she cares for very well.  Every morning she gets up and gives them hay, pasture grass or ground corn.  When she sees that they are very dirty she washes them, and she also provides them with water when needed.  

This time she is requesting a loan to buy more sheep.  She would like to buy two, and the food to feed them.  What Mari enjoys the most about this work is when her sheep have babies, because she has a sheep that just had a baby and Mari received it with a lot of excitement and pleasure.  Meanwhile, Mari told us about her experience with the baby sheep in a joking manner, saying, "What I like the least is when they cry a lot and I don't know why.  Perhaps it's because they are very spoiled and so they know that I will give them anything they ask for."  She also tells us that it she finds it difficult when her sheep get sick and die, and almost all of the group members agree.  Also, another difficulty that Mari faces is that the place where she has her sheep is a very small space.  Mari's goal is to have her children finish a course of study, even a short one, so that they can have a secure job, because she wants her family's quality of life to improve.  

The members of this group are: Elena, who will invest in pigs and chickens, Lura, who will buy pasture grass for sheep, Carmen, who will buy pigs, Candelaria, who will buy chickens and pigs, Maribel, who will buy chickens, Victorina, who will buy pigs and turkeys, and finally, Cristina, who will buy sheep.  The members of the group "Las Golondrinas del Ejido," are sincerely grateful for this loan that is being granted to them by FRAC and by Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sheep and pasture grass

location.town: San Pedro El Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Martha Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 14, 9, 7, 4  y 1 año, la mayor estudia en colegio y vive con los abuelos ya que es de otro compromiso que tuvo, los dos siguientes estudian en la escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Nuestra amiga  tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en el cual  vende empanadas, alas de pollo asadas, corviches, aguas, sodas, jugos, entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que ella en la mañana prepara algunos de sus productos para  vender en la tarde,  ella además también cría pollos y chanchos ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente en su casa para aquello, esta también es una pequeña pero fuente de ingresos que tiene para salir adelante. Lleva más de 3 años en esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Nuestra amiga está repitiendo y nos cuenta que a pesar de que la temporada no fue del todo buena igual le quedo ganancias las mismas que utilizo para gastos relacionados con los estudios de sus hijos, ahora espera realizar otro crédito el mismo que va a utilizar para comprar pollos y alimento para estos ya que esta temporada es muy buena con la venta de sus animalitos. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su vida.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The community bank "Maria Auxiliadora" meets in the Sequita parish, which is a part of Montecristo, in the rural community of Manabita. This community is full of hard working, dedicated people who are proud of where they come from. The people of Sequita are honest and know how to work hard and dedicate themselves to their families. 

Martha is from this community. She is 37 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has five children: 14, 9, 7,4 and 1 years old. The oldest child is studying in an institute and lives with her grandparents, which is another commitment she has made. The second and third oldest children are also studying. Her husband is a businessman.  

Our friend has a small business in her house, from which she sells empanadas (a filled pastry), corviches (sweet plantain dough stuffed with spicy seafood and then baked or fried), grilled chicken wings, sodas, juices and other things. She told us that in the mornings she prepares some of her products which she sells in the afternoons. She also raises chickens and pigs, because she has room to do so near her house. This also is a small source of income which helps her to get ahead. She has been doing this for the past three years and she is doing very well.   

Our friend told us that even though the season was not completely good, she was still left with profits, which she used to pay expenses related to the her children's education. Now she would like to take out another loan to use to buy chickens and food for the chickens. Right now is a high season for the sale of her animals. She has been a member of the communal bank for 8 years; she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot in her life. 

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken food.

loans.name: Victoria Ana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Victoria, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una  hija, la cual es mayor de edad pero que aun vive en su casa y estudia Ing. Civil en una Universidad de Portoviejo. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.
 
Nuestra amiga trabaja en una guardería en la localidad, pero además de eso también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su lugar de trabajo, su hija por su parte también le ayuda con sus ventas ya que ella les vende a sus compañeros de clase y también cuando sale con ella a recorrer la ciudad. Trabaja todos los días ya que tiene sus dos actividades, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Portoviejo o en  Guayaquil cuando ella pueda viajar a esta ciudad. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde sus inicios y  le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es ver que su hija termine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in Sequita Parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who know only work and dedication to family.

This is where we meet Victoria, age 46.  She is married, and they have one daughter.  Her daughter is an adult, but she still lives in Victoria’s house.  Her daughter is studying Civil Engineering at a university in Portoviejo.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Our friend works at a daycare in the area.  However, she also works selling all types of clothes.  She sells door-to-door, and she also sells at the place where she works.  Her daughter also helps her with her sales because she sells to her fellow students, and she goes with Victoria when she travels the city.

Victoria works every day because she has two business activities.  She gives credit to her customers, and she collects every eight days.  She goes to buy her merchandise in Portoviejo, or she goes to Guayaquil when she is able to travel to that city.  She has over ten years of experience at this business activity, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.  She has been in her communal bank almost from the beginning.  She likes it because she used one of the loans to start her business.

Her dream is to see her daughter finish her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase thread for embroidery.

loans.name: El Girasol 2 Group

texts.es:
Celia tiene 52 años y es originaria de Huemuchapa municipio de Tecoanapa, guerrero. Ella es casada felizmente con Saulo y el también es comerciante se ayudan entre si  por el trabajo que tienen, tienen Levid tiene 12 años cursa 6° de le primaria, Levi cursa 2° del bachiller.  

Celia se dedica a la venta de fríjol y Chiles verdes por la temporada que es en marzo y abril hasta mayo y después igual por su temporada vende Mandarina y Jicama, Celia al igual que su esposo tienen 32 años en su negocio lo cual piensan invertir su próximo préstamo en mas mercancía según la temporada como Elotes, Plátanos etc. Para poder poner un negocio estable, ya puede ser en un local o en su propia casa y evitar los pasajes, ya que les afecta no mucho pero si, en sus ganancias.
Celia es integrante del grupo Girasol 2 lo cual esta formado por 12 integrantes con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante por su familia quienes son: Celia, Edilberto, Olibia, M Rosa, Alfa, Apolonia, Rufina, Nayeli, Justina, Gilberto, Quirina, Oguida y se dedican ala venta de: Maíz, Pescados frescos y secos, Fríjol, Verduras y  Pollos
texts.en:
Celia, 52, is from the town of Huemuchapa in Tecoanapa, Guerrero.  She is happily married to Saulo who is also a merchant, and they help each in their work.  They have two children, Levid, 12, who is in 6th grade, and Levi, who is a sophomore in high school.

Celica sells beans and green chili peppers during the March, April, May season, and later in the year she sells tangerines and yam beans.  Celia and her husband have been in business for 32 years.  They plan to use the loan to buy more goods depending on the season, such as corn, bananas, etc., so they can establish a stable business, either in a shop or at home, to save on transportation, which affects their profits.

Celia is a member of the communal bank "Girasol "" which is comprised of 12 members who want to work and get ahead for their families.  The members are Celia, Edilberto, Olibia, M Rosa, Alfa, Apolonia, Rufina, Nayeli, Justina, Gilberto, Quirina, and Oguida, and they sell: corn, fresh and dried fish, beans, vegetables and chickens.

loans.use: To buy goods such as corn, bananas, yam beans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a workshop

loans.name: Olaya Georgina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Olaya, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos de 23, 19 y 17 años de edad, el menor de ellos estudia en colegio  y es el quien aun vive en su casa.
 
Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda en su casa, allí  vende toda clase de víveres, pero también vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), productos que vende en su casa y también sale a recorrer,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, su  hijo le ayuda en su negocio cuando está desocupado y en los momentos que ella sale a vender y cobrar sus productos ya que ella deja a crédito y cobra por semanas,  lleva más de 2 años con su tienda y con sus productos de Yanbal mucho más tiempo, es así que ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres y cosméticos de Yanbal para surtir su negocio. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, está en la directiva del mismo y le gusta porque el grupo es muy ordenado y cumplido.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank "María Auxiliadora" meets in La Sequita parish, which is in the Montecristi region and the canton of Manabita.  This is a place full of hardworking people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are honest people who are dedicated to their work and their families.  

Here we meet Olaya, who is 40 years old.  She is the single mother of three children, aged 23, 19 and 17.  The youngest of these attends school, and he still lives in her house.

Our friend Olaya has a store in her house where she sells all types of groceries.  She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories) from her house, and she takes her products out around to sell.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm.  Her son helps her with the business when he's not busy, and in those times when she goes out to sell and to collect.  She sells her products on credit, and collects on a weekly basis.  She has had this store for more than 2 years, and she's been selling Yanbal products for much longer.  In this way, she has been able to get ahead with her children.

She will use this loan to buy groceries and Yanbal cosmetics to stock her store.  She has been with her communal bank from the start, and she is on the board.  She likes it because the group is very organized and accomplished.

Her dream is to continue to move ahead.

loans.use: to buy groceries and Yanbal cosmetics

loans.name: Aneela's Group

texts.en:
Aneela has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business who is involved in brick sales. He purchases bricks from different dealers and sells to the required customers. He is well-known for his business. He has been in this business for over 8 years. With the loan investment, he will buy bricks in larger quantity for reselling. 

Aneela herself is a very creative and talented lady. She not only gives required time to her household works, but also manages her sewing business very well. From the earnings, she runs the financial expenses with her husband. 

Aneela hopes that with this investment, her husband’s business will continue to prosper so that he can offer an even better service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy bricks for selling

loans.name: Elena Nelly

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Elena, tiene 61 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 7 hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven con ella los mismos que junto a su esposo trabajan en el campo.

Nuestra amiga tiene una pequeña granja de pollos en su casa, compra por cajas los pollos cuando están pequeños y los cría por tres meses, luego los vende en pie o por libras a los vecinos o entrega a las tiendas de la localidad, dice que sus pollos se venden mucho ya que los cría con maíz por lo cual su carne es  parecida al pollo criollo. Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas por día. Su esposo también tiene sembríos de maíz y maní lo cual está en plena recolección.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más pollos, alimentos para estos y para pagar mano de obra para la recolección de la cosecha. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener una granja grande y con tecnología.
texts.en:
The “Mary the Helper” Communal Bank meets in La Sequita parish, Manabita Canton, which is part of Montecristi. The canton is full of hard-working dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish with gentle, honest inhabitants who only know how to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

Elena, 61 years old, lives there in a free union which has produced 7 children, all adults now; and 3 still live with her and work alongside her husband in the countryside.

Our friend Elena operates a small chicken farm at her house. She buys cartons of young baby chicks and raises them for 3 months, then sells them on foot or by the pound to neighbors, or delivers them to local stores. Elena says her chickens sell well, because she raises them on corn, which makes their meat similar to that of creole chickens.  Elena works every day for 2 or 3 hours. Her husband also has farm plots planted in corn and peanuts, which are now being harvested.

This loan will be used to buy more chickens and feed for them, and to pay workers for harvesting the crop. Elena is a founding member of this communal bank and she likes it for the help it offers with the loans. 

Elena's dream is to have a large farm with modern technology.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Las Florecitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Florecitas está conformado por la señora Rosalia va a comprar con su préstamo verduras, carnes, chiles, ajonjolí, almendras, ajos, semillas, la señora Rosa va a comprar zapatos de dama,  caballero y niños, compra de maíz, carne, chiles, manteca, queso, requeson, la señora Maria va a comprar huevo, papel higiénico, aceite, azucar, jabon, refresco, la señora Alberta va a comprar maíz,  la señora Clara va a comprar productos nutricionales por paquete. La señora Maria tiene 76 años de edad, ella es viuda, ella tiene 5 hijos 4 mujeres y un varón todos mayores de edad ya casados. Ella solicito su préstamo para comprar refrescos, huevo, cloro, aceite, café, norzuiza, sopas, azúcar etc. parra surtir su tienda de abarrotes, ella inicio su negocio hace 30 años la necesidad la hiso que iniciara su negocio tenía que mantener a sus hijos, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para la comida, a ella le gusta trabajar a así tiene ingresos del diario, ella utiliza las ganancias para pagar la luz que le llega muy cara. Sus sueños y esperanza son que Dios le permita vivir para seguir trabajando y que sus hijos estén bien lo mejor para ellos, que vivan contentos como hermanos. Ella esto feliz con el préstamo que va a recibir va a surtir su tienda  ya que en ella sus clientes encuentran de todo cominos, clavos, pimienta, carbonato, ajos, chiles, tomates, cebolla y mucho mas y así ofrece a sus mejor servicio.  Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias que nos están ayudando con sus préstamos, nos cobran menos interés y que nos sigan apoyado con sus préstamos para salir adelante con los negocios y con las familias”.
texts.en:
This mutually supportive group, called Las Florecitas (The Little Flowers), is made up of: 
Señora Rosalia, who will use the loan to buy vegetables, meats, chillies, sesame, almonds, garlic, and seed.
Señora Rosa, who will buy shoes for women, men and children, and to buy corn, meat, chillies, lard, cheese, and ricotta.
Señora Maria, who will buy eggs, toilet paper, oil, sugar, ham, and soda.
Señora Alberta, who will buy corn.
Señora Clara, who will buy packages of nutritional products.

Señora Maria is 76 years old, is widowed, and has five children; four women and one man, all of whom are adults and already married.  She asks for the loan to buy sodas, eggs, bleach, oil, coffee, bouillon, soups, sugar, etc. in order to stock up her grocery store.  She began her business 30 years ago.  The reason she needed to start the business was because she had to care for her children.  Her business is important because she has income for food.  She likes to work so that she has daily income; she uses the earnings to pay for lighting which is very expensive.  Her dreams and hopes are that God allows her to live to continue working and that her children are well, do what is best for them, and live happily like brothers.  She is happy with the loan that she is going to receive to stock up her store so that her customers can find cumin, clove, pepper, bicarbonate, garlic, chillies, tomatoes, onions, and a lot more - thus offering them better service.  

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "we thank you for helping us with the loans, charging us little interest, and continuing to support us with the loans in order to get ahead with the businesses and with our families".

loans.use: to buy soda, eggs, bleach, oil, coffee, bouillon, soups, sugar, bread, ham, chocolate, firewood, corn, etc.

loans.name: Marilú Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marilú, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya  mayores de edad y uno de 11 años que estudia en colegio y es el que  aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda en su casa, nos cuenta que con esto ella puede ayudar en algo en los gastos del hogar y también para los estudios de su hijo, su negocio aunque es pequeño lo tiene bien surtido de víveres, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00, dice que le gusta su negocio ya que allí se entretiene y a la vez se gana algo para el bienestar de su familia. Ella lleva más de 5 años y poco a poco con la ayuda de los créditos lo ha ido aumentando.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, aceites  entre otros víveres para surtir su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 5  años y le gusta porque gracias a la ayuda de los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su meta es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The Community Bank María Auxiliadora meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the city of Montecristi and the village of Manabita, a community that is full or hardworking people who are dedicated to and proud of their roots and heritage. Sequita is a parish of honest people who work hard and are dedicated to their families.

Marilú is 41 years old and is married with four children, three of whom are grown and the youngest of whom is 11 years old. Their youngest child is in high school and still lives with his parents. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

Marilú operates a store from her home, and this business allows her to help out with household expenses and with their son’s school expenses. Her business is small, but is well stocked with food items. She works every day from 6:00 am until 6:00 pm, and likes having her own business, since it keeps her busy and entertained, and also helps her generate income for the benefit of her family. She has been working at her store for more than five years, and little by little, with help from loans, she has grown her business.

She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase rice, sugar, oil and other food items to stock her business. She has been a member of the Community Bank for more than five years, and she enjoys being a member. Thanks to the support from the loans, she was able to start and maintain her business.

Her goal is to provide everything she can for her son.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil and other food products.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a mother of four children and is married to her husband Ngome. All of her children are enrolled in school. For the past year, she has been operating a café and selling to the neighborhood and passersby. She aims at expanding this business and venturing into outside catering in the future.

Mlongo owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes high market competition to be her major challenge. She spends more on food and school fees over the month.

The requested loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) will be used to purchase rice, beans, and wheat flour, and to repair the premises,

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, and wheat flour, and repair the premises.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 41 years old and lives in Sebac, Tudela. She is married with 3 children. 

Josephine has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 6 years. Josephine requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Josephine hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is from the village of Disimuray. He is 47 years old, married, and has four children. To make a living,  Rolando owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for 15 years and earns approximately 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every crop season. Now, Rolando is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 30-year-old married woman who has 5 school-going children. She has rented a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the past 4 years, she has been selling charcoal from home, selling to the neighbors and passersby. Mariam’s goal is to open a charcoal depot in the future. High transport cost to her place of operation poses a challenge to her. She depends only on this business for her livelihood. She has requested a loan of 25,000 KES to add stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to add stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Concepcion, se caracteriza por ser una persona amable, cordial  y sobre todo muy humilde.
Es originaria de una ciudad de Oaxaca donde hay un río llamado Río Verde en los limites con un pueblo  vecino llamado San Pedro Tututepec.
Doña Concepcion tiene treinta y siete años de edad, está felizmente casada con el señor Crecenciano con quien tiene tres hijos Luis Felipe, Daniela y Ana Karen.
Dice que se dedica a la venta de refacciones automotrices desde hace  un año seis meses y cuenta con un local en  la colonia centro de su comunidad donde empezó vendiendo accesorios para carros y con las ganancias obtenidas fue que decidió vender refacciones ya que sus clientes se lo recomendaban.
Su esposo le ayuda en la refaccionaria los fines de semana ya que atiende su taller de hojalatería y pintura.
Uno de los sueños que tenia sin cumplir es tener su local propio ya que donde tiene su refaccionaria es rentado pero el crédito le va ayudar a poner una cortina en el local que su esposo construyó donde tiene su taller de hojalatería.
Una de las cosas lindas de su trabajo es que con el tiempo ha podido aprender qué es lo que llevan los carros y sobre todo cómo ayudar a sus clientes cuando tienen duda acerca de las piezas que necesitan.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más refacciones y para comprar una cortina para su local.
Le da las gracias a Vision Fund por ayudarla a que sus sueños se cumplan y no se queden truncados.
texts.en:
Concepcion is known for being friendly, warm, and most of all, modest. She is originally from a town in Oaxaca where the Rio Verde divides her town and the neighboring San Pedro Tututepec. Concepcion is 37 years old and is happily married to Crecenciano and they have three children together; Luis Felipe, Daniela and Ana Karen. 
She tells us that she has been selling automotive spare parts for about a year and a half now and she has a small site in the colonial center in her community where she began selling car accessories and with the earnings she decided to sell spare parts because her customers recommended it. 
Her husband helps her on weekends because he otherwise tends to his body work and paint shop. 
One of her dreams she hopes to achieve is to have her own store because where she currently sells her automotive parts is rented, but the credit will help her put up a curtain in the store her husband has made where he has his workshop.
One of the beautiful things about her work is that she has been able to learn about cars and their parts and also how to help her customers when they are unsure of what parts they need. She is asking for a loan to purchase more automotive parts and to purchase a curtain for her store. She thanks Vision Fund for helping her fulfill her dreams that would otherwise be cut short.

loans.use: purchase more automotive parts and to purchase a curtain for her store

loans.name: La Buchicata Group

texts.es:
En este grupo se integró una nueva persona es la señora Gladis Alicia quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
La representante de este grupo es la señora María de la Paz, una señora alegre amable, trabajadora y sobre todo muy  humilde.
Doña Mari como mejor la conocen nos dice que se dedica a la venta de pan, queso, carne enchilada, pollo destazado y huevos de granja desde hace diez años. Nos dice que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es atender a las personas y regalarles una sonrisa y alegrarles la vida. Doña Mari cuenta que anteriormente vendía mercancía de abarrotes pero por cuestiones de salud tuvo que salir de la ciudad y cerró su tienda de abarrotes, pero cuando regreso empezó a vender  huevos, carne enchilada y queso; con las ganancias compró pollo para la venta. Ella vende los pollos en su casa: saca una mesa en el corredor y se sienta a vender.
Pidió el crédito para la compra de más pollos para la venta ya que considera que es un buen negocio, también lo va invertir para la compra de mercancía de abarrotes ya que desea abrir su tienda una vez más.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les da a todas las mujeres trabajadoras y humildes.
texts.en:
Gladis Alicia, who makes a living selling food, is a new person who became part of this group.

This group's representative is María de la Paz, a happy, nice, hardworking, and above all, very humble, woman. Ms. Mari, as she is better known, tells us that she has been making a living selling bread, cheese, meat enchiladas, butchered chicken, and farm eggs for ten years. She tells us that what she likes most about her business is attending to people and giving them the gift of a smile to make their lives happier. Ms. Mari says that formerly she used to sell grocery merchandise but for health reasons had to leave the city and close her grocery shop. When she returned she began to sell eggs, meat enchiladas, and cheese. With her earnings she bought a chicken to sell. She sells chicken in her home: she takes a table out in the corridor and sits down to sell.

She asked for a loan to buy more chicken to sell since she considers it to be a good business. Also, she's going to invest it in the purchase of grocery merchandise since she would like to open her store again.

She is thankful for the foundation for the support they give to all the hardworking, humble women.

loans.use: to buy chicken and grocery merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Sini Titi San Andrés Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Sini Titi San Andrés, está conformado por ocho personas indígenas, originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado San Andrés Huaxpaltepec, Oaxaca, es un pueblo lleno de danzas y tradiciones. Una de las danzas típicas es la de las mascaritas, que se baila en carnaval, acompañada de orquesta y recrea algunos aspectos de la vida de nuestros pueblos.

El señor Damián de treinta y cuatro años de edad es el representante del grupo, él se dedica a la venta de hierbas curativas, también cura a las personas de espanto, fiebre y a los niños los cura de coraje. Las personas de pueblos vecinos y de la comunidad van a su casa para recibir su ayuda limipiándolos con albahaca y huevos. También lleva vendiendo hierbas curativas desde hace quince años, y su mamá fue quien le enseñó todo sobre esta práctica ya que ella quedó viuda y a través de dicha actividad los mantenía a él y a sus hermanos.
Damián menciona que con la ayuda de Vision Fund ha podido seguir con su negocio, y él se siente satisfecho ya que con su trabajo cura a las personas para que se sientan sanos. Con la ayuda del préstamo va a comprar más hierbas curativas para su venta.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Teofila- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Yesenia- se dedica a la venta de bisutería.
Bianca-se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Nelida- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Margarita- se dedica a la venta de hierbas curativas.
Maria- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Vianney- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.

Todos ellos le dan las gracias a Kiva y Vision Fund por ayudar a las personas trabajadoras que desean sobresalir y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
This group is called Sini Titi San Andrés and is made up of eight indigenous people who are from a small town named San Andrés Huaxpaltepec, Oaxaca.  It is a town full of dances and traditions.  One of the typical dances is "las mascaritas" (the little masks), which they dance during the carnival, accompanied by the orchestra and it portrays some aspects of the life in their small towns.  

Damián, who is thirty four years old, is the group's representative.  He works selling medicinal herbs and he also cures people of fever, "espanto" (a sickness brought on by a great fright), and he cures children of anxiety.  People from neighboring towns and from the community go to his home to receive his care and he cleans them with basil and eggs.  He also has sold medicinal herbs for fifteen years.  His mother was the one who taught him everything about this practice since she became a widow and it was through this means that she provided for him and his brothers.

Damián mentions that with the help of Vision Fund, he has been able to continue his business and he feels satisfied since with his work, he cures people so that they feel healthy.  With the help of the loan, he's going to buy more medicinal herbs for his sale. 

The other group members are:
Teofila - sells Mexican snacks
Yesenia - sells jewelry
Bianca - sells clothing
Nelida- sells Mexican snacks
Margarita - sells medicinal herbs
Maria - sells Mexican snacks
Vianney- sells Mexican snacks

All of them give thanks to Kiva and Vision Fund for helping hard-working people who want to succeed and achieve their goals.

loans.use: to purchase medicinal herbs to sell.

loans.name: Las Margaritas 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Domitila es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, cuenta con 49 años de edad está casada con el señor Gregorio que es albañil y se dedica al campo también, tiene 3 hijos Never tiene 25 años y Gregorio tiene 20 años ellos dos le ayudan a su papá y su hija Adilene tiene 22 y ella le ayuda a su mamá ninguno estudia.
Domitila es comerciante y se dedica a la venta del pan pues se los entregan cada tercer día en la semana que son los lunes, miércoles y viernes como no tienen un local por ejemplo para vender tienen que salirse a andar vendiendo por las casas pero aun así dice que si vende bien pues su hija se va por un lado y ella se va por otro ella cree que le va mejor así, que tener su propio horno para hacer el pan.
Domitila es integrante del grupo Las Margaritas 2 el cual está integrado por 12 mujeres muy trabajadoras que son capaces de salir adelante por sus familias, a continuación serán mencionadas y cada una de las actividades que realizan: Bertha vende ropa, Domitila vende pan, Marcela vende comida, Isabel vende perfumes, Magally vende pizza, Divina vende ropa, Monica vende comida, Eulalia vende tacos, Maximina vende refrescos, Herminia vende frutas y verduras, Maria de los Angeles vendes verduras, Ignacia vende perfumes.
texts.en:
Domitila is a responsible and hardworking person who is 49 years old and is married to Gregorio, who works in construction and also in agriculture.  They have 3 children. Never, 25, and Gregorio, 20, both help their father, and her daughter Adilene, 22, helps her mother.  None of them are in school.

Domitila is a trader and she works selling bread which she delivers every other day of the week: Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays.  As she doesn't have a store, in order to sell she has to go out selling door-to-door.  However, she says that if her sales are good, she goes out to sell in one part of town and her daughter sells in another.  She believes that she does better this way than if she had her own oven to make the bread.

Domitila is a member of the communal bank "Las Margaritas 2," which is made up of 12 very hardworking women who are capable of getting ahead for their families.  They are mentioned below, along with their type of business.  Bertha sells clothing, Domitila sells bread, Marcela sells food, Isabel sell perfumes, Magally sells pizza, Divina sells clothing, Monica sells food, Eulalia sells tacos, Maximina sells soft drinks, Herminia sells fruits and vegetables, Maria de los Angeles sells vegetables, and Ignacia sells perfumes.

loans.use: to buy bags, brown wrapping paper, baskets and other items

loans.name: Flor Mechoacan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Flor Mechoacan está conformado por dieciséis personas trabajadoras y humildes, originarios de Santa Catarina Mechoacan; una de las tradiciones de este pueblo es la fiesta patronal que se celebra el 24 de noviembre, fiesta de honor a Santa Catarina, con bailes, juegos pirotécnicos, misas y procesiones.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Patricia de veintiocho años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una señora amable trabajadora e indígena con deseos de superación. Dice que se dedica a la venta  tacos de cecina, chorizo y carne enchilada desde hace ocho años. Su taquería se encuentra en el sitio de taxis de su comunidad, obtuvo su negocio vendiendo tacos dorados en las calles, pero con sus ganancias pudo comprar  bancos y mesas,  y uno de sus hermanos le prestó su casa para poner el establecimiento y pudiera atender mejor a sus clientes.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Abel quien le ayuda a atender su taqueria, tiene dos hijos Abel Andrés de nueve años de edad y Fátima Yoselin de seis años de edad. Patricia abre su negocio a las cuatro de la tarde por que en las mañanas atiende a sus hijos y los lleva a la escuela; cierra su taquería a las nueve de la noche. Además también se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas. Pidió el crédito para la compra de más ingredientes para la elaboración de  tacos como es tortillas, carne de res, carne enchilada, chorizó, aceite y verduras. Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a todas las personas indígenas.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:

Crescencia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Rosa- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Concepcion- se dedica a la venta antojitos mexicanos.
Agustin Olivero –se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Catalina Sofia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Heliodora- se dedica a la venta  de servilletas.
Silvia – se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Luisa Clementina- se dedica a la venta de mercancía  de abarrotes.
Sinforosa Natalia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Hilda- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Margarita- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Mirna- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Felicita- se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Catalina- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Macrina- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les da a todas las mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
The group known as Flor Mechoacan is made up of 16 hardworking and humble people from the town of Santa Catarina Mechoacan. One of the traditions in this town is the festival of the patron saint which is celebrated on November 24th, in honor of Santa Catarina, with dances, games, fireworks, masses and processionals.

One of the members of the group is Patricia, 28, who is known as a friendly, hardworking woman of indigenous descent who wants to better herself. For 8 years she has been selling tacos made with cured meat, sausage, and chili meat. Her taqueria is at the taxi stand in her community. She started her business selling fried tacos in the street, but with her earnings she was able to buy benches and tables and one of her siblings lent her his house to put in a restaurant so she could better attend her customers. 

She is happily married to Abel who helps out at the taqueria. They have two children: Abel Andres, 9, and Fatima Yoselin, 6. Patricia opens her business at four in the afternoon because in the morning she takes care of her children and takes them to school. She closes the taqueria at 9pm. She also makes napkins. She asked for a loan to buy more ingredients for her tacos like tortillas, beef, ground beef, sausage, oil and vegetables. She thanks the foundation for helping out indigenous peoples. 

The other members of the group are:

Crescencia-  she sells Mexican snacks
Rosa- sells Mexican snacks
Concepcion- sells Mexican snacks
Agustin Olivero – sells Mexican snacks
Catalina Sofia- sells Mexican snacks
Heliodora- sells napkins
Silvia – sells napkins
Luisa Clementina- sells groceries
Sinforosa Natalia- sells Mexican snacks
Hilda- sells Mexican snacks
Margarita- sells Mexican snacks
Mirna- sells Mexican snacks
Felicita- sells napkins
Catalina- sells food
Macrina- sells Mexican snacks

They are grateful to the foundation for the support that it has given all of these hardworking women.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tacos.

loans.name: Mary Jakeline

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mary, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 9 y 8 años de edad, el mayor estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en la construcción.

Nuestra amiga para poder ayudar en algo a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y al ver que su marido no gana lo suficiente solicito uno de los créditos con el cual adecuo un pequeño local en su casa en el mismo que surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, la misma que recién la tiene por un año pero que a pesar de tener tan poco tiempo le da buenas ganancias y satisfacciones, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 o hasta más tarde si alguien necesita algo pues no se le hace problema atenderlos a cualquier hora.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, aceites  entre otros víveres para surtir su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 10  años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora ("Our Lady of Help") communal bank meets in Sequita parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province full of hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita's people are honest and know only how to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

In this place we meet Mary, 35 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has three children aged 8, 9, and 12. The oldest is in secondary school and the younger ones are in primary school. Her husband works in construction.

In order to help her husband in some way with the household expenses, and seeing that he did not earn enough, our friend applied for one of the loans. With it, she fitted out a small area in her house in which she stocked a small grocery store. She has had it for a year, but despite having had it for such a short time, it has given her good earnings and satisfaction. She works every day from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm or even later if someone needs something, since it isn't a problem for her to wait on them at any time.

She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, and oils, among other groceries, in order to stock her business. She has been in the communal bank for more than 10 years, and she likes it because of the help the loans provide.

Her goals are to continue moving forward with her business and her family life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and oils, among other groceries

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim was born in 1969. She lives in Trung Thon village, Dong Anh commune. She has two children. She and her husband are farmers. Not only growing rice, but also she goes to small business. She is the leader of 4-member group loan of SEDA. She has participated with SEDA since 2006 and always pays her loan punctually. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,014.000 Vietnamdong (VND). In this cycle, she would like to borrow 7,194.000 VND to buy fruits to sell.
 
About other borrowers in her group:
Tat is 41 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,450.000 VND to buy pigs.
Hanh is 42 years old. She has two children. She would like to borrow 6,758.000 VND to buy more iron scrap.
Dan is 59 years old. She would like to borrow 6,322.000 VND to buy iron scrap to resell.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Medea

texts.en:
Medea is 22 years old. She lives in a small village with her family: her husband Ramaz, who is busy with gardening; her 6-year-old son, who goes to the local school; and her parents. The family is busy with farming. They have a plot of land where strawberries are grown, and they have a cornfield. The family sells the harvested products in nearby villages.

Along with the agricultural business, Medea has her own small grocery store. She has various products in her store, such as sugar, macaroni, rice, and chocolate. She is a very hard-working woman and works hard during whole days for the welfare of her family. With the sales from her business, she covers household expenses, leaving a small profit which she invests in the store. The total average monthly income for the family is 750 Georgia Laris (GEL).

Medea requested a loan for purchasing stock for her store. She will diversify the products, attracting new customers and increasing sales. With this loan, the average income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her store.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is a widowed woman with two children, neither of whom is in school. She operates a meat goat business, which she has been running for one year now, selling at the market. She intends to purchase goats using the requested loan. Saumu owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her dream is to open a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu to get loans to boost her business. The loan of 25,000 KES will enable her to purchase more goats.

loans.use: To purchase more goats.

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
As a farmer, Khan and her family live in a village of Dambae district where common business is growing cassava. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for 20 years. Her family struggles when her children get sick and/or the price of cassava drops. Khan has been with VisionFund since 2011 and the first loan has helped her family by having enough food to eat. 

As a leader, Khan is now leading a group to apply for another loan after her first loan has been paid. She will use her portion to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her plantation. With this loan, she hopes to generate more income by selling her crops so that she can feed her family better.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is 32 years old. She lives with her husband, Vazha, and parents-in-law, both of them are pensioners. The family runs an agricultural business. They have two milking cows and 2 calves. Tea produces dairy food (cheese and curds) and sells it on the local open market. The family is also busy with farming. They have a vineyard on 1 hectare of land and a little plot of land where peaches are grown. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,200 Lari (GEL).

Tea requested a loan for cultivation of her agricultural land. Also, she plans to rent more hectares of land and sow various fruits and vegetables: beets, cabbage, carrots, and strawberries, Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to make more profit. With increased income, she will be able to improve living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To cultivate land and rent additional land

loans.name: Fanny Amarily

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Fanny tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, 4 son mayores de edad y el ultimo de 16 años el mismo que estudia en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa a pesar de que ya algunos están comprometidos. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda en su casa, allí  vende toda clase de víveres y además algunos remedios y tarjetas telefónicas ya que esto le da ganancias extra comenta, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, dice que tiene muchos clientes porque en su tienda se encuentra de toda clase de productos como: carne, queso, embutidos pescado, etc. sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando están desocupados. Ella lleva más de 15 años con su negocio el cual le ha dado muchos beneficios y con el cual ha logrado salir adelante junto a su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres, remedios, tarjetas telefónicas entre otras cosas para surtir su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su meta es agrandar aun más su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in the parish of La Sequita, which is in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita's people are honest and know only how to work and dedicate themselves to their families. 

Fanny is 44 years old, married, and she has five children from this relationship. Four of them are adults, and the youngest, who is 16, is going to school. All of her children still live at home, even though some of them are already engaged. Her husband is a merchant.

Our friend has a store at home, where she sells all kinds of groceries, as well as some remedies and phone cards, since these items bring in some extra income, she says. She works every day from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm. She says she has a lot of customers because they can find all sorts of products at her store, such as: meat, cheese, sausages, fish, etc. Her children help her out with the business when they're not busy. She has had her business for over 15 years, and it has shown a very good profit, which has allowed her to get ahead with her family.

She is going to use this loan to purchase groceries, remedies, phone cards, and other items to stock her business. She has been with the communal bank for eight years and she likes it because of the help she receives through the loans.
 
Her goal is to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, remedies, phone cards, etc.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito lives at his small house at Baculud with his wife and four children. His wife also helps him manage their hectare plot of land which they cultivate, plant and harvest rice on. They have been in the farming business for over 10 years and gain twice in a year for about 20,000 PHP during harvest season. He aspires to expand and improve his crop output so he is now borrowing a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor cost in farming. 

Someday, Tito would like to keep producing good harvest from the business to earn funds to be invested in buying piglets to raise and sell. This will be an additional source of income for the family. He hopes to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor cost in farming

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a rice grower at Iguig. He lives with his wife, Remedios. All her children lived separately from them. To make a living, the couple are both involved in raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell to traders. From their small business, he earns 15,000 PHP each harvest season. It falls twice in a year. 

He is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy pesticides and fertilizers for crop maintenance. Ensuring proper nutrition of crops will lead to an abundant yield upon harvest. With good harvest, he will able to save funds to use in times of emergencies. He also hopes to achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for crop maintenance

loans.name: Alba  Marisol

texts.es:
ALBA  MARISOL tiene 21 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres y hermana en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar. 

ALBA  MARISOL el presta servicios profesionales. Solicita el crédtio para comprar duela, clavos, lija para madera, tabla triple. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar el arreglo que tanto deseaban hacerlo para poder estar más cómodos.

Las compras de los materiales a utilizarce se lo hará en la ciudad de Guaranda.

El sueño e spoder ponerce un negocio de venta al por mayor de sábanas, edredones, cortinas. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es lograr terminar el posgrado.

En el tiempo libre le gusta ayudar a vender los catálogos de ropa a la hermana.
texts.en:
Alba Marisol, 21, is single and has no children and lives with her parents and her sister in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.

Alba Marisol provides professional services. She’s asking for the loan to buy flooring, nails, sand paper for wood and plywood.  With help from the loan she will be able to do the home improvements they so want in order to be more comfortable.  She will buy the materials to be used in the city of Guaranda.  

Her dream is to be able to set up a business selling sheets, comforters and drapes at wholesale.  The challenge she faces is to complete her post-graduate degree.  In her free time she likes to help her sister sell clothes via catalogue.

loans.use: to buy flooring, nails, sand paper for wood and plywood.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo raises crops in his hectare rice field. He is now 47 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. He works hard in his rice field just to maintain good harvests during harvest season. He has insufficient funds now, so he is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides for crop maintenance. He hopes this loan will be given to him as a way of ensuring good crop production. He promises to pay it back in full. 

Someday, with enough farm inputs applied to the crops, he will attain good harvest and acquire good profits from it. This will also help continuously pay his childrens' matriculation fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Marapat

texts.ru:
Марапат 55 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Марапат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1997 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 2,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня  хозяйство Марапат насчитывает 4 коровы, 1 лошадь, 2 бычка, что приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Также Марапат возделывает 1,0 га земли, где выращивает картошку и морковь. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марапат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян риса для посадки.  Доходы от кредита Марапат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Marapat is 55 years old, married, and the mother of three. As a main source of income for her family, Marapat has been raising livestock and growing produce, having launched this business with a starting capital of 2,000 KGS. At present Marapat’s farm includes four cows, one horse, and two bulls, and brings in about 5,000 KGS per month from the sales of milk and dairy products. Marapat also works  1 ha [about 2.5 acres] of land, where she grows potatoes and carrots.

In order to grow her business further, Marapat turned to “Bai Tushum  & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy rice seeds for planting. Marapat plans to use the revenues earned thanks to her loan in order to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds.

loans.name: Allin Llankaqcuna De Chichubamba Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Allin Llankaqcuna de Chichubamba” en la comunidad de Chichubamba en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de animales menores cuyes y gallinas, elaboración de chocolate y café, venta de verduras y flores y otros se dedican a la agricultura y a brindar servicio de transportes.      
 
(La señora Alcione está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Alcione nació en  el distrito de Maranura la provincia de La Convención. 

La socia Alcione tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos.  Actualmente, Alcione vive en la comunidad de Chichubamba y donde desarrolla sus actividades economicas. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Alcione es la elaboración de cerámica,ella tiene un taller en su domicilio donde elabora sus productos. Ya son 11 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Alcione en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo pintura, arcilla, vidrio, pigmentos. El sueño de  Alcione es exportar sus productos y asistir a ferias internacionales.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the “Allin Llankaqcuna de Chichubamba” communal bank in the community of Chichubamba in Cusco Department’s Urubamba Province.  This communal bank is composed of people who seek at all times opportunities to get ahead by means of their daily efforts to provide a better future for their children.  The economic activities of the members are, for example: guinea-pig and chicken sales, coffee and chocolate making, vegetable and flower sales.  Others are in agriculture and some provide transportation services.

(Alcione is raising her hand in the photo).  Alcione was born in Maranura District in the Province of La Convención.  She’s 42-years-old and is in a common law relationship; she has two children.  Alcione currently lives in the community of Chichubamba where she carries out her economic activities.  

Alcione’s main economic activity is making ceramics.  She has a workshop at home where she manufactures her products.  She’s been in this business for 11 years already and she does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her business.  On this occasion, Alcione needs the loan to buy supplies like paint, clay, glass and pigments.  Alcione’s dream is to export her products and to attend international expositions.
 
The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various installment payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy paint, clay, glass and pigments.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Liezl is 38 years old.


Liezl has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Liezl has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.


Liezl has been in this business for three years. In the future, Liezl would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 32-year-old mother of six children and is married to Kalama. All of her children are in school. 

Margaret operates a retail kiosk, which has been running for the last four years. She was previously a mere housewife. In addition, she operates a water selling business, selling from home to the neighborhood. Her goal is to start a wholesale shop in the future.

Margaret owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. She plans to add stock of maize flour, rice, and sugar with the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

loans.use: to add stock of maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás es un padre de familia de  35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en un caserío de la zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, ubicado en la región Piura. En la zona sólo cuentan con el servicio de luz eléctrica, sus condiciones de vida son humildes y precarias. 

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y porcino. El cría sus animales en corrales acondicionados cerca de su domicilio y cuando estos han alcanzado el tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. También se dedica a la agricultura para lo cual cuenta con un terreno de cultivo donde tiene instalados plantaciones de mango que comercializa cuando lleva el tiempo de cosecha, generalmente en los meses de verano. Su experiencia como agricultor le ha valido el que eventualmente trabaje en otros fundos agrícolas de la zona. 

Tomás desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo, asimismo desea adquirir fertilizantes para obtener una buena cosecha de mango. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. 

El ya ha mantenido créditos con nuestra institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Tomás is 35-year-old parent, who lives with his wife and three children in a rural settlement in the farming district of Tambogrande, located in the Piura region. In this area they only have electricity, and the living conditions are humble and precarious. 

He raises sheep and pigs. He raises his animals in pens set up near his home, and when they have reached the ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market. He also farms, and has a piece of farmland where he has planted mangos that he sells when harvest time comes, normally in the summer months. He has made use of his experience as a farmer and may eventually work at other farms in the area. 

Tomás wishes to acquire balanced feed so that his animals develop optimally. As well, he wishes to buy fertilizers in order to get a good mango harvest. To achieve his objective he has applied to Edpyme for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles. 

He has already managed loans with our institution, and has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible client.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for fattening animals and fertilizers for his mango crop.

loans.name: Jaime Elias

texts.es: Jaime de 50 años de edad, tiene un taller de zapatería en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 19 años. En su Taller Jaime fabrica toda clase de calzado especialmente de sandalias femeninas. Jaime aprendió este oficio, desde muy joven trabajando con otros zapateros. Su negocio está ubicado al costado de su casa materna; Jaime además es albañil y también lo contratan en construcciones de viviendas y cuando esto ocurre desarrolla su trabajo de zapatería durante las noches. Su meta es ampliar su negocio, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograrlo, esta es la razón por la que acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace Jaime a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, como cuero, pegante, accesorios y herrajes, con los cuales fabricará nuevos diseños que saldrán a la venta y planean ser todo un éxito por su estilo cómodo y a la moda.
texts.en:
Jaime is 50 years old, and has a shoemaking workshop in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, which is located on the shore of the Caribbean Sea. He lives with his life partner and their two children, ages 18 and 19. In his workshop, Jaime makes all sorts of shoes, especially women’s sandals. He learned the trade from other shoemakers when he was very young. His workshop is attached to the side of his home. Jaime is also a mason and works on contract for construction projects for homes. When he is contracted to complete a construction job, he works nights at his shoemaking workshop. 

His goal is to grow his business, but he does not have the necessary capital to expand at this time. He is therefore requesting this loan, which will be his first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and with Kiva. He plans to use the support from this loan to purchase raw materials, such as leather, glue, accessories and hardware for use in designing and making new shoes. He hopes that these new styles will generate good profits, since they will be both comfortable and stylish.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as leather, glue, accessories and hardware for making shoes.

loans.name: Maired Maria
