texts.es: Maired es una mujer de 35 años  a la edad, que desde los 21 años terminó sus estudios de bachiller  y empezó a comercializar prendas de plata y fantasías; artículos con los que inició su negocio y con los que poco a poco fue creciendo, hasta lograr que con los ahorros productos de él, organizara una tienda, donde vendía ranchos, víveres, abarrotes, refrescos y carnes al detalle, durante 2 años. Como este trabajó le resultó agotador y no le permitía dedicarse  a su familia, decidió  comercializar electrodomésticos y ofrecer servicios de telecomunicaciones por minuto; con este negocio tiene 6 años y le ha ido muy bien; siempre es apoyada en su hogar, por su cónyuge, que es pintor de muebles de madera; ambos tienen sueños comunes y el principal es trabajar unidos, para ayudar a que su hija, hoy de 5 años,  se convierta en una profesional exitosa. En la actualidad, Maired tiene la meta de incrementar sus clientes y está haciendo una preventa, donde le han encargado mas mercancía, de la que ella con su capital de trabajo propio, puede responder. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará abanicos, vajillas, licuadoras, sabanas, artículos, que le ofrecen un buen porcentaje de utilidades e incrementarán su capital de trabajo y la recuperación de su cartera, pues se aumentará el valor de esta y esto es justamente lo que garantiza que su credikiva sea muy exitoso al ser bien invertido.
texts.en:
Maired, 35, starting selling silver articles and costume jewelry at the age of 21 when she completed high school.    She started her business with these articles and gradually grew until she was able to use savings from profits to open a store where she sold snacks, groceries, soft-drinks and meat at retail for two years.  Because this work turned out to be exhausting and did not give her time to dedicate to her family, she decided to start selling home appliances and telecommunication services by the minute.  She’s had this business for six years and does very well.  Her husband, who paints wooden furniture, always supports her at home.  They have shared dreams the main one of which is to work together to help their daughter who is 5-years-old now to become a successful professional.

Maired’s current goal is to increase her clientele and she’s doing a presale and has gotten orders for more merchandise that she can respond to with her own working capital.  This is the reason why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through which to buy fans, sets of pots and pans, blenders, sheets and other items that produce good profit margins and will increase her working capital and recuperate her accounts receivable because they will increase in value which [we at FMSD] believe is precisely what guarantees that her Kiva loan will be successful since it’s been well invested.

loans.use: to buy fans, sets of pots and pans, blenders, sheets and other articles.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 28-year-old single young man. For the past seven years, Wisam has been selling men's clothes. His store is located in a good movement area and has a good reputation among customers, but also he needs more support to cover the costs.

Wisam is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of summer clothes, such as: T-shirts, trousers, and jackets. This will enable Wisam to compete well with others and attract his customers to buy, which will increase sales and improve his income.

Wisam is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of summer clothes

loans.name: Eileen

texts.en:
Eileen is 37 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo. She is single with no children.


To earn a living, Eileen has a meat processing business. She earns about 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Eileen has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase meat, salt, and spices.


Eileen has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Eileen would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat, salt, and spices for her meat processing business.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya manages a daycare for five children. Over the last several years, her daycare has gained an excellent reputation and is in high demand. It is always full well before the school year begins. 

Aliya needs to make changes to the daycare and is preparing for expansion in the future. One area where the children play is on a large balcony and she needs to replace the railing for safety reasons. In addition, she needs to add an air conditioner for the indoor play area and nap room. 

Aliya loves caring for young children and provides a warm, loving environment. Aliya wants to expand her business, hire an assistant and take on ten kids rather than just five. She sees her daycare meeting the needs of the area in the future, as opposed to having to turn away young children because there is no room.

loans.use: to purchase and install a railing to enclose the outdoor play area and an air conditioner for the indoor play area and nap room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools, wood, and concrete molds.

loans.name: Adolfo Enrique

texts.es: Con la venta de ropa exterior e interior, multiusos, toallas ropa de cama y deportiva, Adolfo logró aumentar su capital de trabajo y esto fue gracias a que invirtió muy bien su  credikiva anterior. El se ha entusiasmado para hacer una nueva inversión; por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un segundo financiamiento, con el que comprará mercancías en general, como prendas de vestir, pues le han ofrecido buenos precios si compra de contado y en mayor volumen. Su éxito en esta inversión, radica en que hará una oferta  con precios mejores que los de su competencia y además porque con ello, ofrecerá una gran diversidad de prendas de vestir modernas. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por contar con su apoyo, este es muy importante, ya que con esto ayudan a mejorar condiciones de vida de muchas familias en Colombia y a cumplir muchos sueños. “
texts.en: With the sale of underwear, outerwear, multiple-use wear, towels, bed linens and sportswear, Adolfo increased his working capital thanks to his investing his prior Kiva loan well.  He’s encouraged to make a new investment which is why he’s applying for his second loan to buy general merchandise like clothes because he’s been offered good prices if he pays cash and buys large quantities.  This investment’s success is based on his being able to offer better prices than his competition and because he’ll have a wide variety of modern clothes.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following:  “Thank you for allowing me to rely on your support; this is very important because you help many families in Colombia improve their quality of life and to make many dreams a reality.”

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Mary está muy contenta con su credikiva, pues desde que recibió su anterior crédito, logró aumentar su capital de trabajo,invirtiendo en mercancias de las que mas solicitan sus clientes y vendiendolas muy prontamente, porque hasta compró una nueva vitrina que surtió y que atrajo a mucha clientela, por la forma en que estaba exhibida su mercancia. En la actualidad se preparara para aplicar a un nuevo credikiva, con el que comprará ropa, calzado, accesorios femeninos, productos de aseo los cuales promoverá entre sus clientes mejor seleccionados y con su experiencia y  capacidad de trabajo, saldrá adelante muy rapidamente, haciendo que su credikiva tenga mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Mary is very happy with her Kiva loan because since she got her previous loan she managed to increase working capital investing it in merchandise that is most requested by her customers and selling it very quickly.  She even bought a new display case that she stocked and that attracted many customers because of the way her merchandise was displayed.

She is now getting ready to apply for a new Kiva loan to buy clothes, footwear, women’s accessories and cleaning supplies that she’ll promote among her best chosen customers and with her experience and capacity for work, [FMSA believes] she will very quickly get ahead making her Kiva loan very successful.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, women's accessories and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She operates a retail kiosk selling to her neighbors. She aspires to open a wholesale store in the future.

Margaret owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes high cost of commodities to be her major challenge. Food and school fees are her greatest monthly expenses. She joined Yehu to secure loans to boost her business.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she plans to add stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Other sources of income include earnings from her spouse, who sells charcoal.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is married with three children, all of whom are in school. She is married to Hamisi, a businessman, and they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mbeyu has been operating a retail shop for the last two years, previously selling cereals. She dreams of constructing a rental house in the future. She also operates a bodaboda (motorcycle) as her side business.

Mbeyu will be able to add maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil to her stock. She spends more on food and school fees over the month.

loans.use: to add maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil to her stock.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is 45 years old and married with two children; one son and one daughter. Her husband and her son are involved in a business selling thread rolls.  

Shamshad herself is involved in a sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighboring customers and earns income for the family. She is very caring in nature. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. Her daughter supports her in managing her household works. 

Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will purchase thread rolls in a larger quantity for reselling. 

She hopes that with this investment, his business will continue to prosper so that he can offer an even better service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy thread rolls for reselling

loans.name: 9 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “9 DE ABRIL” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Galia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Pasanaco, venta de frutas, pulpería, artesanía, comerciante de edredones, venta de cosméticos.

La señora Galia, indica que hace quince años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos alimenticios por mayor, mismo que aprendió de su Tía.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y azúcar), mismos que comprará de la las ferias de la Cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en algunas oficinas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank 9 de Abril is starting their first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the regional office of Santiago II. It comprises six members and is managed by a Board of Directors, where Galia is Treasurer. The members are involved in different businesses, such as: revolving funds, fruit sales, grocery store, arts and crafts, mattress sales, and cosmetics sales. 

Galia says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 15 years, and that she joined through a friend, who invited her. Currently she has a business selling wholesale food products, which she learned from her aunt.

The loan she is now requesting will be to increase capital: she will purchase rice and sugar at the outdoor markets in the city of El Alto and will later sell them at several offices. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, for she is in a common-law marriage and has five children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health trainings.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is a 26-year-old married woman with 2 young children. She and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol. Nerissa does her best to increase their profits and take care of her children. She has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and gasoline. This will help bring in more fish for Nerissa and her husband to sell. She hopes their fishing business will grow and for her family to be in good health always.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and gasoline

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a 48-year-old married woman. She has 6 children, and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Hamisi, and he works as a fisherman. Mwanamisi operates a business selling coconuts from her home. She has worked in this business for 10 years and was previously employed as a farmer. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality, and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanamisi will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more coconuts. 

Mwanamisi aspires to own a grocery store in the future. She joined Yehu because of its good history.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a young businessman. He is single and the youngest child within his family. He did not finish his studies due to financial need.

Robert raises hogs and is a farmer within his local community. He is grateful because, despite the hardship and difficulties he has experienced, he is able to stand firm to overcome those trials in life. Robert paid back his previous loan and is asking for a bigger amount. He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000  to buy necessary vitamins, vaccines, and stocks of hog feed. He hopes that he can make his pigs healthy to enable them to reach their optimum growth. Robert hopes that he will have continuous access to financial resources from ASKI and KIVA lenders so he can maintain his hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy necessary vitamins, vaccines, and stocks of hog feed

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 38-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in her own house that has both electricity and piped water.

Catherine runs a kiosk that has been operating for the last 5 years. Her aim is to open a wholesale shop in the future. She experiences a challenge of market competition. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

This loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) will enable her purchase sugar, rice, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назире 40 лет, замужем, воспитывает  4 детей. В 2002 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи,  Назира начала свой бизнес в пошиве верхней одежды. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Назира сумела развить свой бизнес, приобретя 6 машинок и зарабатывая около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
Для покупки материала и сопутствующих аксессуаров, Назира обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 24,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Назира планирует частично вложить в закуп стройматериалов для ремонта дома, и часть – в развитие бизнеса за счет покупки нового оборудования.
texts.en:
Nazira is 40 years old, married and raising four children. In 2002, in the search of additional sources of income for her family, Nazira launched her business sewing  outerwear. Thanks to her resilience and hard work, Nazira has been able to grow her business, eventually buying six sewing machines and earning around 12,000 KGS per month.

In order to buy cloth and accessories, Nazira turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 24,000 KGS. Nazira plans to use part of the resulting revenues into buying construction materials for renovating her home, and the other part  for by buying new equipment so as to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and supplies.

loans.name: Yoana Angely

texts.es:
Yoana es una joven madre de 22 años, su pequeña tienen tan solo 3 años de edad, Yoana la  ama mucho y por ella es capaz de dar la vida, sobre todo trabaja muy duro para darle lo mejor y lo hace sola ya que el padre de su niña la abandono cuando aún estaba en la barriga de su madre. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima acogedor, playas hermosas, atractivos turísticos muy bonitos como las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de paracas, que reciben a infinidad de turistas en todo el año, también se desarrolla la agricultura , especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros.  Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es  muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos. 

Yoana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado, ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como ropa para niños, pantalones jean, poleras, casacas, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hija y sobre todo seguir saliendo adelante”.
texts.en:
Yoana, 22, is a young mother of a three-year-old daughter.  Yoana loves her very much and is willing to give her life for her.  She works very hard to be able to give her the best and she does it alone because her daughter’s father abandoned her when she was still in her mother’s belly.  

Her house is located in the city of Pisco, a city that’s noted for its welcoming climate, its beautiful beaches and tourist attractions like the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabrum that receive infinity of tourists year-round.  Agriculture also takes place here especially cotton and corn growing, among others.

With much effort and savings she managed to start her own business selling women’s, men’s and children’s clothes.  She works about 8 hours daily and can see up to 15 customers per day.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s very kind to her customers and above all because she offers quality products at affordable prices.

Yoana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business like children’s clothes, jeans, t-shirts and jackets, among others so that she can improve her income and have a wider variety of goods to offer her customers which will allow her to continue striving daily to make her greatest dream a reality:  to give her daughter a good education and above all to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 45-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of five sons and four daughters between the ages of 5 and 18 years. Her husband works in agriculture and has a farm planted with olive and almond trees. The income he gets from selling the crops isn't enough to cover the family's needs and their education expenses.

Siham has decided to assist her husband in improving the family's income by having her own project, a grocery store. She sells a variety of groceries, and she wants to buy some additional items currently missing from her store, including rice, tea, milk, sugar, cooking oil, and canned food.

Siham is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more groceries for her store. This will increase her sales and improve the family's income. 

Siham is photographed with her youngest son in her store.

loans.use: To purchase necessary groceries

loans.name: China

texts.en: China is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 3 children and all are enrolled in school. China operates a coconut selling business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for 7 years and was previously employed as a fish seller in town. Her primary customers are residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. China will use the Kes 30000 loan to expand the business by purchasing more coconuts to sell. China aspires to open a new kiosk in the future. She joined Yehu because they have affordable interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Dennys Pablo

texts.es: Dennys es un Manteño de 46 años, felizmente casado y padre de dos niñas. Su esposa Carmen no trabaja de momento es ama de casa. Una de sus hijas es mayor de edad y ya está casada, la otra tiene 13 años y está estudiando en el colegio fiscal de Manta. Dennys nos cuenta que empezó desde muy joven trabajando con un amigo de su padre que era soldador. Fue su maestro ya que le enseño la forma de trabajar y el trato a los clientes. Pasando un tiempo decidió independizarse abriendo su local propio y poco a poco ha ido adquiriendo la maquinaria necesaria. Han pasado 6 años desde que tomo esa decisión ahora trabaja junto a su hermano desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días. El nos comenta que la falta de maquinas está bajando su rendimiento pero espera superar ese problema con el préstamo. Su sueño es tener un taller de soldadura con todas las herramientas necesarias para mejorar su economía y ayudar dando trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en: Dennys is a 46 year old Manan, happily married and the father of two girls.  His wife Carmen does not work at the moment and is a housewife.  One of their daughters is a married adult and the other is 13 years old and attends the local public school in Manta.  He says that he began working with a friend of his father who was a welder when he was very young.  He was the teacher who taught him how to work and treat customers.  After some time he decided to venture out on his own and open his own shop.  He has acquired the necessary machinery little by little.  Six years have passed since he made this decision and now he works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm every day.  He says that his lack of equipment is reducing his return but he expects to beat this problem with this loan.  His dream is to have a welding shop with all the necessary tools to improve his finances and help by providing employment to other people.

loans.use: to buy a welder.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es: Carlota de 58 años es una mujer casada y madre de 8 hijos que hoy están en las edades de 26 a 40 años. Procedente del departamento del Magdalena, llegó desde hace 10 años, a la ciudad de Barranquilla con toda su familia y se hospedó en casa de sus padres, donde emprendió una aventura de negocios para lograr generar ingresos y sostener a su familia. Así fue como en compañía de su esposo, puso un restaurante en casa paterna, ubicándola en la terraza y por ser una vía principal, impactó a la clientela que gradualmente fue creciendo. Hoy vende almuerzos y una gama de fritos y bollos o amasijos, preparados con maíz, queso y anís, envueltos en capachos. Su sueño mas adelante, es tener su propia casa y continuar organizando su negocio. Su gran desafío fue el desplazamiento de su tierra natal, a esta ciudad y el tener que iniciar inmediatamente un negocio, para generar ingresos que resolvieran las necesidades de sostenimiento básico de su familia. Pero eso es ya pasado y hoy se concentra en su futuro crecimiento empresarial, aunque con necesidades de capital de trabajo, para desarrollar su actividad de manera armoniosa. Esta es justamente  la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el que comprará materias primas e insumos y para sustituir pasivos costosos, que le generen mayores utilidades en las ventas y esto es lo que garantiza el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Carlota, 58 years old, is married and the mother of 8 children who are now between the ages of 26 and 40. From the department of Magdalena, she arrived 10 years ago in the city of Barranquilla with her entire family. They stayed in her parents' house, where she developed a business in order to be able to generate income and sustain her family. This was how, with her husband, she put a restaurant in her father's house, locating it on the terrace. Since it was a main road, it made an impression on the clientele, which gradually increased. Today she sells lunches and a range of fried items and spongy bread rolls or dough products made with corn, cheese, and anise, wrapped in baskets. Her dream for later on is to have her own house and to continue organizing her business. Her great challenge was the displacement from her native land to this city and having to immediately start a business in order to generate income that would cover the basic needs of her family. But this is already in the past, and today she concentrates on her future business growth, although with the need for business capital, in order to develop her work in a harmonious way. This is precisely why she is applying for a Kiva loan, with which she will buy raw materials and supplies and replace costly debt. This will generate more profit for her in sales, and this is what guarantees the success of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies and replace costly debt

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres se han unido con el sueño de ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas desean poder ayudar a sus familias y por medio de ese trabajo mejorar sus vidas.
Maria es la presidenta de este grupo, cuenta que su comité con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido salir adelante y de esa forma ir ayudando a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre acude a ella para comprar sus productos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos. Ella y su grupo agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo de fundación paraguaya y de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sixteen women joined together with the dream of helping each other out through teamwork.  They want to be able to help their families and through their work improve their lives.

María is the group President.  She comments that her committee has been able to get ahead with much effort and sacrifice and to help their family this way.  She sells all types of food and does very well because she has a good clientele that always comes to her to buy her products.  

She’s asking for the loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other ingredients.  She and her group pare grateful for the help they are getting from Fundación Paraguaya and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other ingredients.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is 40 years old, married and has 5 children. All of her children are continuing their studies.  Khalida is a sewing expert and sews clothes for her neighbors. Her husband has a paint business and sells paint of different colors.

Due to her good quality of work, her clients are very satisfied and give Khalida regular orders.  Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further improve her sewing business.  With the loan investment she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine takes a lot of time to sew a dress. With the new sewing machine, she will able to finish client orders on time and increase her profits.  She is very experienced in her work and confident that by purchasing a new sewing machine, her business will be improved a lot.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 33-year-old single mother of three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.
She has a retail shop that she has operated for twelve years. Constance acquired the initial capital to buy the retail shop through photography, her first business venture.
The main hardship Constance faces is price fluctuation. Despite hardships, her personal goal is to build a permanent house. Her goals for her business are to diversify and buy land on which to grow crops. The purpose of this loan is to buy general merchandise, such as soap and salt, to sell in her retail shop.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as soap and salt, to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre”.  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Lucre de la provincia de Quispicanchi del departamento de Cusco.

La socia Isabel vive en la ciudad de Lucre donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos secos y a la venta de carne, ella es una mujer trabajadora que saca adelante a sus hijos. En esta oportunidad la socia Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar carne y productos secos como por ejemplo trigo, cebada, maíz y otras cosas más. 

La socia Isabel agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower, Isabel, belongs to the “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” communal bank, located in Lucre district, in Quispicanchi province, Cusco department.

Isabel lives in the town of Lucre where she carries on her livelihood. She sells food staples and meat. She is a hard-working woman who is helping her children get ahead in life. On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy meat and food staples such as wheat, barley, corn and other products. 

Isabel appreciates the loan, and promises to make her payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy meat and food staples such as wheat, barley, corn, and other products.

loans.name: Grupo Joyitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GRUPO JOYITAS” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lendaura. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de carne, venta de ropa, venta de ganado, venta de artículos varios, tienda de barrio.

La señora Lendaura, indica que es la primera vez integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de barrio, mismo que aprendió de una de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres), mismos que comprará de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y Viacha posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de salud y crédito y el crédito ágil.
texts.en:
The “Joyitas” (Little Jewels) group will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Focal Center.  It has ten members led by a governing board headed by Lendaura.  The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of businesses among which we have: vegetables sales, meat sales, clothes sales, livestock sales, assorted merchandise sales and neighborhood store.

Lendaura indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having joined thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  She currently has a neighborhood store that she learned from her mother.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy foodstuffs in the street markets in El Alto and Viacha for subsequent resale in sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family however possible because she’s single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training, the loans and the quickness of the loans.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Magret, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who all go to school.  She has been selling charcoal for five years now.  She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a plot of land and start building a small house; buy a TV set, a big radio, and a sofa set; and pay school fees and household expenses.  She has paid back all of her loans successfully.  She wants this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.  Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Compressor, which has a total of 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria salió desde el Sur de Bolívar hacia la ciudad de Cartagena, para buscar la tan anhelada paz, que  ella y su familia, (conformada por 8 hijos, hoy en las edades de 20 a 42 años), no habían logrado en su tierra natal.  Su naturaleza campesina y capacidad de sembrar la tierra, en esta ciudad, a la que se habían trasladado,  le daba pocas posibilidades de  generar ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar, pero sus necesidades fueron superiores y emprendieron su propia aventura de negocios, apoyados por un gran amigo, que les prestó el primer capital de trabajo, para que compraran mercancías variadas y desde entonces han logrado ampliarlo y seguir soñando con mejorarlo aun mas su nivel de vida. En la actualidad comercializa sombreros y todos los artículos de consumo que piden sus clientes; así mismo vende pescado de rio y galletas especialmente. Su mercado lo conforman las amas de casa, pequeñas tiendas y recomendados de sus clientes, ubicados en los alrededores del barrio. Su meta es capitalizar su negocio y obtener ingresos para aumentar su bienestar familiar. Su principal desafío actualmente es el poco capital de trabajo con el que cuenta,  para poder lograr aumentar su clientela, que cada día aumenta la demanda de los productos que vende. Esta es  la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace Maria a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará pescado para responder a encargos, sombreros y galletas, que también han solicitado sus clientes. El éxito de su credikiva es que invierte justamente en los pedidos de sus clientes rentables y que lo hace sin esperar recoger el dinero procedente de sus cuentas por cobrar, sino con el dinero producto de su credikiva que le permite  responder de manera  ágil a su clientela.
texts.en:
María left the south of Bolívar and headed to Cartagena in search of the wished for peace that she and her family, composed of 8 children aged between 20 and 42 years, had been unable to find in the place of their birth.  Coming from the countryside her skills were in working the soil which in the city they had relocated to give her few opportunities to generate income to support her home.  But her needs were greater so they started their own business venture with help from a great friend who lent them their initial working capital to buy assorted merchandise.  Since then they managed to expand it and to continue dreaming with improving their standard of living even more.

She currently sells hats and all kinds of consumer goods her customers request; she also sells river fish and cookies in particular.   Her market is composed of housewives, small stores and customers referred from other customers located around her neighborhood.  Her goal is to capitalize her business and to obtain income to increase her family’s wellbeing.

Her main challenge at present is the little working capital she has available to increase her clientele which every day increases demand for the products she sells.  This is the reason why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, the first financing she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy fish to fill her orders and hats and cookies that have also been requested by her customers.  

[FMSD] believes that the success of her loan depends on her investing precisely on profitable pending customer orders she has and that she does so without waiting to collect money she has in accounts receivable but with money from her Kiva loan so she’s able to respond more readily to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fish, hats and cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a beverage display case/refrigerator and soft drinks

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita lives happily in her hometown of Turod Norte.  She is 61 years old and has lived with her partner for 15 years.  Estelita is a loving wife and responsible mother to her seven children.  Though her family is less fortunate than many others, she aspires to expand her general store because she is getting old.  Estelita wakes up early in the morning to serve her costumers.  She has been doing this to improve her family’s living conditions.

Estelita owns a general store that she established more than three years ago.  She plans to buy and stock more merchandise but her capital is no longer sufficient due to the abrupt increase of their household expenses.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional merchandise.  She knows that her patience and retail knowledge will help her to obtain success in life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her general store.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is currently unemployed, but helps her business. Her older daughters go to school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. 

She has been selling organic dairy products since 1993. She travels through the countryside to collect her products. Her products are not mass produced; therefore, her products don't include any kind of chemicals. Now that people are more concerned about their health, her product demand is increasing rapidly. She's requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase more organic dairy products such as milk, koumiss, etc. in order to meet the increasing demand.

loans.use: To purchase more organic dairy products

loans.name: Kary

texts.es:
La socia Kary pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre”.  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Lucre de la provincia de Quispicanchi del departamento de Cusco.

La socia Kary nació en la ciudad de Lucre y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, actualmente,  ella trabaja como empadronadora de un ministerio del estado pero ella tiene su actividad cotidiana que es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y también vende productos secos como trigo, cebada, maíz y otros más. En esta oportunidad la socia Kary requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

La socia Kary agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Kary belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre.”  This communal bank is located in the Lucre district of Quispicanchi province in the department of Cusco.

Kary was born in the city of Lucre, and she lives in the same city where she was born.  She is 36 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has a son.  She is currently working as a census taker for the ministry of state, but her daily activity is raising small animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She also sells dried products such as wheat, barley, corn and other grains.  At this time, Kary needs a loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

Kary appreciates this loan and promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Mileydys

texts.es: Mileydis de 30 años de edad, llegó a la ciudad de Cartagena con su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 7 y 9 años, para buscar la tan anhelada paz, que no existía en ese entonces en su tierra natal; en Cartagena la única y rápida oportunidad de producir ingresos, era trabajando en casa de familia. Pero Mileydis decidió estudiar artesanía, porque una vez aprendiendo a trabajar las manualidades, podía generar ingresos, emprendiendo su propia aventura de negocios. Así lo hizo y encomendada a Dios, empezó a producir bisutería y a ganar una clientela, a la que le gustaron sus productos, porque además, ello  respondía  a las necesidades de estar a la moda de sus consumidores;  por eso en su negocio le ha ido muy bien y hoy su meta es crecer cada vez mas, como lo está haciendo de la mano de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Organización con la que ha logrado tener su vivienda en un lugar digno, lo cual ha cambiado la vida de su familia. Ante la creciente clientela que diariamente hace pedidos y Mileidys puede responder solo, cuando recupera sus cuentas por cobrar, ella ha decidido aplicar a un credikiva, que es el segundo financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprara Materias primas, y artesanías del departamento de la Guajira, ubicado al norte de Colombia,  pues quiere diversificar y agregar estos productos que son muy apetecidos por sus clientes, lo cual hace que esta inversión tenga mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Mileydis, 30, arrived in Cartagena with her family composed of her spouse and two children aged 7 and 9 years to seek the peace they so desired that did not exist then in the place of their birth.  In Cartagena, the only way available to quickly earn money was to work as a domestic in a private home.  

But Mileydis decided to study crafts-making because once learning manual arts she would be able to generate income by going into her own business venture.  That’s how she did it and putting herself in God’s hands started to make costume jewelry and win over a clientele that liked her products because besides they responded to her customers’ need to be fashionable.  This is why she’s done very well in her business and today her goal is to grow even more like she’s been doing hand-in-hand with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which she’s succeeded in acquiring her dwelling in a proper setting which has changed her family’s life.

In face of the growing demand caused by her customers’ daily orders which Mileydis can only respond to it when she collects on her accounts receivable she’s decided to apply for a Kiva loan, her second financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy raw materials and crafts from La Guajira Department located in north Colombia because she wants to diversify and add these products that are highly sought after by her customers which will make her investment successful.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and crafts from La Guajira Department.

loans.name: El Valerio Group

texts.es:
El grupo “EL Valerio” está conformado por seis integrantes todas son mujeres muy responsables que se dedican todos sus esfuerzo para que sus familias estén bien económicamente el nombre del grupo Valerio lo eligieron ellas por el lugar donde vive es una comunidad grande en la que se dedican la cultivo de maíz aunque la gente de ese lugar esta triste ya que días pasados cayo una helada y quemo el cultivo de maíz creen que ya no se recupere y menos si no llueve.
La señora María quien es una integrante del grupo vive en unión libre desde hace 15 años con el señor Basilio el cual trabaja en el campo juntos han formado una familia de 5 hijos que aun dependen de ellos cuatro de ellos van a la escuela bueno Doña María se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa ella lo que hace en la semana visitas a sus vecinas para ofrecerles un poco de ropa que tiene o también les toma pedidos para que el fin de semana se los traiga desde la capital, es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que quiere que la calidad de vida de sus hijos mejores, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar mas ropa en mayoreo como suéteres, pantalones, chamarras, faldas, camisas etc. Esto para cubrir pedidos que tiene pendientes el crédito le beneficiara para surtir de mas ropa y sus ganancias sean más cuando le llega el crédito aprovecha para surtir y así no tiene que viajar a la ciudad de México.
Lo que Doña María le gustaría tener un carro para trasportarse a otras comunidades para vender la ropa que vende pero también le encantaría rentar un local para tener un negocio estable y ya no tener que caminar. Aunque sabe que las rentas están muy caras, así que nos cuenta que tiene que trabajar mucho más para poder llegar a tener su local.
Sus ganancias le ayudan de mucho ya que puede surtirse de más ropa, puede comprarle ropa, zapatos, comida y más que nada gastos para su educación y es de gran ayuda ya que cuando su esposo no tiene trabajo ella lo ayuda con sus ganancias de la venta de su ropa.
Doña María y el resto del grupo están muy agradecidos con el apoyo de Kiva y Vision Fund (FRAC) ya que podrán invertir en sus actividades, las demás integrantes son: Doña Mariela, invertirá en ropa; Doña María, en borregos; Doña Concepción, en alimento para sus becerros; Doña Celedonia, también en becerros; Concepción, en ropa y cosméticos. Todas están muy contentas ya que iniciaron el crédito y están comprometidos con la institución y Kiva para no quedar mal.
texts.en:
The El Valerio communal bank is comprised of six members.  They are all very responsible women who devote all of their efforts towards their families being okay financially.  They chose the name of the group, Valerio, for the place where they live.  It is a large community, which is devoted to growing corn.  The people in this place are sad because there was a recent frost that burned the corn crop.  They believe they will not recover, and it is even worse if it does not rain. 

María is a member of the group.  She has been in a common-law marriage with Basilio for 15 years.  He works in the field.  Together they have formed a family of five children who are still dependent upon them.  Four of the children go to school.

María buys and sells clothes.  During the week she visits her neighbors to offer them a little clothing that she has.  She also takes orders that she will bring from the capital on the week-ends.  She is a very hard-working woman who wants her children’s quality of life to improve.

This time she has requested a loan to buy more wholesale clothes like sweaters, pants, jackets, skirts, and shirts, etc.  This is to cover the pending orders that she has.  The loan will help her stock up on more clothes, and she will have more income.  When the loan comes she will take advantage of it to stock up, and this way she will not need to travel to Mexico City.

María would like to have a car for transportation to other communities in order to sell clothes.  However, she would also love to rent a place to have a stable business and no longer have to walk.  She knows that the rent is very expensive, and she tells us that she has to work a lot more to be able to have a place.

Her income helps her a lot because she can stock more clothes, she is able to buy clothes, shoes, food, and more than anything, pay the educational expenses.  This is a big help when her husband does not have work.  She helps him with the income from her clothing sales.

María and the rest of the group are very grateful for the support from Kiva and Vision Fund (FRAC).  They can now invest in their business activities.  Mariel will invest in clothes, María, in sheep; Concepción in feed for her calves; Celedonia also in calves;  and Concepción in clothes and cosmetics.

They are all very happy because of the loan, and they are committed to remain in good standing with the institution and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

location.town: El Valerio San Jose del Rincon.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 59 years old. She lives in a small village with her family: her husband, Otari, her three children (25, 29 and 35 years old) and two daughters-in-law. The whole family is involved in the family business. They earn a living through agricultural business. They have a one-hectare vineyard and work hard to get a good harvest. In the fall, they pick grapes and make natural and sweet wine. They sell the wine in nearby villages. In addition to the agricultural business, Eter is busy with trading. She has second hand clothes at home and sells them to the local population. She has been selling for almost two years and has a lot of customers. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Lari.

Eter requested a loan for performing seasonal agricultural works in vineyard. She will purchase medicines against parasites to protect the trees and harvest. After properly done seasonal work, she will get more harvest and her sales will increase. Along with the above-mentioned, Eter will use the loan for purchasing additional second-hand clothes to increase the turnover. As a result of the above-mentioned investment, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to spend more on satisfying their daily needs to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides and used clothing

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 15 years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan of  40,000 KES to purchase more goats.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: El Horizonte De Oquendo - Callao Group

texts.es:
Livia tiene 37 años, sus 03 hijos son el mejor estimulo para que siga luchando,  por eso ahora que es parte de la alcancía EL HORIZONTE DE OQUENDO quiere empezar un negocio y su primer préstamo le servirá para comprar ropa para vender, su comadre se dedica a lo mismo y es quien la anima y le enseñara los lugares donde adquirir ropa barata, para luego ofrecerla directamente; de esa manera podrá tener un negocio que  le permita tener ingresos para solventar los gastos de su familia, sobre todo lo que más desea ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios, actualmente Livia ha sido elegida la presidenta de la alcancía y quiere cumplir fielmente el cargo que le ha sido asignado.
*Livia aparece con polo a rayas blanco y negro.
texts.en:
Livia is 37 years old. Her three children are the best motivation for her to continue striving. At the moment, she is a member of the Communal Bank "El Horizonte de Oquendo".

Livia wants to start a business and her first loan will enable her to buy clothes to sell. The godmother of her children is in the same line of work, so she encouraged Livia and showed her where to acquire inexpensive clothing that she could resell directly at a later time. Having a business will enable Livia to generate income for her family's expenses. Most of all, she wants to help her children with their studies. She was recently elected to become the president of the Communal Bank, so she wants to serve faithfully in her assigned position.

*In the photograph, Livia is the woman wearing a blouse with black and white stripes.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en: Mwanaulu is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children and both are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Abdalla and he works as a carpenter. Mwanaulu operates a grocery store and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for six years and was previously employed to sell fish. Her primary customers are residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanaulu will use the KES 15,000 loan to expand the business by purchasing more tomatoes and groceries. Mwanaulu aspires to open a new retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of the affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and groceries.

loans.name: Saram's Group

texts.en: Saram and her family live in a wooden house located in Dambae district. Saram is 46 years old and has one daughter who works on the farm. Saram and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava to support the family for 15 years. Their business struggles when the price of cassava drops and the labor fee increases. Saram has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and she is now leading a group of three female members to apply for another loan after her fourth and their third loans ended. As the leader, Saram will use her portion to buy fertilizers and to spend on land plowing. She hopes that this loan will help to raise the living standard of her family to another level.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en: Mwanamkuu is a 32-year-old married woman. She has four children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Hamisi and he works as a farmer. Mwanamkuu operates a grocery shop and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for five years and was previously employed to sell fish. Her primary customers are residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanamkuu will use the KES 15,000 loan to expand the business by purchasing sacks of tomatoes, onions and potatoes. Mwanamkuu aspires to open another store in the future. She joined Yehu because of the affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of  tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Mabongisi Ya Nkolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is the leader of the Community Bank named “Mabongisi ya Nkolo Plus” which is composed of 15 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Rebecca has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1999 in the same business. She operates a general store to the west of Kinshasa. She has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a cold room in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her about US $100 per week. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. Rebecca is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC, having eight times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying cans, sacks of rice and sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit. 

Thirty-five years old, Rebecca is married and the mother of four children, whose ages vary between 4 and 9 years old. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying cans, sacks of rice and sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit.

loans.name: Erneste

texts.en:
Erneste is 48 years old and is married with 2 children. He sells various goods such as: sugar, biscuits, salt, cooking oil etc. His business is open from 7 a.m to 5 p.m daily per week and he currently employs two people to help him.  He has 1 year of experience in this work. 

Erneste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy buy various goods such as: sugar, biscuits, salt, cooking oil etc for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as: sugar, biscuits, salt, cooking oil etc for re-sale.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 37 years old and is married. He sells various goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, cakes, pineapple etc.  His business is open from 8 a.m to 6 p.m daily per week and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Jean Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, cakes, pineapple etc for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, cakes, pineapple etc for re-sale.

loans.name: Azza

texts.en:
Azza is a 20-year-old single lady. She has two sisters and three brothers. Their mother has passed away, and their father has been taking care of them since then.

Azza is a university student majoring in Business Administration and Online Trading. She is now studying to get her bachelor’s degree and wants to continue to get a PhD certificate in the future.

Now she has applied for this loan in order to pay for her next semester registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester registration fees

loans.name: Misael

texts.en:
Misael is 46, married and has three school-age children.His family is peacefully living within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista.

Misael is engaged in a hog-raising business. He and his wife Mila aim to improve their living conditions so that they will become financially stable and give their children a better future. He is glad because his wife is helping him in generating income through her small community based store.

Due to financial shortage, Misael is asking for an additional capital of PHP 35,000 which will be use to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in his hog raising business. He hopes that he can further improve his hog raising business through his strong determination and patience.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in raising hogs

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is a 23-year-old single lady. She is the oldest among two sisters and one brother.

Lama is an English literature student, studying in a private university in northern Jordan.

She has applied for this loan to pay for her upcoming summer semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming summer semester fees

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis de 28 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Cartagena  y es el propietario de una panadería donde vende productos derivados de la harina de trigo, como panes de dulce, de queso, rellenos, pudines, etc, panadería que inició desde el año 2000, pero que solo hasta el año 2006, fue adquirida por Luis,  debido a que sus antiguos propietarios se la vendieron, para reunirse con sus familiares en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Luis viendo esta   oportunidad,  la compró apoyado por sus familiares y con unos ahorros, teniendo además como base su gran experiencia en los negocios familiares, en los que tradicionalmente había participado. Con su negocio simultáneamente cursó estudios de economía en la universidad y ahora se encuentra especializándose. Su meta es convertir esta unidad de negocios, en una fuente especializada de ingresos, poniendo en práctica todo lo aprendido en la universidad, pues quiere ser cada vez más,  un mejor empresario y generador de empleos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará un horno y materias primas en mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos e iniciar un proceso de diversificación de sus productos, pues está entusiasmado en elaborar pan árabe y productos de dieta, que son muy apetecidos en los hostales, hoteles y en general el sector turístico, que  se encuentra en crecimiento y esto es una gran oportunidad de invertir y hacer de su credikiva todo una inversión de éxito.
texts.en: Luis is 28 years old. He lives in the town of Cartagena and he is the owner of a bread bakery. He sells baked goods made from wheat flour auch as sweet bread, cheese bread, filled pastries, pudding, etc. The bakery was opened in 2000  but was only acquired by Luis in 2006 when the prior owners sold it so they could go live with family in Barranquilla. Luis saw the opportunity and bought it with the support of his family and some savings. He also a a the base of great experience with family businesses, which he has participated in according to tradition. While he runs his business he is also studying economics courses at the university and now it is his major. His goal is to convert this business unit in a specialized source of income, putting into practice everything he has learned at the university. He wants to become a better and better businessman and a job creator. Right now he is applying for a Kiva loan which he will use to buy an oven and raw materials in a greater volume, to earn discounts and start the process of diversifying his products. He is eager to start making pita bread and diet products, which are very much in demand in hostals, hotels and in general for tourists. This is a growth sector and a great opportunity to invest and make his Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy an oven and raw materials in a greater volume.

loans.name: Nasson

texts.en: Nasson is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 30,000 to purchase equipment for his new medical clinic. With the loan, he wants to purchase a microscope for use in his clinic. Nasson is giving thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for providing him with financial support to improve his living standards and his family's mode of living.

loans.use: To purchase a microscope for his clinic

loans.name: Sreythouk's Group

texts.en: Sreythouk is 24 years old and married with one daughter. She and her family live in a village in the Dambae district. Sreythouk and her husband have been farming rice for four years. She also runs a small grocery store to make additional income for the family. Sreythouk has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles while the other group member has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. Since their last loan ended, they are requesting another loan. As a leader, Sreythouk will use her portion to pay labor fees for land plowing and to purchase fertilizers. With this loan, she hopes to grow a good yield of crops and sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor fees

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik is going on with her sewing business. Her business allows her and her family to provide for themselves. Thanks to her first Kiva loan Sofik was able to buy аn overstitching machine and materials for her business. Also during the loan period she bought a netbook which she uses at her business as well. 
Recently Sofik’s customers number have increased as now she also fulfills a hospital’s orders for uniforms. Also she and her family are sewing bedclothes which they sell at wholesale markets.  
Sofik needs $1,500 loan to buy an ornament making machine and materials for her business. This machine will allow Sofik to diversify her production and thus to increase her future income.

loans.use: to buy an ornament making machine and materials for her business

loans.name: Dana

texts.en:
Dana is a 20-year-old single lady. She is the only sister for five boys.

Dana is a third year university student majoring in French language and literature. She wants to help her father who pays for the university fees, so she decided to apply for this educational loan to pay for the upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Marko

texts.en: Marko is a 38-year-old married man. He has 3 children and all are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Ann and she works at her retail shop. Marko operates a retail shop and sells his goods from home. He's worked in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are residents and his highest monthly expense is school fees. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Marko will use the Kes 30000 loan to add stock by buying bags of sugar, rice andcooking oil. Marko aspires to open a new kiosk and hire employees in the future. He joined Yehu for affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to add stock by buying bags of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Don Ismael es un nuevo cliente dentro de la institución por lo que es una persona que se puede platicar muy a gusto cuando le comentamos sobre su historia de éxito se emociono saber le tomaríamos la foto, es por eso que nos otorgo la entrevista en ella nos cuenta que tiene 37 años de edad vive en una comunidad mazahua que lleva por nombre San Agustín Mextepec está casado con la señora Guadalupe desde hace 16 años juntos han procreado 3 niños que van ala escuela.
Don Ismael tiene una zapatería desde hace que era niño el sabia como vender zapatos ya que sus padres fueron los fundadores del negocio y del mercado donde se venden los zapatos, pero ahora ya tiene un negocio propio que aunque viene de sus padres don Ismael es quien la atiende y se encarga de ella, Don Ismael esta solicitando el crédito para comprar más zapatos como, botas, tenis, zapatillas, sandalias, etc. para dama, caballero, niña y niños. Nos cuenta que le crédito le ayudara de mucho ya que podrá invertir mas en su negocio y no tendrá que preocuparse en mucho tiempo para para comprar mercancía.
Sin embargo la dificultad a la cual presenta es muchas veces no vende y por falta de dinero no puede invertir mas en su negocio también porque acaba de pasar por la enfermedad de su esposa de eco también cuenta que le gusta mucho el campo tenia borregos y un sembradío de nopales, aunque los borregos los vendió para solventar los gastos que se originaban acusa de la enfermedad de sus esposo.
Pero Don Ismael es una persona muy trabajador responsable y tiene metas como echarle mugas ganas a su negocio de zapatos ya que recuerda que algún tiempo le fue muy bien en la venta de sus zapatos y quisiera  vender como antes para mejorar la calidad de sus hijos y esposa considera que por falta de dinero no puede levantarse pero hará todo lo posible para levantarse nuevamente.
Es un padre de familia muy trabajador por lo que esta muy agradecido con frac y kiva por el apoyo que le brindan y esperar no quedar mal.
texts.en:
Ismael is a new client of the institution. He is a person who can talk very comfortably when we comment on his history of success. He was excited knowing we would take the picture. This is why he gave us the interview. In it he tells us that he is 37 years old and lives in a Mazahua community called San Agustín Mextepec. He has been married to Guadalupe for 16 years, and together they have 3 children who attend school. 

Ismael has a shoe store. From the time he was a child, he knew how to sell shoes, since his parents were the founders of the business and of the market where they sell the shoes. Now he has his own business. Although it comes from his parents, Ismael is the one who tends to it and is in charge of it. Ismael is asking for the loan in order to purchase more shoes such as boots, tennis shoes, high heels, sandals, etc., for women, men, girls, and boys. He tells us that the loan will help him a lot since he will be able to invest more in his business and he will not have to worry about buying merchandise for a long time.

Nevertheless, the difficulty he is facing is that many times he doesn't sell and due to lack of money, and also because he just went through the illness of his wife, he can't invest more in his business. Regarding this, he also says that he likes the countryside a lot and had sheep and a field of cactus, though he sold the sheep to cover the costs resulting from the illness of his wife.

But Don Ismael is a very hard-working and responsible person, and he has goals, such as to push hard with his shoe business, since he remembers that once his shoe sales were very good, and he would like to sell like before in order to improve the quality of life for his children and wife. He thinks that due to lack of money he will not be able to raise himself up, but he will do everything possible to raise himself up again. He is a very hard-working family man, for which reason he is very grateful to FRAC and Kiva for the support they give him, and he hopes not to end up looking badly.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, boots, and tennis shoes for men and women

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is from the town of Cordon. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Editha has been managing her boarding house business for three years. She has also involved herself in the agricultural business, particularly raising hogs. 

Editha has successfully repaid her previous loan and is asking for a larger loan in the amount of PHP 20,000. She will use her requested loan amount for the repair and maintenance of her boarding house business. 

She hopes that she can maintain her hog-raising and boarding house business to be able to provide her boarder with good quality service at a cheaper price. In this way, she could earn a bigger income to sustain the needs of her other two children.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her boarding house business.

loans.name: Moeurn's Group

texts.en: Moeurn, 54, is married and a mother of three. She and her family live in a village in the Dambae district. She has been planting cassava for several years. Moeurn also sells coffee to make additional income for the family. On average, the business earns her around 30,000 Cambodian Riel. Moeurn's group consists of two members and both have been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. They are now requesting another loan since their first loan ended. As a leader, Moeurn will use her portion to spend on land preparation such as plowing and to buy fertilizers. She hopes this loan will help to expand her business and allow her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Flores” está conformado por ocho integrantes, 3 hombres y 5 mujeres. El grupo pertenece a una comunidad que se llama "Cabecera" la cual está muy cerca del municipio. Se trata de una localidad pequeña donde la gente es muy trabajadora y responsable. Los integrantes que se encuentran en el grupo son personas recientes y no saben porque se eligió dicho nombre en un principio, ya que actualmente no hay ninguno de los integrantes fundadores. 

Doña Yolanda, representante del grupo, tiene 42 años de edad; está casada con el señor Quirino quien trabaja como mecánico, juntos han formado una familia con tres niños que asisten a la escuela. Doña Yolanda cuenta que tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 8 años pues nos cuenta que  no tenia nada que hace y fue como quiso iniciar su negocio  que ahora tiene como nombre “El patrón” esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar refrescos, leche, jabón, productos enlatados, etc. Pero nos cuenta que tiene una dificultad la cual es la competencia que tiene muy cercas aunque no se desanima ya que su tienda ya tiene mucho tempo y eso hace que le eche mas ganas, también nos cuenta que el crédito le ayuda mucho para invertir mas en su negocio de abarrotes, la meta que tiene doña Yolanda es seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y su familia, sus ganancia que obtienen de la tienda es para gastos del hogar, educación de sus niños entre otras cosas.

Doña Yolanda y el resto del grupo podrán invertir en sus negocios como don Cirilo en sus borregos, Felipa en venta de ropa, Natalia en cría y venta de pollos, Abelardo en sus tintes para estéticas, Guadalupe en productos de farmacia, José Luis para ropa de bebé y Ofelia en su tienda de abarrotes. Todos podrán invertir en sus negocios por lo que están muy agradecidos con Vision Fund (FRAC) y KIVA por el apoyo otorgado.
texts.en:
The Las Flores communal bank is comprised of eight members, three men and five women.  The group belongs to a community called Cabecera, which is very close to the municipality.  It is a small community where the people are very hard-working and responsible.  The members of the group have joined recently, and they do not know why that name was chosen in the beginning.  There are currently no founding members in the group.

Yolanda, age 42, represents the group.  She is married to Quirino, and he works as a mechanic.  Together they have made a family with three children, and the children go to school.  Yolanda has had a grocery store for eight years.  She tells us that she did not have anything to do, and so she wanted to start her business.  The business is called El Patrón.

This time she has requested a loan to buy soft drinks, milk, soap, and canned goods, etc.  She tells us that she does have difficulty, the nearby competition.  However, this does not discourage her.  She has had her store for a long time, and this makes her put her heart into it even more.

She also tells us the loan helps her a lot in order to invest in her grocery business.  Yolanda’s goal is to continue growing in her business and to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  The income she gets from the store is for household expenses and her children’s education, among other things.

Yolanda and the rest of the group will be able to invest in their businesses.  Cirilo will invest in sheep, Felipa in selling clothes, Natalia in raising and selling chickens, Abelardo in his dyes for a salon, Guadalupe in pharmacy products, José Luis in baby clothes, and Ofelia in her grocery store.

All of them will be able to invest in their business, and they are very grateful to Vision fund (FRAC) and Kiva for the support they provided.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk, soap, and canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Yohenis Del Carmen

texts.es: Yohenis de 25 años de edad vive en la ciudad e Cartagena, hermosa y tradicional ciudad en la costa norte de Colombia y ubicada a orillas del mar Caribe. Allí en este hermoso paisaje, tiene su propio negocio en el cual vende mercancía variada, como calzado, cosméticos, perfumes; idea negocio que nació desde que llegó hace 5 años, procedente de Barranquilla, (ciudad ubicada a 2 horas de Cartagena), con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos hoy en las edades de 6 y 4 años. Ella inicialmente compraba mercancía que vendía al detalle, mediante su distribución a crédito entre pocos clientes;  paulatinamente su mercado se extendió y con ello las oportunidades de invertir, por eso logró el acceso al mercado de productos que se ofrecen mediante guías especializadas, llegando a vender mediante catálogos, como hasta ahora lo hace. Sus principales productos son los cosméticos, la ropa, accesorios femeninos y masculinos e infantiles. En la actualidad la temporada le marca que debe invertir en ropa masculina, porque se acerca el día del padre, fecha mediante la cual planea tener bien surtido su negocio, para que las  familias encuentren todo lo que ellos sueñan, para agasajar al padre del hogar. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un  credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará perfumes, camisas, suéteres, calzado masculino, inversión que planea sea exitosa porque la hace dirigida a la temporada y teniendo en cuenta los pedidos de las mujeres quienes son las que mas hacen obsequios en este día y por consiguiente compran..
texts.en: Yohenis is 25 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena, a beautiful and traditional city on the north (Caribbean) coast of Colombia.  In this beautiful area,  Yohenis has her own business selling a variety of goods such as footwear, cosmetics and perfumes.  She decided to start her business when she arrived in this city from Barranquilla (a city two hours from Cartagena) five years ago together with her family (her husband and her two children who are now 6 and 4 years old).  Yohenis started off buying merchandise which she later sold retail.  She sold her products on credit to a small number of customers.  She gradually increased her customer base and also her opportunities for investment.  She started selling products through specialized guides and catalogs and still does this.  Yohenis' main products are cosmetics, clothing, and men's, women's and children's accessories.  She currently needs to invest in buying men's clothing because Father's Day is just around the corner and she needs to have a well-stocked business before this date so that families are able to find everything they need to please the father in their household.  Yohenis is applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to buy perfumes, shirts, sweaters and men's footwear.  She believes that this investment will be successful because it is aimed at a particular sales season and she has orders from women (who are the people who give the most gifts and buy the most on this day).

loans.use: to buy perfume, shirts, sweaters and men's footwear

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Rayito de Sol está conformado por nueve mujeres responsables y trabajadoras que se esmeran siempre por sacar adelante a su familia, estas mujeres viven en una comunidad llamada San Agustín Mextepec, donde la gente además de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz también se dedica al comercio es un lugar pequeño y muy tranquilo. El nombre del grupo se eligió ya que cuando las integrantes formaron el grupo, la representante de entonces tenía un grupo musical de niños llamado "Rayito de Sol".
Ahora quien es la representante del grupo es Doña Guadalupe de 42 años de edad; ella está casada con el señor Jesús desde hace 26 años quien también es comerciante. Juntos han formado una familia; sus hijos son: Omar quien se encuentra estudiando la universidad y una niña en primaria. Doña Lupita, como mejor la conocen, nos cuenta que ella se dedica a vender productos de jarcería desde hace 18 años; ella vende en el mercado casi todos los días de la semana solo descansa los miércoles, sábados y domingos. Doña Lupita inició esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y también con los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar únicamente vasos de licuadora, pilas, estropajos, fibras y cosas de plásticos. Comenta que el crédito le ayuda de mucho ya que así ella puede surtirse en lo que más necesita y así no preocuparse un buen rato por su mercancía.
