Sin embargo, Doña Lupita también explica que presenta dificultades como el no tener un lugar bien establecido para vender ya que por ahora, para vender tranquilamente tiene que buscar y pagar un lugar estable a los delegados del mercado. Por lo general todas las integrantes del grupo tienen esta dificultad y no lo pagan porque es muy caro. En temporadas de lluvia tampoco pueden vender durante mucho tiempo y es la temporada en la que les va un poco mal en sus ventas. Una de las metas que se ha propuesto es que su hijo termine su licenciatura de contaduría para que su calidad de vida mejore ya que si está dentro de sus posibilidades el ayudarlo, lo hará, aunque tenga que esforzarse más. Doña Lupita menciona que sus ganancias son de gran ayuda ya que cuando no tiene buenas ventas, toma de los ahorros para cubrir otros gastos como la educación de sus hijos, alimentación, calzado y también para realizar sus pagos con la instititución.

Doña Lupita y las integrantes del grupo están muy contentas y agradecidas con Kiva y Vision Fund (FRAC) por el apoyo que les ofrece ya que cada una de ellas podrá invertir en sus actividades. Carolina invertirá en contrloes remoto para televisison, DVD, etc. Doña Elvira surtirá su tienda, Doña Eufemia invertía en calcetas, Doña Juana invertirá en batas y mandiles, Doña Paula y Elena invertirán en vasos de licuadora y jarcería mientras que Josefina invertirá en chales y rebosos y Doña Florentina invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The “El Rayito de Sol” (Little Ray of Sunshine) group is composed of nine responsible, hardworking women who strive to move their families forward.  These women live in a community called San Agustín Mextepec where the people in addition to growing corn also work in commerce in a small, very tranquil setting.  The name of the group was chosen when the members formed the group.  The representative back then had a children’s musical group called “Rayito de Sol.”

The group representative now is Guadalupe, 42.  She’s been married to Jesús who is also a merchant for 26 years.  They have formed a family together.  Their children are Omar who is attending university and a daughter in elementary school.

Doña Lupita, as she’s better known, tells us that she’s been selling janitorial supplies for 18 years.  She sells in the market almost every day of the week; she only takes off Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays.  Doña Lupita started this business to help her husband with household expenses and also to help cover her children’s educational costs.

On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy blender jars, batteries, scouring pads, fibers and plastic items.  She comments that the loan will help her much because she will be able to stock up on what she needs the most and not have to worry about merchandise for a while.  However, Doña 
Lupita also explains that she does have the difficulty caused by not having a well-established place in which to sell because for now, in order to sell in peace, she has to find a space and pay the market delegates for it.  In general, not all the members of the group have this problem and they don’t pay it because it’s very expensive.

When it rains they can’t sell either and sometimes that’s for long periods of time and she does poorly with her sales then.  One of the goals she’s set is that her son finishes his bachelor’s degree in accounting so that his quality of life can improve and if it’s within the realm of her possibility to help him, she’ll do so even if it means striving harder.

Doña Lupita mentions that her profits are of great help to her because when sales are poor she draws from savings to cover other expenses like her children’s schooling, food, shoes and also to make her payments to the institution.

Doña Lupita and the group members are very happy and grateful to Kiva and Vision Fund (FRAC) for the support they give because each one of them will be able to invest in her activities.  Carolina will invest in remote controls for television sets, DVD’s, etc., Doña Elvira will stock her store, Doña Eufemia will buy socks, Doña Juana will buy robes and aprons, Doña Paula and Elena will buy blender jars and janitorial supplies while Josefina will invest in shawls and ‘rebozos’ [Mexican shawls] and Doña Florentina will invest in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy spoons, plates, blender jars, etc.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Mu'ssha Group

texts.es:
Don Venancio tiene 70 años de edad y es originario de una población pintoresca y con una gran cultura como la mazahua, él es parte del grupo llamado Mu´ssha dice que eligieron el nombre porque antes invertían en borregos y es lo que significa esa palabra en lengua mazahua. Él es carpintero desde hace mas de 20 años, dice que por falta de un trabajo estable un amigo le enseño a como trabajar la madera para que tuviera un trabajo más seguro, el platica que hace mesas, sillas, bancos, puertas, ventanas de madera y muchas otras cosas más. Dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que de ahí a podido mantener y sacar  adelante a su familia. El está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de madera, pegamento, clavos para poder realizar sus creaciones, dice que a el le gustaría tener un local en la ciudad donde pudiera tener su taller y poder vender sus creaciones, dice que cuando creaciones va y las vende en diferentes poblaciones y que las vende a un mejor precio, el está agradecido con el crédito por que le ayudara a tener ganancias y asi poder darle a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida y le podrá ayudar a comprarle los medicamentos que ella ocupa ya que esta enfermita.

Los otros cinco integrantes del grupo se llaman Aurelia, Josefa, Elpidio, Aurelia y Maria Eduviges ellos invertirán en sus negocios de compra y venta de pan, artículos para abarrotes, material para hacer prendas artesanales, en compra de diferentes dulces para venderlos fuera de las escuelas y en compra de bisutería en madera y chaquira.
texts.en:
Venancio, 70, is from a picturesque village with a great culture, the Mazahua.  He’s part of a group called “Mu’ssha.”  He says that they chose that name because they used to invest in sheep and that’s what that word means in the Mazahua tongue.  

He’s been a carpenter for over twenty years.  He says that because of the lack of employment a friend taught him how to work the wood so that he’d have a more secure job.  He relates that he makes tables, chairs, benches, doors and windows as well as many other things out of wood .  He says that he likes his work very much because he’s been able to support and move his family ahead through it.

He’s asking for a loan to buy wood, glue and nails to make his creations.  He says that he’d like to have a space in the city to have his shop and be able to sell his creations.  He says that he sells his creations in various towns and that he sells them for very good prices.

He is grateful for the loan because it will help him earn profits to give his wife a better quality of life and to buy her the medicine she needs because she’s sick.

The other five group members are called Aurelia, Josefa, Elpidio, Aurelia and Maria Eduviges.  They will invest in their businesses of buying and selling bread, grocery items, supplies to make traditional clothing, to buy various candies to sell outside schools and to buy wood and beaded costume jewelry.

loans.use: to buy furniture making supplies.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está soltera,  vive con sus dos hijos    actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende asistir la finca y comprar insumos como herbicidas y  fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella tiene pensado asistir la propiedad la cual cuenta con un poco de pasto para ganado y un poco de café para poder obtener el mejor provecho  y generar  el máximo de ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Susana is 26 years old and single.  She lives with her two children.  Susana plans to use her loan to carry out work on her farm and to buy supplies such as herbicides and sprays.  She will also pay laborers.  Susana plans to work on her property which consists of a little pasture for her livestock and a little coffee.  She would like to make the most of this land, earn as much profit as possible and obtain a better quality of life and financial stability.

This is the first loan that Susana has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to carry out work on her farm and buy supplies

loans.name: Margarita Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Margarita, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y otro de 10 años el mismo que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda en su casa, allí vende de todo un poco como: helados hechos por ella misma, hielo, sodas, artículos de bazar, ciertas medicinas entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que a ella le gusta tener de todo para satisfacer a sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 o hasta más tarde, allí pasa el tiempo y cuando su hijo llega de clases tiene tiempo para ayudarle en sus tareas y es por eso que más le agrada su negocio porque le da tiempo para todo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, útiles escolares, sodas y productos para elaborar sus helados. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 12 años y le gusta porque los créditos le han facilitado su vida. 

Su meta es darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Members of Communal Bank María Auxiliadora meet in the Sequita Perish which belongs to Montecristi, a prosperous canton of Manabi. The bank is full of hard-working, dedicated, people who are proud of their roots. The Sequita is a parish where its inhabitants are honest, and dedicate their time to working and their families.

Here we met Mrs. Margarita who is 43 years old, married, with 2 children, one who is grown up and the other who is 10 and still in school. Her husband is a chauffeur.

Our friend has a store within her home where she sells a little bit of everything such as: homemade popsicles, ice, sodas, tools, medicine, etc. She likes to offer a little bit of everything to satisfy her clients. She works every day from 6am to 8pm and sometimes later. She spends most of her day there and when her son comes home from school she has time to help him with his homework. What she likes most about her job is that it allows her to have time to do all she needs to do.

She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, school supplies, sodas, and materials to make popsicles. She has been with this communal bank for more than 12 years and she likes it for the credits they offer to make her life easier.

Her goal is to offer her small son the best.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, school supplies, sodas, and materials to make popsicles.

loans.name: Danika Marina

texts.es:
Danika es una joven de 20 años de edad, la cual es muy entusiasta y trabajadora, desde pequeña sus padre le enseñaron el valor del trabajo, por ello ella es muy trabajadora y sobre todo humilde, Danika vive al lado de su esposo en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso y acogedor, en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, plátano, maíz, entre otros. Danika solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero siempre le gusto la repostería y por ello llevo cursos de repostería y decoración y a raíz de ello se animo por tener su  negocio de venta de tortas, dulces, bocaditos, entre otros. Al principio le fue un poco difícil porque le daba un poco de vergüenza el salir a las calles a ofrecer sus productos, pero con el ánimo que le brindaba su esposo quien también es su mano derecha; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón para la preparación de los dulces.

Danika está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un  horno, piletas para tortas y accesorios para la decoración de las tortas, así de esta manera ella podrá tener los utensilios necesarios para la preparación de sus tortas y dulce y así podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad se mas grande sueño:” Tener la carrera de gastronomía”.
texts.en:
Danika is 20 years old and very hard-working. At a young age her parents taught her about work ethic which is why she's hard-working and above all humble. Danika lives with her husband in Imperial city which is characterized for having a warm and hot climate. It is also known for agriculture specifically cotton, banana, and corn cultivation among others. Danika only studied until high school but she always liked baking so she took baking and decoration classes then opened her own business where she sells sandwiches, candies, snacks, etc. In the beginning it was a little difficult for her because she was too shy to go out and offer her products but with her husband’s support, who is also her right hand, was able to do so. Her business is going well because she treats her clients well and prepares very tasty treats.

Danika is thankful for the Kiva lenders because through them she will be able to buy an oven, sink for sandwiches, and accessories to decorate the sandwiches. She will have the necessary tools to make the sandwiches and sweets to increase profits which will help her make her biggest dream a reality: “Become a cook.”

loans.use: buy an oven, sink for sandwiches, and accessories to decorate the sandwiches

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive junto a su familia en una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, ubicado en la región Piura. En esa zona, la mayoría de centros poblados solo cuenta con el servicio de luz eléctrica y viven en viviendas bastante precarias y humildes. 

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, ella cría sus ovejas en corrales situados cerca a su vivienda y cuando estas alcanzan un buen tamaño y peso las comercializa entre sus vecinos y los negociantes de la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con un pequeño terreno agrícola en donde tiene sembrado limón, el cual cosecha semanalmente y lo comercializa en el mercado del distrito.

Ella se vale de estas actividades para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Su cónyuge se dedica también a la agricultura y posee un terreno en donde siembra mango. 

Primitva desea adquirir fertilizantes para mejorar la producción de su parcela de limón y también desea adquirir alimento para engordar a sus animales y percibir mayores ingresos en sus ventas. Por ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Ella ya ha tenido un crédito en Kiva y agradece a las personas que en su momento le apoyaron.
texts.en:
Primitiva is 42 years old, married, and is in charge of 3 children. She lives with her family in a rural area of the agricultural district of Tambogrande, located in Piura region. In this area, the majority of the towns only have electricity and very poor and humble homes.

She raises sheep for a living. She raises them in corrals located close to her home and once they grow a certain size and weight she sells them to neighbors and merchants in her area. In addition, she has a small piece of land where she grows lemons, picks them, then sells in a local market.

She does all of this work to help her husband support the family financially. Her husband is also a farmer who owns a piece of land and grows mangos.

Primitiva needs fertilizer to increase her production of lemons and also needs feed to fatten up her animals and make more profits. This is why she is requesting a 1500 Peruvian soles loan. She has had a loan with Kiva before and is thankful for the people who supported her during that time.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosario Nathali

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 18 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Parcona, este distrito se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, se le conoce también por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón. Cuando Rosario tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear pero le gusta más comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cal es el riquísimo “Tallarín rojo”. Con mucho empeño termino de estudiar la carrera de administración, pero debido a que no encontraba empleo decidió tener su negocio.

Con el día a día Rosario trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida en especial uno de los platos típicos más ricos de nuestro país el cual es la riquísima Chanfainita y también patasca, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene muy buena sazón para la preparación de los platillos y por ello sus clientes siempre regresan.

Rosario está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar una mejoras en su local como pintado, refracción de techo, colocación de mayólica en el piso, de esta manera su local será mas cómodo para los clientes y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Rosario is 18 years old. She lives in the district of Parcona. This district is noted for having a warm climate. It is also known for its agriculture, especially cotton cultivation. When Rosario has some free time, she likes very much to take walks, but she most likes to eat one of her favorite dishes, the delicious "Tallarín Rojo" (pasta with red sauce). With much effort, she finished studying an administration course, but since she couldn't find work she decided to have a business.

Day to day, Rosario works in her business selling food, especially the most tasty typical dishes of our country, which are the delicious Chanfainita (cow's lung, potato, and seasoning) and also patasca (pork, sheep, or beef head stew). She works about 8 hours a day and can wait on up to 40 customers in a day. She thinks that her work is going well for her because she has very good seasoning for preparing the dishes, and due to this her customers always return.

Rosario is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to make some improvements to her premises such as painting, roof repair, and installation of tile flooring. In this way, her premises will be more comfortable for the customers, and she will be able to improve her income. This will allow her to continue fighting every day in order to make her biggest dream a reality: to have her own house.

loans.use: to improve her premises (painting, roof repair, installation of tile flooring, among others)

loans.name: Pequeños Gigantes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Pequeños Gigantes, esta conformado por seis personas indígena, originarios de la ciudad de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca, un lugar rico en artesanías.
Una de las artesanías de  este lugar es la elaboración de pulseras, aretes, elaborados de vidrio cortado.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo  es la señora Victoria, quien se caracteriza por ser una señora, alegres, humilde  y amable.
Dice que se dedica a la venta de productos naturistas, pulseras, aretes y collares y también a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años.
Cuenta que obtuvo su negocio gracias a fundacion ya  que con su ayuda compro productos naturistas y con sus ganancias pudo comprar aretes y pulseras y con sus ganancias de las pulseras  y aretes compro ropa para la venta.
Este muy feliz ya que a podido engrandecer su negocio con el paso de del tiempo.
Dice que va a  las comunidades vecinas a ofrecer a  sus mercancías y las vende en pagos ya que la mayoría de  sus clientas son personas de bajo recursos.
Una de las cosas más lindas que le han pasado es tener su negocio y contar con  fundacion Realidad ya que  con su ayuda va a comparar  más productos naturistas para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Le da las gracias a fundacion  por ayudar  a la gente humilde y de bajos recursos.
Las otras integrantes  del grupo son:

Yolanda Avilania- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Leticia- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Jesús Felipe- se dedica a la venta calzado.
Leonardo Javier- se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Baltazar Teodoro- se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Todos ellos le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a todas las personas trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This group is called “Pequeños Gigantes” (Little Giants) and it’s made up of six indigenous people from the city of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca, a place that’s rich in crafts.  One of the crafts from this place is making bracelets and earrings out of cut glass.

One of the group members is Victoria who is noted for being a cheerful, humble, kind woman.  She says that she works selling natural products, bracelets, earrings and necklaces and that she’s also been selling clothes for three years.

She relates that she obtained her business thanks to the Fundación because with their help she bought natural products and with her profits she was able to buy earrings and bracelets and from profits from the bracelets and earrings she bought clothes to sell.  She’s very happy that she’s been able to expand her business as time has gone by.  She says that she goes to neighboring communities to offer her merchandise and that she sells it in installments since most of her customers are people of low income.

One of the nicest things that have happened to her is being able to have her business and to be able to rely on Fundación Realidad because with their help she will buy more natural products to sell at wholesale and retail.   She thanks the Fundación for helping humble, low income people.

The other group members are:

Yolanda Avilania- sells shoes.
Leticia- sells clothes.
Jesús Felipe- sells shoes
Leonardo Javier- sells fruit and vegetables.
Baltazar Teodoro- sells clothes.

All of them thank the Fundación for helping all working people.

loans.use: to buy natural products to sell.

loans.name: Najma Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Najma bibi has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. He is involved in the animal sales business. He buys young animals from animal markets, raises them and then sells them to his customers.
  
Najma is a very caring and dedicated lady. She provides full support to her husband by taking care of his animals. 

She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder daughter is involved in sewing work and her elder son helps his father in his animal sales business. Her other two children are getting an education and read in the 10th and 8th standard. 

With the loan investment, her husband will purchase animals (goats) to raise and re-sell. She hopes that with this investment, his business will continue to prosper so that he can offer even better service to his customers.

Note: One of the members has a sewing business. That's why she is showing her work in this picture.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Sot's Group

texts.en: As a parent of four, all of whom are still in school, Sot and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava to support the family for 12 years. Sot lives with her family in a village located in the  Dambae district. Sot has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and the other group member is new to VisionFund. Acting as a group leader and after her previous obligations have been paid, Sot is leading a group of two members to apply for another loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pay for family expenses. Sot hopes this loan will allow her to make more income from selling her crops and, therefore, her family can live in better conditions and her children can be in school until they finish their education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for family expenses

loans.name: Alba Rocio

texts.es: Alba de 49 años de edad  vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14, en la ciudad de Cartagena, donde se dedica a la venta de pescado, frutas  tropicales y dulces. Desde el año 1984 cuando llegó a la ciudad de Cartagena, se dedicó a vender productos del mar, para lograr apoyar el sustento de su hogar, posteriormente una comerciante, le dio la oportunidad que vendiera la ropa que comercializaba y allí le fue muy bien. Empezó a generar dos ingresos y cuando conformó una clientela sólida y un pequeño capital se independizó.  Su mayor fortaleza en su desempeño de negocios es su espíritu independiente, pues desde niña así lo mostraba a sus padres y esto se ve reflejado en la alegría que le generan las actividades comerciales, en las que se ha dedicado a vender muchos productos. Desde hace 4 años se consolidó en la venta de pescado y por eso organizó su infraestructura con cavas que compra surtidas de pescado de rio en el mercado de la ciudad y distribuye entre sus clientes, aprovechando los buenos precios que le ofrecen sus proveedores, lo cual le permite generar utilidades y poder invertir nuevamente, como lo hizo posteriormente, cuando agregó un nuevo negocio una chasa, donde vende dulces y frutas naturales, producto  de cada  cosecha. Actividades con las que ha complementado efectivamente los ingresos de su hogar, pues su sueño y gran desafío es lograr el completo bienestar de su familia y llevar a sus hijos a que sean exitosos, en lo que emprendan.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, porque cada vez mas, quiere fortalecer sus tres negocios y con este financiamiento espera comprar pescado, dulcería y frutas a un precio mucho mas especial que el acostumbrado, pues cuenta con una capacidad de compra mayor con su credikiva, que es lo que hace que esta inversión sea exitosa y por eso cuando vende los productos es muy competitiva y gana cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Alba, 49, lives with her spouse and two children who are 14 years of age in the city of Cartagena where she works selling fish, tropical fruit and candy.  Since 1984 when she arrived in Cartagena, she’s been selling products from the sea to support her home.  Later a merchant gave her the opportunity of selling clothes that he sold and she did very well.  She started earning two incomes and when she had a solid customer base and a little capital she became independent.  Her greatest strength in her business development is her independent spirit because since she was a girl she’d show this to her parents and this is reflected in the joy she gets from commercial activities that she’s engaged in selling many products.

Four years ago she consolidated into selling fish and she organized her infrastructure with cases that she buys stocked with assorted river fish from the market in the city and then sells among her customers taking advantage of the good prices her suppliers give her which allows her to generate profits to reinvest again like she’s done previously when she added a new business with a stand where she sells candy and natural fruit from each harvest, activities with which she’s effectively complemented her household’s income because her great challenge is attaining her family’s total wellbeing and to see her children become successful at whatever they undertake.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her three businesses more each time and plans to use this loan to buy fish, candy and fruit at a much more special price than usual because she has the capacity to buy at wholesale with her Kiva loan which will make the investment successful and this is why she’s very competitive when she sells the products and earns more each time.

loans.use: to buy fish, candy and fruit.

loans.name: Version Plus Group

texts.en:
Philo is the chairwoman of a Community bank named “Version Plus”, which is composed of eight micro entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Philo is 45 years old, married and the mother of four children whose ages vary between 9 and 19 years old. All of them go to school. Philo runs a general store and sells loaves of bread. She has been in business since 2005. After learning through her friend about Hope’s loan program, she decided to join one of its groups in November 2005. Philo has already received 22 loans from Hope DRCongo that she repaid correctly. Currently, her business generates a profit of about US $190 per week. With her next loan, she is planning to purchase 20 bags of loaves of bread to increase the inventory of her business. Philo’s dream is to become the loaf of bread provider in her environment. She runs her business in the southwestern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to purchase bread to sell

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es: Sindy  es una joven de 25 años de edad muy creativa, la muestra es que se desempeña en un arte al que le agrega valor con sus acabados: ella tiene un taller de confecciones en su propia casa, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 8 años y de dos meses de nacido; con ellos  sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas y profesionales de bien. Por eso se esmera trabajando en su pequeño taller, donde trabaja a todo costo y fabrica multiusos y presta su servicio persona a persona cuando estas así lo requieren. Sindy  tiene una máquina dese hace muchos años, que la ha acompañado y tiene un gran valor sentimental, pues con ella ha logrado sus principales  ingresos;  pero ella tiene un gran desafío y es que permanentemente debe estarla revisando y reparando, porque le atrasa su producción y gasta mucho dinero en esto. Ella sabe que para seguir creciendo y hacer más competitivo su negocio debe cambiarla, porque mejorará sus tiempos productivos y porque no  debe seguir quedando mal ante  su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará una maquina industrial, en la planea tener mucho éxito, porque su producción será mas efectiva y sus clientes estarán mas satisfechos y tendrán menos devoluciones de prendas. De tal manera que su credikiva sería de mucha utilidad y una alternativa de sostenibilidad de su negocio, pues se encuentra muy feliz y agradecida, porque su familia fue beneficiada con la adquisición de la casa  en Ciudad Bicentenario, proyecto de vivienda sostenible, liderado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su programa Sueños y oportunidades.
texts.en:
Sindy is a 25 year old young woman who is very creative.  The example of this is that she works in an art that she adds value to with her finishings.  She has a dressmaking shop in her own house.  She lives in her house with her husband and their two children, ages 8 and 2 months.  She dreams of them becoming successful people and good professionals.  That is why she does her best working in her small shop.  She works there at all cost making multi-use garments and lending her services from person to person when they need them.

Sindy has had a machine that has accompanied her for many years, and it has a great sentimental value. With the machine she has managed to get her first earnings.  However, she has a great challenge.  She always needs to check and repair it.  This slows down her production, and she spends a lot of money on this.

She knows that in order to continue growing and being more competitive she needs to change machines.   This will improve her production time; she needs to stop looking bad to her customers.

That is the reason she turns to a Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy an industrial machine with which she plans to be very successful because her production will be more effective, her customers will be more satisfied, and there will be fewer refunds for clothes. 

In this way her Kiva loan will be very beneficial and an alternative to sustain her business.  She is very happy and grateful because her family benefited from the acquisition of the house in Ciudad Bicentenario. This is a project in sustainable housing led by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in their Dreams and Opportunities program.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta tiene 67 años, está casada y tiene dos hijas. Actualmente vive en la casa de su hija menor en la ciudad de Santa Ana, Chanchamayo.
Ella es una mujer de gran coraje y fuerza, se viene recuperando de una operación a los ojos, y ya se reincorporó a su trabajo. Se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas hace más de 15 años.  Empezó vendiendo sus propios productos, ya que cuenta con parcelas de terrenos donde cultiva frutas cítricas como naranjas. Se dio cuenta que las ventas eran rentables, por eso empezó a comprar frutas como papayas, piñas, paltas, plátanos, etc., de otros productores y abrió un puesto de venta de frutas en el mercado mayorista. “Estos días lo que se vende mejor son los cítricos como naranjas y mandarinas”, comenta. Le gusta su actividad, porque conoce mucha gente y entabla amistad con sus clientes. Su meta es consolidar mejor su negocio ampliando sus ventas.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y agradece la oportunidad depositada. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Amigos Capelinos” y le agrada compartir actividades con compañeras.
Con el dinero solicitado comprará frutas al por mayor, especialmente naranjas y mandarinas, las que comercializará en su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 67 years old, married, and has two daughters.  She currently lives in her younger daughter's house in the city of Santa Ana, Chanchamayo.

Vicenta is a courageous, strong woman.  She is recovering from an operation on her eyes and has already gone back to work.  Her business is buying and selling fruit and she has been in this business for 15 years.  She started out selling her own produce as she has farmland where she grows citrus fruit such as oranges.  Realizing that these sales were profitable, she started buying additional fruit such as papaya, pineapples, avocados, bananas, etc. from other producers and opened a fruit stall in the wholesale market.  "What sells best right now are citrus fruits such as oranges and mandarins" she comments.  Vicenta loves her business because she gets to meet a lot of people and makes friends with her customers.  Her goal is to better consolidate her business and expand her sales.

This is Vicenta's first loan from MFP and she is grateful for this opportunity. She is a member of the 'Los Amigos Capelinos' community bank.  She enjoys sharing activities with her fellow group members.

Vicenta will use the money she has requested to buy fruit wholesale, especially oranges and mandarins, which she will sell from her stall.

loans.use: to buy oranges and mandarins to sell

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 23-year-old single guy. Both of his parents are retired public sector employees.

He is a 4th-year university student who is majoring in accounting. He has applied to this loan to pay for his semester fees so he can graduate as soon as possible and find a suitable job in his field.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy tables, chairs, beers, among other things

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en: Duaa is a 21-year-old single lady with two younger brothers. After their father passed away, they have been living on their mother’s retirement salary. Now Duaa has applied for this educational loan to pay for her semester fees as she majors in Finance and Banking.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Banazeer

texts.en:
Banazeer is a 23-year-old single lady. She is the oldest among seven brothers and sisters.

Banazeer goes to a private university; she is studying to become a school teacher. She has applied for this loan to pay for her registration fees.

loans.use: To pay for her registration fees

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is married with two school-going children. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rental bills and food for his family.

For the past four years, Jackson has been operating a grocery. He sells to his neighbors and town-dwellers. He faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in his business. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes

loans.name: Buthaina

texts.en:
Buthaina is a 50-year-old conservative woman. She asked her son to take her place in the photo.

Buthaina has four sons and a daughter; the youngest is Bilal, who appears in the photo.

Bilal is in his early 20s. He attends a private university (where his father works) to get a bachelors degree in graphic design.
 
Now, Buthaina wants to pay for her son's semester fees, so she has applied for this educational loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's semester fees

loans.name: Irubgu

texts.en:
Irubgu is married and has one child who is still young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Irubgu has operated a barber shop business for the past five years; his potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He also makes tea for sale to earn additional profit. Irubgu's major business challenge is competition from other barber shop operators in the area. Irubgu dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.

Irubgu plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase a hair cutting machine for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a hair cutting machine

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled, 22 years old, is a single man who has four younger sisters. Khaled works in a private company to be able to help support the family and himself. At the same time, he attends university to get a bachelor's degree to support his position in the company. Khaled has applied for this loan to pay for his university fees to graduate as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is single and lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Arnold has operated a bicycle repair business; his potential clients are bicycle riders in the area. Arnold has requested a loan to purchase spare parts for repairing bicycles. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for repairing bicycles

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electric bills.

Zena operates a clothes-selling business. She sells door-to-door to her neighbors and passerby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Zena is applying for a KES 25,000 loan to purchase bundles of lesos to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of lesos to sell

loans.name: Maryanne

texts.en:
Maryanne is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, Maryanne has owned a kindergarten school, whereby children from the neighboring school attend her school. Her major challenge is parents' delayed school fee payments. Her major dream is to expand to accommodate more pupils. Maryanne plans to use this loan to purchase stationery for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stationery for the school.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, Tatu has owned real estate houses, renting to tenants. Her major business challenge is delayed payments by clients who take on credit. Tatu dreams of expanding and establishing more real estate houses in the future. Tatu plans to use this KES 25,000 loan to furnish and renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to furnish and renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: La Bendición Group

texts.es:
La Bendición es un grupo integrado por 13 personas alegres, amables y trabajadoras cada una de ellas tiene una actividad economica, ellos son: Gabina venta de refrescos, Dominga  venta de refrescos, Patricia venta de antojitos mexicanos, Olivia venta de antojitos mexicanos, Alfredo venta de abarrotes, Elizabet venta de dulces, Julieta Francisca venta de ropa, Lucero venta de articulos del hogar, Fernando cría de cerdos, Lidia  venta de dulces, Norma venta de refrescos, Pedro  venta de tortillas y Adriana venta de dulces. Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de Tetela en la cual hay una zona arqueológica.

Julieta tiene 28 años, solo estudio la secundaria, está casada con Vicente, que trabaja la tierra. Tienen 5 hijos que están en la escuela primaria. Julieta vende ropa de hombres y mujeres. Se inició en este negocio hace cuatro años porque ella quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogares. Ella es consciente de la gravedad de la situación económica actual y sabe que tienen que trabajar los dos para poder brindar a sus hijos mejores oportunidades. 

Para vender su ropa, Julieta visita a muchos hogares en Tetela. Ella muestra las prendas a sus cleintes y, si tiene suerte, vende algunos artículos. Muchos de sus clientes le hacen encargos de ropa, y ella con gusto los surte y posteriomente los entrega y recibe el pago por la mercancía. Con un préstamo, Julieta va a comprar nuevas camisas, pantalones, blusas, shorts, vestidos y muchas otras prendas para vender. Ella desea desarrollar su negocio para poder pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
"La Bendición" is a communal bank comprised of 13 cheerful, kindhearted and hardworking people. Each one of them is in a type of business, and they are: Gabina, who sells refreshments; Dominga, who sells refreshments; Patricia, who sells antojitos (a typical Mexican snack); Olivia, who sells antojitos; Alfredo, who sells groceries; Elizabet, who sells sweets; Julieta Francisca, who sells clothing; Lucero, who sells home products; Fernando, who raises pigs; Lidia, who sells sweets; Norma, who sells refreshments; Pedro, who sells tortillas; and Adriana, who sells sweets. This communal bank is located in the community of Tetela, where there's an archeological site.
Julieta is 28 years old and only studied up to high school. She's married to Vicente, who works in farming. They have five children who attend primary school. Julieta sells men and women's clothing. She got her start in the business four years ago, because she wanted to help her husband pay for their home expenses. She's aware of the dire state of the current economy and she knows that they both have to work in order to be able to give their children better opportunities.
Julieta visits many homes in Tetela in order to sell her clothing. She shows the garments to her customers and, if she's lucky, she sells some products. Many of her customers make orders for clothing, and she gladly stocks up, then later delivers the merchandise and collects the payment. With the loan Julieta will purchase new shirts, pants, blouses, shorts, dresses and many other garments for selling. She wishes to make progress in her business so that she can pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase new shirts, pants, blouses, shorts and dresses.

loans.name: Adella

texts.en:
Adella is married and has three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member (a niece). Adella resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

For the past 11 years, Adella has operated a retail shop business. She also generates additional income by hiring out her motorcycle. Adella has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, jerrycans of cooking oil and bags of bread. Adella sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of commodities from Kikuubo in Kampala to her shop. Adella hope to see her business expand to a wholesale shop and to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil and bread

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest expenses are food and school fees.

For the past fourteen years, Joyce has operated a mahamri (dumplings) sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Joyce also has a dairy farming business, which provides her with another source of income. Joyce's major challenge is seasonality; during dry hot seasons, it becomes difficult to get Napier grass for her dairy cows. 

Joyce is requesting a loan of KES 25,000 to establish a stall at the market to sell her mahamri (dumplings). She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to establish a stall at the market to sell her mahamri (dumplings).

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, Joyce has operated a maize milling business from her home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is price fluctuations of maize.  Joyce plans to use this KES 25,000 loan to purchase sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Merquit

texts.es:
Merquit tiene 39 años, vive con el padre sus cuatro hijos, actualmente vive con tres de ellos, los de 17, 7 y 4 años. Su casa es propia y se ubica en el distrito de San Ramón, Chanchamayo.
Ella sabe que el dinero que su pareja trae a la casa no es suficiente cuando se tiene cuatro hijos. Por eso, hace un año que se dedica a la preparación de comida rápida como: anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de res y de carne de pollo), hamburguesas, pollo y papas fritas, y algunas bebidas. Para esto, acondicionó un pequeño espacio fuera de su vivienda, donde atiende a sus comensales, todos los días a partir de las 5 de la tarde. “Me va bien, ya llevo como un año, y ya me conocen los clientes”, menciona. Una de sus metas es ampliar el negocio y abastecer su puesto con sillas y mesas, pero primero quiere captar más clientes y probar con la preparación de otras comidas.

Es la primera vez que Merquit accede a un crédito con MFP, por eso se siente agradecida por el préstamo. Pertenece al banco comunal “Rosas y Claveles” y se siente a gusto de formar parte de un grupo sólido de personas optimistas.
Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar insumos como: carne de pollo, corazón de res, papas, menudencia de res y pollo, para la preparación de sus comidas. También comprará bebidas.
texts.en:
Merquit is 39 years old. She lives with the father of her 4 children. Currently they live with 3 of them. They are 17, 7, and 4 years old. They own their house which is located in the district of San Ramón, Chanchamayo.

She knows that the money that her partner brings home is not sufficient for 4 children. This is why a year ago she started preparing rapid food such as anticuchos (kebabs made with beef hearts and chicken), hamburgers, chicken and fries, and some soft drinks. To do this she outfitted a little space outside her home, where she serves her diners every day from 5:00PM in the afternoon. “I’m doing well, for this last year, and the clients already know me,” she says. One of her goals is to expand the business and supply her business with chairs and tables, but first I want to capture more clients and try to prepare some other dishes.

It is the first time that Merquit has asked for a loan through MFP, so she feels thankful for the loan. She belongs to the communal bank “Rosas and Claveles” [Roses and Carnations] and she likes being a part of a united group of optimistic people. With the money from the loan she will be able to buy supplies such as: chicken, beef hearts, potatoes, and beef and chicken giblets, for the preparation of her dishes. She will also buy soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of her dishes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 38 años, es soltera y madre de dos hijos de 20 y 15 años, con quienes vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Chanchamayo.
Ella es una mujer que ha aprendido a trabajar en muchas actividades. Cuando se separó del padre de sus hijos tenía que hacerse cargo de proteger y mantenerlos. Hace 4 años que se dedica a la preparación de comida. Realiza esta actividad dos veces al mes y prepara comidas al horno y a la parrilla, para ello utiliza carnes de trucha, pollo, carnero, res, cerdo, etc. 
Su modalidad de venta es peculiar. Ella manda elaborar tarjetas o tickets, los que vende días antes de entregar los alimentos, “tarjeta aceptada es tarjeta pagada”, es su lema.
En estos años trabajando en esa labor, menciona que le va bien, y sí es rentable, solo depende de cómo venda o coloque las tarjetas. En cada quincena ofrece 50 platos y cada uno lo vende a 7 soles. “En estas actividades también vendo gaseosas, cervezas y golosinas, por eso es rentable”, comenta. A Gladys le gusta cocinar y le agrada la idea de ganarse la vida con lo que sabe hacer, por eso anhela abrir un puesto estable al lado del hospital estatal. Allí piensa ofrecer distintos platos de comida y bebidas.

Esta es la primera vez que Gladys accede a un crédito de MFP. Ingresó al banco comunal “Los Amigos Capelinos”, cuyas compañeras tienen intereses en común y se solidarizan entre todas.
Con el dinero que solicita podrá adquirir ollas, platos, utensilios de cocina, bancas, una mesa y otros para iniciar la implementación de su nuevo puesto al costado del hospital.
texts.en:
Gladys is 38 years old.  She is single and the mother of two children who are 20 and 15 years old.  She lives with her children in her own home which is located in Chanchamayo district.

Gladys is a woman who has learned to work in a number of business activities.  When she separated from her children's father, she had to take charge of protecting and providing for them herself.  She has been providing a meal service for four years now.  She carries out this work twice a month and prepares her meals in the oven and on the grill.  She uses trout, chicken, lamb, beef and pork.

Gladys' sales method is unusual.  She makes cards or tickets which she sells days before delivering her meals.  "An accepted card is a paid-for card" is her motto.  Every fortnight she offers 50 dishes and sells each one for 7 soles.  "At these events I also sell soda, beer and candies because it is profitable" she says.  Gladys enjoys cooking and enjoys making a living from what she knows how to do.  For this reason, she would like to open a stable stall outside the state hospital.  There she plans to offer a number of different dishes and drinks.

This is the first time that Gladys has requested a loan from MFP.  She is a member of the 'Los Amigos Capelinos' community bank.  Her fellow group members have a lot in common and are supportive of each other.  Gladys will use the money she has requested to buy pans, dishes, cooking utensils, benches, a table and other supplies so that she can fit out her new sales location alongside the hospital.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils for her new sales stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is married with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Salim has operated a grocery selling business for the past ten years, selling to his neighbours and town dwellers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Salim dreams of establishing another grocery store in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Silvanah

texts.en:
Silvanah is a widow with three children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Silvanah has owned rental houses and a soap making business for the past ten years. Her potential customers are local neighbors. Silvanah's business challenge is delayed payments by tenants. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Silvanah has requested this loan to purchase building materials, cement and sand to complete her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, cement and sand to complete her rental houses.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the rental bill.

For the past one year, she has operated a tailoring business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailor operators in the area. She dreams of establishing a bigger shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase clothing materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Danilo Francisco, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y una hija   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra y además comprar almacigo de café. El tiene pensado comprar todos estos insumos y el almacigo de café para su posterior siembra en la propiedad de la familia y con los insumos darle el mantenimiento adecuado para  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Danilo Francisco is 28 years old, married, and lives with his wife and one daughter. He will use the loan to buy materials such as fertilizer, fumigations,  labor, and coffee seeds. He plans on buying these materials and coffee seeds to sew them this season in their land and maintain it properly to increase income to have a better life quality and financial stability. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He never had any loan with a state bank but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with much more ease and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy materials such as fertilizer, fumigations,  labor, and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana De San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal VIRGEN DE COPACABANA DE SAN SEBASTIAN; este banco está situado en el distrito de  San Sebastián en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Lidia Justina tiene 48 años, separada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de postres como tortas,pasteles,queques entre otros, la socia trabaja a pedido para los distintos compromisos  como matrimonios, bautizos, cumpleaños entre otros, la socia a la vez se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa como casacas,chompas,ropa para niños ,ella vende de forma ambulatoria repartiendo su mercadería a sus clientes  que le solicitan, la socia lleva años en sus negocios lo cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a cada uno de ellos, la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de torta como harina y azúcar.

Los socios que salen adjuntos en la foto son socios que pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

La persona que sale oculta en la foto es una socia que se retiro el mismo día del desembolso por motivos personales.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de flores, pulmas, venta de artesanía, repostería, venta de productos vitamínicos, alquiler de taxi, cabinas de internet, tienda de abarrotes, venta de golosinas.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
This lady is a member of the VIRGEN DE COPACABANA DE SAN SEBASTIAN communal bank.  This bank is located in San Sebastián, within the Cusco province and department.

Lidia Justina is 48 years old, is separated and has a son.  She has a dessert business and makes pies and cakes among other things.  She takes orders for different events like weddings, baptisms, and birthdays etc.  She also buys and sells clothing such as jackets, sweaters, and children’s clothing.  She sells on foot, delivering merchandise to customers who ordered it.  She has been doing this for many years and things are going well for her businesses because of her dedication she places on each.  She is a very happy and responsible woman with a great desire to get ahead with her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies, such as flour and sugar, for making cakes.

The other members in the picture are members who requested permission for work reasons.

The person whose face is hidden left the communal bank that same day for personal reasons.

The other members have other businesses such as flower sales, feathers, arts and crafts, desserts, vitamin sales, taxi rentals, internet cafes, grocery stores, and snack sales.

This member is grateful for the means that makes it easy to obtain this loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier es un hombre alegre  que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 11 a 21 años. En su fogón que trabaja al carbón, prepara productos fritos diariamente y está ubicado en un punto muy comercial de un sector de la ciudad, donde poco a poco ha ganado el cariño y reconocimiento de su clientela. De este negocio Javier deriva el sustento de su familia y tiene muchas expectativas de crecimiento respecto a él, porque se esmera en que cada día aumente el bienestar a de su hogar. Su esposa inició con esta actividad, mientras el distribuía panes en diversas  tiendas de la ciudad, pero las ventas eran muy bajas y por eso decidieron aunar esfuerzos, para que su esposa apoyara mas la crianza de sus hijos y él se dedicó del todo a este negocio, haciéndolo crecer paulatinamente. Hoy sus principales clientes son empleados de empresas cercanas, vecinos del sector y transeúntes,  porque es una zona muy concurrida, pero quiere aprovecharla aun más. Su proyecto de inversión consiste en diversificar sus productos agregándole otros ya solicitados por su clientela, como pollo, carne asada chicharrones de cerdo etc y cambiar su fogón de carbón por uno que funcione a gas, lo cual mejorará las condiciones laborales en las que trabaja y además ampliará su oferta de productos de acuerdo a lo que desean consumir su potencial clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva para poner en marcha este proyecto de inversión. Su razón de éxito son las oportunidades que le ofrece el merado circundante, su fortaleza en su desempeño y su disciplina de trabajo que lo acompañan para dirigir estos recursos al crecimiento de su negocio que no es más que su propio bienestar.
texts.en: Javier is a cheerful man, lives in Cartagena, with his wife and three children who’s ages range from 11 to 21 years of age. He uses a carbon oven in his kitchen and every day sells fried food. He is located in a commercial area of the city where little by little he has gained clients trust and affection. With this business Javier is able to sustain his family and he has high expectations for growing this business since he works hard every day. His wife started this business while he distributed bread to various stores but sales were so low that they decided to divide their efforts. This way his wife could raise their children and he was in charge of the business and helping it grow little by little. Today his main clients are employees from local companies, neighbors, passer-byers making it a highly trafficked place. However he wants to take more opportunities. His investment plan consists of diversifying his merchandise, adding more products requested by clients such as chicken, grilled beef, pork rinds, etc and change his carbon oven to a gas oven. This will improve his working conditions and amplify his product selection according to client’s demand. This is why he is requesting Kiva a loan and start his project. He believes he can succeed due to the highly trafficked area, his strength in his performance, and work discipline. All of these qualities will help his business grow.

loans.use: odiversifying his merchandise, and change his carbon oven to a gas oven

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 46 años, su pareja es Marcelino con quien tiene tres hijos de 26, 24 y 17 años. Viven con los dos menores en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de San Ramón, Chanchamayo.
Hace 20 años que ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía, especialmente a la venta de artículos de madera, como cucharones, tableros para picar alimentos, porta ollas, porta vasos, porta utensilios, y otros objetos de madera cuyo uso es exclusivo para las labores en la cocina.
“Llevo bastante tiempo en el negocio y si me va bien, la clave está en establecerme en lugares de ventas”, menciona. Margarita adquiere su mercadería en una carpintería. Los viernes ofrece sus productos en su misma localidad, los sábados viaja 25 minutos para llegar a la feria de otra ciudad; y los domingos viaja más de 2 horas para llegar a otra comunidad donde también tiene buena clientela. Invierte cerca de 1000 soles para 15 días, por eso ahora quiere invertir un poco más y salir a otras ciudades.

Esta es la primera vez que Margarita accede a un crédito de MFP, por eso agradece la confianza. Pertenece al banco comunal “Rosas y Claveles” y se siente optimista de contar con socios amigables y laboriosos.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá aumentar la cantidad de mercadería para este mes, ya que tiene un presupuesto guardado, y con el préstamo adquirirá más artículos de madera.
texts.en:
Margarita is 46 years old. Her partner is Marcelino with whom she has three offspring, ages 26, 24 and 17. The couple lives with their two youngest in a rented home located in the San Ramón District in Chanchamayo.

Margarita has been selling handicrafts for 20 years, especially articles made of wood such as ladles, chopping boards, pot holders, coasters, utensils holders and other wooden objects which are used exclusively in the kitchen.

“I have been in this business for quite a while and it has been going well. The key is to establish myself in good sales locations,” she notes. She acquires her merchandise from a carpenter’s workshop. Every Friday, she sells her products in the same location; on Saturdays, she travels 25 minutes away to arrive at a market in another city and on Sundays she travels more than two hours to reach another community where she also has a good customer base. She invests close to S/. 1,000 every 15 days. Consequently she now wants to spend a little more and reach other cities.

This is the first time Margarita has applied for a loan from MFP. Thus she is grateful for their confidence in her. She belongs to the “Rosas y Claveles” Communal Bank and feels optimistic about relying on such helpful and hardworking members.

With the money she has requested she will be able to expand the quantity of her merchandise this month since she is on a tight budget. She will use the loan to purchase more wooden articles.

loans.use: to expand her merchandise so that she can sell more this month.

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de los Angeles, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes son menores de edad, por lo que ella decide quedarse en su casa para atenderlos. Pero el estar sin generar ingresos y dependiendo de su esposo la motiva a comezar a vender : ropa para cama, paños y artículos para el hogar.
Ella inició con unos ahorros, pero actualmente su clientala le demanda más productos, y ella no cuenta mucho capital de trabajo, pero considera que con perseverancia, constancia y apoyo económico ella podrá tener su negocio. Por lo que va Fundación Mujer y hace la solicitud de crédito.
Con apoyo económico ella podrá vender más y contribuir con los gastos de su presupuesto familiar y poderme realizar como mujer y microempresaria.
texts.en:
María de los Angeles lives with her husband and two children. They are minors and she decided to stay home and care for them. But without generating income and depending on her husband motivated her to start selling from home. She sells bedclothes, drapes and items for the home.
She started with her savings, but right now her customers are demanding more products and she doesn't have any more working capital. She considers that with perserverance, constance and financial support she will be able to have her business. That is why she has gone to the Fundación Mujer and made an application for a loan. 

With financial support she will be able to sell more and help pay for the household expenses and fulfill herself as a woman and micro entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets, drapes and comforters

loans.name: González Comercio Group

texts.es:
La señora María del Socorro es parte de la comunidad de La Coraza, que está de 30 minutos de Vicente Camalote, en el estado de Oaxaca. La gente de esta  comunidad se dedica a la siembra de caña. 

María del Socorro tiene 45 años y está casada con el señor Juan. Ella tiene 4 hijos adultos, dos hombres y dos mujeres, actualmente cuida a su nieta Brinatani. Hace cuatro años, María del Socorro abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Con el tiempo, ella ha invertido más en el negocio e incluso ha comenzado a vender tacos los viernes, sábados y domingos por la tarde. Ha solicitado un préstamo para ayudarse a surtir su tienda con tomate, cebolla, jabón, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, papel higiénico y galletas.

María del Socorro está muy agradecida con Kiva y Vision Fund por darle la oportunidad de crecer su pequeño negocio. Ella espera ver algún día a su tienda de convertirse en un pequeño supermercado. Ella  continuara trabajando para ofrecerle a Britani  la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios.

Doña María del Socorro es miembro de un grupo llamado González Comercio que está integrado por 4 mujeres: Lidia quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos; Anali, a la venta de zapatos y Ninfa, a la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
María del Socorro is part of the community of La Coraza, which is 30 minutes from Vicente Camalote, in the state of Oaxaca. The people of this community work growing sugar cane.

María del Socorro is 45 years old and is married to Juan. She has 4 grown children, 2 men and 2 women, and currently she takes care of her granddaughter, Brinatani. Four years ago María del Socorro opened a little grocery store in her home. Over time, she has invested more in the business and has even started to sell tacos on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday afternoons. She is asking for a loan in order to supply her store with tomatoes, onions, soap, oil, beans, sugar, toilet paper and cookies.

María del Socorro is very grateful to Kiva and Vision Fund for giving her the opportunity to grow her small business. She hopes to see her store grow into a little supermarket. She will continue working in order to offer Britani the opportunity of continuing her education.

María del Socorro is a member of a group called González Comercio that has four women members: Lidia who works selling soft drinks, Anali who sells shoes, and Ninfa who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, soap, oil, beans, sugar, toilet paper and cookies.

location.town: La Coraza, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene dos vitrinas grandes y mercancías que ha adquirido, con proveedores que ofrecen  productos mediante guías especializadas y ella aprovecha sus descuentos, para hacer la gran oferta entre todos sus clientes. Ella  ofrece recargas a celulares en un espacio que le dio su esposo en la tienda de su propiedad, para que generara otros ingresos. Rosa es casada y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 10 y 13 años y con su esposo planean trabajar fuertemente para cumplir  el sueño de verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos.  Como solo cuenta con un operador para vender recargas a celulares y con este negocio le ha ido muy bien, en lo referente a la rentabilidad de él, necesita comprar recargas de otros operadores y también vender mercancías masculinas para aprovechar la temporada que se avecina, en la cual se celebra el día del padre. Ahora su mayor desafío es tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para invertir es este proyecto y es justamente lo que conseguirá con un credikiva, primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará recargas perfumes, colonias, calzado y ropa interior y exterior masculina, para tener el inventario que sus clientes necesitan y quieren comprar con motivo de la celebración de el día del padre. Su credikiva tendrá éxito, porque invierte justamente en una temporada de gran movimiento comercial y porque proyecta reinvertir en su negocio, las utilidades producto de esta venta, lo cual incrementará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Rosa has two large window displays and merchandise which she purchased from suppliers who offer products through specialized directories. She takes advantage of their discounts in order to get great bargains for all her customers. She offers cell phone recharges in a space her husband set up for her in the store he owns, so that they could get another income. Rosa is married and has two children aged 10 and 13. She and her husband plan to work hard in order to achieve their dream of seeing their children become successful professionals. Since she sells recharges from only one cell phone provider, and because this business has done very well in terms of profits, she needs to purchase recharges from other providers. She also needs to sell men's merchandise in order to profit from the upcoming season, during which father's day is celebrated. Her biggest challenge right now is to get sufficient working capital for investing in this project. That's just what she will get from a Kiva loan, which is the first loan she requests from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will purchase recharges, perfumes, colognes, shoes and men's clothing and underwear, so that she can stock up on what her customers need and want to buy for celebrating father's day. Her Kiva loan will be a success because she will specifically use it on a season of high sales, and also because she intends to reinvest the profits resulting from these sales in her business, which will increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase recharges, perfumes, colognes, shoes and men's clothing and underwear.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children and all her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant business, and she sells to all categories of people through retail. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more utensils, bunches of bananas, chicken, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and cassava.

Sarah has been in the restaurant business for three years.  She works six days a week.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  She aspires to see her business grow larger, into a fully stocked hotel, and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more utensils, bunches of bananas, chicken, beef, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Petrona es una gran emprendedora que tiene un punto comercial, donde la gente encuentra de todo un poco; ella ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje, suministro de productos de peluquería, servicio de telecomunicaciones, venta de mercancía tipo misceláneas y además tiene un salón de belleza donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento personal de la imagen de hombre, mujeres y niños. Su experiencia data de hace 9 años, tiempo durante el cual, ha construido una clientela fija, a los cuales les otorga créditos entre 45 y 90 días de plazo para pagarle. Su negocio gradualmente ha crecido y ha sido apoyada con financiamiento por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que tiene 3 años de estar vinculada y ha recibido 4 financiamientos; con ellos   ha incrementado su capital de trabajo, ha logrado diversificar su oferta y también fidelizar a sus clientes, porque en su negocio siempre encuentran lo que ellos necesitan. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará productos de belleza, como tintes, masajes y mercancía variada dirigida al genero masculino, a propósito de la celebración del día del padre, temporada en la cual sus ventas de perfumes, colonias, calcetines, ropa exterior e interior masculina se incrementa y Petrona justamente necesita tener este tipo de mercancía, dispuesta para sus clientes, a la moda y con buenos precios, para obtener el mejor repunte de sus ventas en este año.
texts.en:
Petrona is a great entrepreneur who has a commercial business where people find a bit of everything. She offers photocopying services, beauty salon supplies, telecommunication services, miscellaneous merchandise and she also has a beauty salon where she offers personal services for improving the image of men, women, and children.

Her experience dates back 9 years, during which time she has built a steady clientele, and she extends credit of between 45 and 90 days for payment. Her business has grown gradually and has been helped financially through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which she has been connected and has received 4 loans. The loans have increased her working capital, and she has managed to diversify what she offers and also build loyalty among her clients, because in her shop they always find what they need.

Currently she is asking for a Kiva loan with which she will buy beauty products, such as dyes, massage and various merchandise directed towards the male gender, with regards to the celebration of Father’s Day, a season in which the sale of perfumes, colognes, socks and outerwear and men’s underwear increases and and this is precisely why Petrona needs to have this type of merchandise ready for her clients, fashionable and at good prices, in order to obtain the best upward trend in sales this year.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as dyes, massage and various merchandise such as perfumes, colognes, socks, outerwear clothing and men’s underwear

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un padre de familia de  26 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en uno de los nuevos centros poblados que se están formando alrededor del pueblo de Olmos, producto del crecimiento demográfico. Su vecindario sólo cuenta con electricidad, aún no cuentan con agua potable. Olmos es un distrito agrícola ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio desde hace más de un año en su domicilio. Allí tiene una refrigeradora, lo que le permite expender su producto helado. Sus clientes son sus propios vecinos y durante el tiempo que mantiene su negocio, esta ha ido prosperando y se ha vuelto conocido en la zona. 

Eduardo desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más cerveza, con lo que espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. 

El es una persona estimada en su barrio. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona buena y responsable. Eduardo agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con él a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 26-year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in one of the new population centers that are forming around the town of Olmos, as a result of a population increase.  His neighborhood has electricity but no running water.  Olmos is an agricultural district located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has worked selling beer from his house for more than a year.  He has a refrigerator there, which allows him to sell his product chilled.  His customers are his neighbors, and during the time that he has had this business it has prospered, and he has become known in the area.

Eduardo would like to epand his business by acquiring more beer, with which he hopes to increase his sales and his income.  In order to achieve his objective he is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

He is a respected person in his neighborhood.  People who know him consider him to be a good and responsible person.  Eduardo thanks the people who will be helping him through Kiva in advance.

loans.use: to buy beer to expand his sales business.

loans.name: Amis Plus Group

texts.en:
Siméon is the manager of the community bank named “Amis Plus.” It is composed of 21 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Siméon started his business selling vegetables with initial capital of US$60. Today, he operates a general boutique. He is 33 years old, married and the father of two children aged 4 and 7. One child goes to school. He currently earns a profit of about US$100 per week.
