With this loan, he intends to increase the inventory of his business by buying cans, sugar, sacks of rice and beans and other store items to resell at a profit. Currently, Siméon is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups because he will achieve his dream of someday building a wine factory in his area. He sells in the western part of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to purchase items for the store to resell at a profit

loans.name: Elida Luz

texts.es:
Elida es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive al lado de esposo el cual la apoya en todo lo que ella emprende y es su mano derecha, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, paprika entre otros, asimismo encontramos uno de los atractivos turísticos el cual es “La laguna de Huacachina” y también se encuentra en Templo del Señor de Luren cuya fiesta patronal es en el mes de Octubre.

Con mucho entusiasmo elida trabaja día a día en su negocio de alquiler de maquinaria para construcción, trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 5 horas y puede atender hasta 2 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y porque su maquinaria esta siempre en buenas condiciones.

Elida está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le ofrecen su valiosa ayuda y con ella podrá comprar un rotamartillo, con esta mejora tendrá mas maquinarias y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y dar un buen servicio a los clientes, así ella seguirá trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en: Elida is a hardworking woman, lives with her husband who supports everything she undertakes and is her right hand.  Her home is located in the city of Ica, a city characterized by warm weather any time of the year.  It is also a city that develops agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, asparagus, and paprika among others.  In this city, there is also an attraction, "The Huacachina lagoon" and also the Temple of the Señor de Luren, whose feast is in October.  Enthusiastically Elida works every day in her business of renting construction machinery.  She works in her business about 5 hours and can assistant up to 2 clients per day.  She believes that it does well because she is friendly with the customers and their machinery is always in good condition.  Elida is very grateful with the Kiva borrowers since this is the second time that they offer their valuable help and with it she can buy a roto hammer.  With this improvement she will have more machinery and can improve her income and provide a good service to clients.  She will continue to work every day to fulfill her greatest dream: "Build your House of noble material".

loans.use: to purchase a hammer drill (rotary hammer)

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is widowed with four children, none of whom are in school.  She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes for children. She has been in this business for five years. 

Berna moves door-to-door selling used clothes and sells to all categories of people at retail. She works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 800000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bales of used clothes for children. Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her movements, and the ever-increasing supply of used clothes in Uganda. 

Berna aspires to build her own house and also to get a permanent business premise. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes for children

loans.name: Neftali

texts.es: Neftali,tiene 36 años de edad,el posee un comedor que esta situado en el mercado municipal de San Martin Jilotepeque,en su comedor vende comida tipica del pueblo,y tambien vende refacciones a toda hora, viendo el la exijencia de sus clientes tomo la decicion de atender a domicilio, atiende pedidos por mayor y menor tal como lo ba exijiendo sus clientes, es por ese medio que sostiene a sus hijos y le da estudio, su esposa le ayuda en las actividades diarias tanto el apoyo de su esposa le han servido para seguir adelante, el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para la elavoracion de comidas, y compra de aguas gaseosas,el espera que como a mucha jente Kiva les a ayudado tambien a el le puedan apoyar en su negocio, desde ya les agradese y les desea muchas vendiciones.
texts.en:
Neftali is 36 years old and owns a food stall located in the municipal market of San Martin Jilotepeque.  In his stall he sells the typical food of his town and he also sells spare parts at all hours.  Given the needs of his customers, he decided to provide delivery service.  He provides for both large and small requests as needed by his customers.  By this means he supports his children and enables them to study.  His wife helps in his daily activities and this assistance has helped him to get ahead.  

He is requesting this loan to buy more supplies for making meals, and to buy soda pop.  He hopes that since Kiva has helped many people, that they can also help him in his business.  He thanks you in advance and wishes you many blessings.

loans.use: to sell meals, spare parts, and soda pop.

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es:
Karla María, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada, y vive en la ciudad de Olanchito, Yoro junto a su esposo, su hijo y su madre.
Karla se dedica a vender ropa usada para adultos y niños como ser: blusas, pantalones, camisas, pantalones cortos, desde hace aproximadamente siete meses. Anteriormente solo se dedicaba a realizar cortes de pelo y belleza en general, pero miro la necesidad de obtener otros ingresos. Esta solicitando su primer préstamo con la institución ODEF, con el fin de comprar fardos de ropa usada para surtir el negocio e incrementar sus ventas. Ella espera ver su negocio en crecimiento para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Karla María, 27, is married living in the city of Olanchito, Yoro, with her husband, her son and her mother.

Karla has been selling used clothes for adults and for children: blouses, pants, shirts and short pants for about seven months.  She used to just work doing haircuts and beauty in general but she needed to earn other income.

She’s asking for her first ODEF loan to buy bundles of used clothes to stock her business and increase sales.  She hopes to see business growth to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of mixed clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Ines,de 37 años de edad,el se dedica a la agricultura,(a la siembra de ejote franses, a la siembra café,maiz, y frijol,el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años,el vende su productos por mayor ya que en la aldea donde el vive allegan compradores,es si como el señor Ines abtiene sus ingresos para mantener a su familia ya que tiene siete hijos, el nos comenta que esta contento por la ayuda que le han brindado y esta muy agradecido ya que el dise que la recompensa biene de Dios,el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas abono quimico,organico,y follares.
texts.en: Ines is 37 and makes a living through agriculture (by planting French beans, coffee, corn, and beans).  He has done this work for several years, and he sells his products wholesale in the village where he lives where buyers gather.  This is how he obtains his income to support his family.  He has 7 children, and he tells us that he is very happy for the help that has been offered to him.  He is very thankful and says that this reward is God-given.  He is reqeusting this loan to buy seeds and chemical, organic, and foliar fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical, organic, and foliar fertilizers.

loans.name: Nuevo Sendero Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Nuevo Sendero”  está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; kiosko, venta de verduras, minimarket, comida rápida, dulcería, repostería, venta de ropa, venta de carbón, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Marta, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste pantalón de color negro y lleva puesto una chaqueta de color rojo, su cabello lo usa tomado y en sus manos sostiene una carpeta y una bolsa.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio en venta de artículos de aseo y de perfumes, lo cual lo realiza de casa en casa vendiendo sus perfumes y productos a su clientela, desde hace 2 años,  trabaja todos los días de 18ºº a 21ºº horas, su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que sus hijos son pequeños.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en distribuidoras de perfumes, y supermercados para la venta de los artículos de aseo, en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará  variedad de perfumes, y agregará artículos de limpieza como lavalozas, esponjas, detergente entre otros.
Una de sus metas es instalar un kiosko en el centro de la ciudad de Chillan, para una mejor atención a su clientela y así optar a una mejor calidad de vida. Marta vive con su esposo y 2 hijos de 14 y 8 años quienes se encuentran estudiando. Uno de sus sueños es instalar su kiosko para generar mayores ingresos y una estabilidad familiar.
Ella está muy satisfecha y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que  participa, ya que existe confianza y respeto.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Nuevo Sendero”. It is comprised of 21 entrepreneurs who are in various lines of work. Among them are a food stall, vegetable sales, a minimarket, fast food, a candy shop, a pastry shop, clothing sales, charcoal sales, services, and others. All of them are in the town of Chillán.
Marta, the communal bank's president, is pictured standing in the front row, the fourth one from right to left. She's wearing black colored trousers and a red colored coat. She wears her hair up and holds a folder and a bag in her hands.
She runs a retail business selling cleaning products and perfumes. She has been selling them to her customers on a door-to-door  basis for the past two years. She works every day from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. She organizes her schedule according to the time she has available, since her children are young.
She usually buys her merchandise from perfume distributors, and she gets the cleaning products from supermarkets in the city of Santiago at low prices, which is financially convenient.
With the loan she will purchase a variety of perfumes and also cleaning products such as dishwashing liquid, sponges, detergent, etc.
One of her goals is to set up a sales booth in Chillán's town centre, in order to provide a better service for her customers and to improve her living conditions. Marta lives with her husband and two children aged 14 and 8, who are in school. One of her dreams is to set up her sales booth so that she can get better profits and stability for her family.
She's very glad and thankful for the opportunity she has been given by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business. Furthermore, she's very comfortable in the communal bank she participates in, since there's trust and respect.
Chillán is a municipality in the center-south zone of Chile. Its name means "seat of the sun" in mapudungun, the language of the native tribe of the mapuches. Chillán is known as the "Cradle of the Country" or the "Land of Artists", because many prominent figures in Chilean history were born in this town, such as renowned pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of perfumes and also cleaning products such as dishwashing liquid, sponges, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera con 4 hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Gracias, Lempira.
María siempre se ha dedicado a realizar actividades agrícolas, cultivando maíz y frijoles, pero hace 4 años se dedico a cultivar café, y vende su producción en oro o entero.  Esta actividad que realiza es su fuente de ingresos familiar y se está  esmerando por mejorarla. Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 5,500.00 Lempiras, siendo ya el quinto préstamo que va invertir en sus cultivos, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes y va pagar mano de obra para darle un buen mantenimiento a su finca.
Mejorando su producción va obtener más ingresos para que sus hijos estudien y se superen.
texts.en:
María, 40, is a single mother of four children living in a village belonging to Gracias Municipality, Lempira.

María has always worked in agriculture growing corn and beans but four years ago decided to grow coffee and she sells her harvests either whole or ready to be roasted.  This activity she does is her source of family income and she’s striving to improve it.

She’s currently asking for a 5500 lempira loan.   This is her fifth loan she will use to improve her crops.  She will buy fertilizer and pay labor costs to do some maintenance in her farm.  By improving production she will earn more income so that her children will study and improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay day laborers.

loans.name: Corazón De Mejía  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad de gente dedicada en su mayoria a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Corazón  Mejía. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio de comida, venta de productos de belleza y prendas de vestir y prestar servicios como cabinas telefónicas o salones de belleza. Ellos hace tiempo atrás decidieron unir sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, con los cueles están muy contentos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es  la señora Gloria, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 16, 14 y 10 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es agricultor.

Nuestra amiga es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Esika, Lebel y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.

En la foto esta una señora con blusa roja con cuadros blancos que no pertenece al grupo, esta parada detras de una señora con camiseta cafe al lado derecho de la fotografía.
texts.en:
The Corazon Mejia communal bank meets every two weeks in Mejia.  Mejia, which  is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo,is a city where the majority of people work in agriculture and in the cultivation and sale of coconuts. The members work at various activities such as food sales, the sale of beauty products and articles of clothing, and services such as phone booths and beauty salons.  A while ago they decided to join forces to be able to access the benefits provided by the Fundacion Espoir, with which they are very happy.

One of the members of this group is Gloria, who is 42 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has four children aged 19, 16, 14 and 10.  The three eldest are in high school and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Our friend is a homemaker who sells clothing from a catalogue and other products in order to earn her own income and to help her husband with the household expenses.  The products she sells are from Esika, Lebel and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works three days a week for two to three hours a day.  She provides her products on credit and bills every week.  She has been doing this for 10 years and it is going well for her.  She says that the products that sell best are the perfumes and cosmetics as they are said to be very good.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear.  She has been there since the start of the communal bank and she likes it for the help that it gives with the loans.

Her dream is to own a boutique.

In the photo is a woman with a red blouse with white squares who does not belong to the group.  She is standing behind a woman with a brown T-shirt on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Claudia Cecilia

texts.es: Claudia de 39 años de edad desde el año 2002 empezó a ofrecer servicios como manicurista a domicilio entre vecinas, familiares que poco a poco le fueron remitiendo nuevos clientes y así mismo empezó a interesarse en aprender otras técnicas de belleza como corte de cabello, tintes, blower, peinados entre otros, las cuales aprendió de manera empírica y las agregó a sus líneas de productos, y finalmente las perfeccionó mediante estudios que le han permitido ser cada vez mejor y sostenerse en el mercado del mejoramiento de la imagen personal en una peluquería ubicada en la vivienda que habita  al suroccidente de la ciudad. Su meta es adecuarla y brindarle a su clientela cada vez mas un ambiente confortable, pero su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograr el propósito, por eso acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual planea hacer un mejoramiento locativo, ampliando su espacio y todo esto para lograr comodidad para sus clientes y para si misma; de esta manera su gran experiencia y su capacidad de trabajo y el crecimiento de su clientela, son los principales potenciadores del éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Claudia is 39 years old and since 2002 she began offering services as a manicurist in the homes of her neighbors and family members.  Little by little she got new clients and she began to be interested in learning about other beauty techniques such as hair cutting, dying, blow drying, and styling among others.  She taught herself these skills and she added them to her product line and finally she perfected them through studies that have permitted her to become constantly better and sustain herself in the personal image improvement marketplace.  She now has a beauty shop located in her house in the southwest of the city.

Her goal is to become better and to constantly give her clients a more comfortable atmosphere, but her greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to achieve her objective.  Because of this she is requesting a Kiva loan, through which she plans to make improvements to her shop, increasing her space and all of this to achieve comfort for her clients and herself.  Her great experience and capacity for work and the growth of her clientele are the principle ingredients of success for this investment.

loans.use: to make physical improvements to her business.

loans.name: Angela Francisca

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 24 años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, y vive en el Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Ángela se dedica a ser comerciante desde hace 5 años, vende mercadería en general  como, Ropa de dama, caballero y niño, cortinas, ropa de cama, cosméticos, cristalería como vasos, platos, vajillas completas, etc. Ella vende la mercadería de manera ambulante en las colonias vecinas, Ángela no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de sus hijos por eso se empeña mucho trabajando para darle a sus hijos todo lo necesario.
Esta solicitando su tercer préstamo de 5,000 lempiras para comprar mercadería que los clientes le han solicitado como Pantalones (jeans) para dama y caballeros, camisas Unisex, cortinas,etc. Con esta inversión piensa obtener mejores ganancias para seguir trabajando reinvirtiendo en el negocio.
Su plan en el futuro  es poder obtener su propia vivienda, para que su negocio pueda funcionar estable y darle mejor presentación a sus productos. También mejorando la calidad de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángela, 24, is a single mother of three children; she lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.

Ángela has been a merchant for the last five years.  She sells general merchandise like clothes for women, men and children, drapes, bed linens, cosmetics, crystal ware like plates, glasses, complete dinnerware sets, etc.  She sells her merchandise from place to place in nearby neighborhoods.  Ángela does not get any support from the father of her children but she works hard to give her children everything necessary.

She’s asking for her third loan for 5000 lempiras to buy merchandise her customers have requested like pants (jeans) for women and men, Unixex shirts, drapes, etc.  With this investment she plans to obtain better profits to continue reinvesting in the business.

Her future plan is to be able to obtain her own house so that her business can function in a stable manner and to give her products a better appearance also improving her children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise she has pending orders for.

loans.name: Higinia

texts.es:
Doña Higinia de 54 años, muy trabajadora, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en  una colonia del sector López Arellano del municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Hace 6 años que doña Higinia se dedica a realizar productos de manualidades, como ser: decoración de jarrones, retratería, floreros, adornos, recuerdos para cumpleaños, etc. Ella trabaja en base a pedidos que le solicitan los clientes. Actualmente solicita un préstamo de 8,000.00 Lempiras para comprar los insumos y hacer los recuerdos de cumpleaños y unos jarrones que tiene por encargo.
Ella espera incrementar su clientela e ir creciendo  en el negocio cada día.
texts.en:
Higinia, 54, is very hardworking.  She’s a single mother of two children she lives with in the municipality of Choloma’s López Arellano neighborhood, Cortes.

Higinia has been making handicrafts for six years like decorating urns, photography, flower vases, decorations, and keepsakes for birthdays, etc.  She works based on orders placed by customers.  

She’s currently asking for an 8000 lempira loan to buy supplies to make the birthday keepsakes and some urns she has on order.  She hopes to increase her clientele and her business every day.

loans.use: to buy supplies to decorate urns with.

loans.name: Marta Luz

texts.es: Desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche y de lunes a Domingo, Marta está atenta a su negocio de tienda, donde vende víveres, ranchos, licores, carnes y abarrotes, a sus 18 años, posee una gran experiencia y capacidad de trabajo inigualables, sus clientela la conforman sus vecinos, peatones que transitan  permanentemente por el sitio donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio. En su barrio ubicado al sur de la ciudad, donde vive con su cónyuge y su hija de 9 meses de nacida,  es muy reconocida por el buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes a quienes trata con mucho respeto. Poco a poco su clientela se incrementa y con ello la demanda de sus productos, los cuales vende al detalle y diariamente rotan con gran rapidez, por eso aunque la competencia es alta se sostiene en el mercado porque además ofrece precios muy competitivos. Su mayor desafío es tener siempre lo que el cliente necesita, pues son bienes de la canasta familiar que no dan espera y que las familias los consumen diariamente. Así su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para sostener un stock de mercancías y responder oportunamente la demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el  cual comprará en mayor cantidad y de contado víveres, abarrotes, licores, con los cuales ganará descuentos por el volumen y con ello potencializa el aumento de sus ventas y ganara también,  el aumento permanente de los precios que es una constante en su negocio, haciendo que su inversión credikiva sea muy exitosa.
texts.en: From 6 a.m. until 10 pm. Monday through Sunday, Marta is attending her business of a general store where she sells supplies, snacks, liquor, meat, and groceries.  At her 18 years of age, she has unequaled experience and working ability.  Her customers are her neighbors and pedestrians who pass by the location of her business.  Her neighborhood is in the south of the city, where she lives with her husband and her 9-month-old daughter.  She is very well-known for the good service she offers her customers, whom she treats with a lot of respect.  Little by little, her clientele is increasing, and with it, so is the demand for her products, which she sells retail and turns over quickly.  Even though her competition is strong, she sustains herself in the market because she offers very competitive prices.  Her biggest challenge is always having what her customers need, which are basic goods that they can't wait for since the families consume them daily.  This is why her working capital has become insufficient to maintain a stock of merchandise and respond appropriately to the demand.  So, she has applied for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy supplies, groceries, and liquor in larger quantities so she can receive discounts.  She will then be able to increase her sales and profits.  Ever-rising prices are constant in her industry, so investing her Kiva loan will be very successful.

loans.use: to buy supplies, groceries, and liquor in large quantities and with cash.

loans.name: Yoel

texts.en: Searching for opportunity and a better financial situation, Yoel emigrated from Cuba to the United States. Recognizing a need for reliable and skilled contractors, and given his extensive carpentry experience, Yoel started his own construction and handyman business. Through hard work and dedication, he has created a business and a financially stable life for himself in America. Yoel has relied exclusively on a word-of-mouth marketing strategy. However, given the unpredictability of referrals, he hopes that with this loan he can brand his business and market it to a wider audience. He plans to purchase uniforms and signs for his vehicle and design a web page for his company. Because he often hires subcontractors to assist him with work, Yoel believes uniforms will improve the company’s image and reputability. In the future, Yoel hopes to continue to grow his business and hire full-time employees that will give him and others like him the ability to maintain financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase uniforms and signs for his vehicle.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casado,  vive con sus cuatro hijos y la esposa  actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar semilla de café para hacer un almacigo y además  insumos como abonos y foliares. El tiene pensado hacer el almacigo de café para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad y lugares aledaños y con todos estos insumos darle el mantenimiento adecuado para tenerlo en excelentes condiciones y con ello  generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Francisco is 50, married, and lives with his 4 children and his wife.  With this loan, he will buy coffee seeds to make a seedbed and other supplies like fertilizers.  He has planned to make the seedbed to later sell the seedlings at the market in the area and neighboring areas.  With these supplies, it will give him adequate support to keep the seedbed in excellent condition, to generate more income, and to have a better quality of life and stable finances.  This is the first loans that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had loans with other banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan loan with better payment terms and a very low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Isis

texts.en:
Mathematics and numbers have always been Isis’s passion. Originally from Cuba, Isis moved to the United States where she earned her bachelor’s degree and later began working for a tax preparation company. Finding herself unemployed after the company closed its doors three years ago, Isis opened her own tax services business to accommodate the needs of clients she was serving out of her house. In addition to tax preparation, Isis helps clients with incorporation, notary, financial consulting, and general bookkeeping. At heart, however, her business is about helping others. She believes that in helping others file tax returns she can help revitalize the economy and in turn make a positive impact in the community. 

Isis works tirelessly to care for her family and her clients and toward the future success of her business. While she is the sole employee, her daughter occasionally helps her with administrative tasks. Isis relies heavily on walk-in clients; however, her office is currently very simple. With this loan she will re-paint and purchase new furniture for her office. She believes that the redecoration will improve her image and ultimately increase her client base.

loans.use: to renovate the office of her tax services business.

loans.name: Duo Flores De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Duo Flores de Sumpango, este duo esta integrado por la señora Maria Luisa,de 47 años de edad,ella es madre de familia, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,ella es dueña de una tienda, en donde vende dicho producto,a demas de tener su tienda tambien elavora y vende ropa tipica, es de esa forma como ella ayuda a su familia a salir adelante,es por eso que ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas meraderia ya la compra de materia prima para la elavoracion de tejidos tipicos, ella espera que se le pueda ayudar para que ella poco a poco baya saliendo adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: María Luisa is part of the duo, "Duo Flores de Sumpango.  She is 47, is a mother, and makes a living by selling basic food products.  She own a store where she sells these products.  She also makes and sells traditional clothing.  This is how she helps her family get ahead and why she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to purchase supplies to make her woven, traditional goods.  She hopes that she receives this help so she can get ahead with her business little by little.

loans.use: to buy food products and supplies to make traditional woven items to sell.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Marvin Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa  actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar  almacigo de café e insumos como abonos y fumigaciones. El tiene pensado comprar el almacigo de café para su posterior siembra en una pequeña propiedad y darle un adecuado mantenimiento con los insumos y asi poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Marvin Gerardo is 36, is married, and lives with his wife.  With this loan, he will buy a coffee seedbed and supplies like fertilizers and pesticides.  He plans to buy the seedbed to later plant the seedlings on a small property.  He will maintain them with the supplies and be able to earn more profits and to obtain a better quality of life and economic stability.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had a loan with another bank, but [per the field partner] FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with good payment terms and a very low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a seedbed.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en: Originally from Bangladesh, Maruf moved to the United States in search of economic opportunity so that he could better provide for his family at home in Bangladesh. Even amid the obvious struggles of moving to a new country, Maruf is determined and hardworking. He is a self-declared entrepreneur and always knew he wanted to start his own business. Upon coming to America, he recognized a strong market for wholesale souvenirs and novelty and home décor items. Over three years ago now, Maruf opened his own business, i>Aadore International, which distributes personalized items to customers all across the country. With his tireless work ethic and business savvy, Maruf has managed to expand his business to include two employees and a larger inventory. With this loan, he will be able to purchase a specialized printer, a magnet-making machine and new inventory to meet his clients’ demands. This long-term investment will reduce his operating expenses and undoubtedly help Aadore International for many years to come.

loans.use: to purchase a specialized printer and magnet-making machine.

loans.name: Magnolia Del Socorro

texts.es: Con la necesidad de generar más ingresos para aumentar el bienestar de su familia, inició su negocio de preparación y venta de almuerzos Magnolia, una mujer de 47 años que vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 15 ya 26 años. Sus principales clientes son trabajadores de establecimientos comerciales, ubicados alrededor de su vivienda de quienes recibe pagos quincenales de acuerdo a lo pactado y a los pagos de sus sueldos. En la actualidad Magnolia está aplicando a un cuarto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización ha la que ha estado vinculada durante 5 años, que le ha posibilitado el acondicionamiento de su negocio, para poder brindarle un ambiente mas confortable. Con su primer credikiva comprará materias primas e insumos, para aumentar las oportunidades que  se le presentan en el mercado, como la de responde a nuevos   clientes que le han referido los actuales compradores y de los cuales,  ella quiere captar su atención. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos y con ello ganará descuentos por compras  de contado y en mayor volumen, lo cual trasladará a su clientela y hará que su negocio sea mas competitivo y esto es justamente lo que logrará credikiva: una inversión exitosa. Magnolia y su esposo se sienten muy satisfechos porque con su negocio y el trabajo independiente de él, han logrado estudios para sus hijos y sueñan con verlos convertidos en personas exitosas porque definitivamente ellos son el motor de sus vidas.
texts.en: Because of her need to generate an income so that she could improve her family’s wellbeing, Magnolia began her business of making and selling lunches.  Magnolia is a 47 year old woman who lives with her husband and three children, ages 15 and 26.  Her main clients are established merchant workers located around her home, from whom she receives payments every two weeks, according to their agreements and salary schedules. Magnolia is requesting a fourth loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization she has been a part of for five years and that made it possible for her to set up her business, in order to give it a more comfortable environment.  She will use the money from her first Kiva loan to buy supplies and ingredients in order to increase the opportunities in the market, such as responding to new customers that have been referred by the current buyers and those whose attention she wants to capture.  This is the reason she is asking for this Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy supplies in quantity, which will allow her to buy at a discount for cash and large volume.  She will pass these savings onto her customers, making her prices more competitive.  This is what the Kiva loan will allow, a successful investment.  Magnolia and her husband are very satisfied because working independently they have been able to provide for their children’s education and they dream of watching them become successful because they are definitely the engine of their lives.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es:
Betzabe tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive junto a sus padres en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande de la región Piura. La calidad de vida en la zona es bastante precaria y cuenta sólo con el servicio de luz eléctrica. 

Betzabe cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de primera necesidad, entre comestibles y abarrotes. Sus vecinos acuden siempre a su negocio ya que ella los atiende con precios módicos y buen trato. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su padre con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Ella desea adquirir más productos para seguir surtiendo a su negocio, ya que la demanda de su bodega ha aumentado, asimismo desea adquirir un andamio con lo que podrá exhibir mayor cantidad de mercadería. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles. 

Betzabe ya ha tenido un crédito con nuestra institución financiado a través de Kiva. Ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con el apoyo brindado en su primer préstamo y desde aquella vez, sigue manteniendo un buen ánimo y muchas ganas de sacar adelante su negocio y progresar.
texts.en:
Betzabe is 22 years old, single, does not have any children, and lives with her parents in a farmhouse located in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, Piura region. The life quality in the area is very poor and only has electricity.

Betzabe has a small shop installed in her home where she sells groceries to clients. Her neighbors always go to her grocery store since she offers reasonable prices and excellent service. The income she receives in this business helps her and her father contribute financially to the family.

She wants to stock up her store with more merchandise since demand has increased. She would also like to purchase a display cabinet to exhibit as much merchandise as possible. In order to do so she requested Edpyme Alternativa a 1300 Peruvin Soles loan.

Betzabe has had a loan through Kiva before. She is very thankful for the support offered with her first loan and since then continues with a positive attitude and a drive to improve her business and progress.

loans.use: buy more merchandise and a display cabinet

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es: Duo Mujeres Alegres,este Duo esta Integrado por la señora Angelina de 44 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica,desde hace varios años,tambien aparte de esa actividad tambien borda,y teje güipiles, desde muy pequeña le gusto tejer,tambien ella ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura su esposo es mucico y en sus tiempos libres siembra Hortalizas, doña Angelina esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para bordar y tejer ropa tipica,
texts.en: This duo includes 44 year old Angela, who has been selling typical clothing for various years.  Aside from this, she also embroiders and knits guipiles and has liked knitting since she was a little girl.  She also helps her husband farming and he is also a musician.  In his free time he raises vegetables.  Angela is asking for this loan to buy supplies to embroider and knit typical clothing.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: La Señora Irma Yolanda,tiene 36 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de consumo diario,y tambien vende recargas electronicas(tiempo de aire para telefonos)ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años,y por medio de esa actividad a podido sacar adelante a su familia,en especial a sus siete hijos,ya que ella es madre soltera y por lo mismo ella tiene que velar por el vienestar de sus hijos,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia(frijol,arroz,fideos,aguas gaseosas,etc)para surtir un poco mas su tienda, espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que nececita para salir adelante.
texts.en: Yolanda is 36 years old, sells groceries, and electronic refills (airtime for phones). She began her business 4 years ago and has been able to maintain her family which consists of 7 children and her being a single mother. She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise (beans, rice, pastas, carbonated drinks, etc.) to stock up her store. She hopes she can receive the help she needs to succeed.

loans.use: beans, rice, pastas, carbonated drinks, etc

loans.name: Duo San Agustin Group

texts.es: Duo San Agustin,en este duo encontramos integrada a la señora,Veronica Amalia,de 26 años de edad ella se dedica a la elavoracion y venta de tejidos tipicos,tales como güipiles de ocaciones especiales, 15 años, de bodas,y para cualquier otro tipo de selebracio especial,ella desde muy pequeña empeso a bordar y gracias a la antiguedad que lleva bordando a sido una persona muy reconocida en su pueblo y por la calidad conque ella hace sus bordados,y por esa miema razon buelve a pedir una ayuda atraves de un nuevo credito, ya que gracias a Dios y a la ayuda que le han brindado a podido ir subiendo en su negocio, espera que fape le pueda ayudar para seguir progresando en su negocio.
texts.en: Veronica Amalia is 26 and is part of the group, "Duo San Agustin."  She makes a living by making and selling traditional woven garments like "gúipiles," which are worn on special occasions such as young womens' 15th birthday parties, weddings, and any other type of special celebration.  She started to weave when she was very young, and thanks to the experience she has weaving, she is very well-known in her town for the quality with which she makes her woven items.  This is why she is asking for help via a new loan, since thanks to God and the help that she has received, she has been able to keep climbing in her business.  She hopes that FAPE can help her keep progressing in her business.

loans.use: to make and sell traditional, woven garments.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan tiene 56 años, junto a su pareja tiene 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 13 y 11 años, a quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes trabaja diariamente con muchas ganas y esfuerzo para poder darles una vida de calidad y sean mucho mejores que el. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Marcona, la ciudad de Marcona se caracteriza por sus playas hermosas, así como también porque es una ciudad en la cual se desarrolla la pesca y la minería, tiene un clima muy cambiante pero en épocas de verano es muy caluroso.  Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta escuchar música y sobre todo comer uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”, sobre todo acompañado con su camote y su canchita, nos comenta Juan.

Día a día Juan sale a trabaja con mucho entusiasmo en su bote ya que él es pescador artesanal,  él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias, se levanta muy temprano para poder alistas todo lo que necesita para trabajar; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y sobre todo tiene mucha fe en Dios.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su bote, también podrá realizar un afinamiento de motor y pintado del bote, de esta manera tendrá un bote más seguro y en buenas condiciones para seguir trabajando, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener más embarcaciones”.
texts.en:
Juan is 56 years old, has a partner, and has two children who are 11 and 13 years of age. He loves them very much, works very hard every day to give them a good quality of life, and for them to be more successful than him. He lives in the city of Marcona. Marcona is known for its beautiful beaches as well as fishing and mining. The climate is very unstable but in the summer it is very hot. During his free time he likes to listen to music and most of all eat one of his favorite dishes “Ceviche,”especially with sweet potatoes and popcorn, Juan tells us.

Every day Juan works with much enthusiasm in his boat to since he is a fisher. He fishes around eight hours a day. He wakes up very early to prepare everything he needs to work. Business is going well because he is very hard working and above all has a lot of faith in God.

Juan is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because through them he will be able to maintain his boat, refine the motor, and paint the boat. This will help increase profits to help one of his biggest dreams come true: “Give his children a good education and have more boats.”

loans.use: maintain his boat, refine the motor, and paint the boat

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Inspired by her grandmother, Sharon started her own day care, Louise and Lillian Day Care, in 2005. Taking care of children has always been her passion and, when the opportunity was right, she left her job with the Department of Education to open her day care. In addition to having extensive experience in the education field, Sharon is incredibly warm and loving – a necessary combination for any day care provider. She employs three people to help her care for 16 children, and she has a growing waiting list. Her day care could, however, desperately use new supplies and some basic repairs. With this loan, she will be able to make updates that will allow her to make the day care the place she has always envisioned it to be.

loans.use: to purchase computers and other supplies for her day care

loans.name: Quince Mas Uno Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Quince más uno” está conformado por 23 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de joyas, adornos en general, venta de huevos, venta de empanadas, peluquería, masajes, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a comuna de Conchalí ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Katherine, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal,  quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un pantalón color azul, zapatos negros, chaqueta de color negra, su cabello es largo de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de cojines interactivos (cojines con forma de animales, autitos, especiales para niños pequeños), se dedica a este rubro desde hace 6 meses, trabaja todos los días.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras de telas en la comuna de independencia  ciudad ubicada en Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará telas, hilos, agujas para hacer más cojines interactivos que su clientela le va solicitando.
Sus metas son crecer con su negocio y poder expandirse, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Katherine vive junto sus 2 hijas de 6 y 3 años. Sus sueños son superarse cada día que pasa y tener una estabilidad dentro de su negocio y poder trabajar para empresas de gran prestigio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza.
Conchalí es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile)  ubicada hacia el norte de la misma. Posee un barrio industrial delimitado, y múltiples actividades económicas y comerciales de pequeño tamaño, incluyendo ferias libres, talleres artesanales, garajes, terminales de buses, entre otros. El sector microempresarial es muy relevante en su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
This communal bank called "Quince mas uno" is made up of 23 enterprising people who work in the field of commerce, specifically jewellery sales, decorations, the sale of eggs, the sale of empanadas, hairdressing, and massages, among other services.  They all belong to the community of Conchali, located in the city of Santiago.  

Katherine, a member of the communal bank, is located in the photo standing, first on the left, dressed in blue pants, black shoes and a black jacket, and with long, dark brown hair worn loose.  She works selling interactive cushions (cushions in the form of animals, little cars, especially for small children).  She has worked in this field for 6 months, and works every day.

Her merchandise is purchased from fabric distributors in the community of Independencia, a city located in Santiago.  

With the loan she will buy fabric, thread and needles to make more cushions that her customers are requesting.

Her goals are to grow her business and to be able to expand, in order to earn more income, and thus to aim for a better quality of life.

Katherine lives with her two daughters, aged 6 and 3.  Her dreams are to get ahead every day and to have stability in her business and be able to work with large, prestigious companies.

She is very happy with and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable with the group that participates, as they are united and there is respect and trust.  

Conchali is a community in the north of the metropolitan region (where Santiago, the capital of Chile, is located).  It has a defined industrial district and a number of small economic and commercial acitivites, including markets, artesanal workshops, garages and bus terminals, among others.   The microempresarial sector is very important in its commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and needles to make interactive cushions that her customers are requesting.

loans.name: Ebelin Yesenia

texts.es:
Ebelin, tiene 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene una hija de 18 años de edad, reside en el Sector López Arellano del municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Ella tiene varios años de dedicarse al comercio, vende ropa, calzado, sandalias, ropa interior y todo tipo de achinería como ganchos para pelo, pulseras etc. Sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. El préstamo que solicita por 10,000.00 Lempiras lo va invertir en mercadería para surtir el negocio y para hacer una pequeña galera en su casa donde pondrá a exhibir la mercadería para vender. Su sueño es lograr tener un local bonito y mantenerlo siempre surtido para que su hija tenga su propio empleo y se ayuden mutuamente.
texts.en:
Ebelin, 41, lives in a common law relationship with her husband with whom she has an 18-year-old daughter.  She lives in the municipality of Choloma’s López Arellano neighborhood, Cortes.

She’s been a merchant for several years.  She sells clothes, shoes, sandals, underwear and all types of low-cost nick-knacks like hair pins, bracelets, etc.  She sells in an ambulatory fashion and also to order.

She’s asking for a 10000 lempira loan to invest in merchandise to stock the business and to build a small shed at home where she can display her merchandise to sell.  Her dream is to have a pretty locale and to keep it always well-stocked so that her daughter can have her own job and they can help each other out.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Narda

texts.es:
Narda tiene 49 años, está separada del padre de sus dos hijos: Álvaro de 16 años y Keyler de 12 años. Vive en la casa de  su madre, con ella y sus dos hijos, quienes son su motivación para seguir trabajando.
Su negocio es la venta de hielo, el cual reparte a los negocios de sus vecinos que se dedican a la venta de bebidas, haciendo entregas a domicilio o puesto de venta, contando con una buena clientela por lo caluroso de la zona. También se dedica a la venta de raspadillas (helado de hielo) y plátanos regionales en el frontis de su vivienda. Para estos negocios cuenta con una congeladora que le regaló su hermano, quien a su vez le dio la iniciativa de emprender en ese negocio, hace más de 3 años. Le agrada su actividad porque le permite estar en casa y tener libertad de tiempo para atender a su madre que está mal de salud, así como el ingreso económico con el cual ayuda para los gastos de su hogar y de sus hijos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el crédito y la oportunidad de avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y tener un buen record crediticio. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues los conoce a todos los integrantes y los considera buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de bebidas gasificadas a precio por mayor para ampliar su negocio, además de más plátanos y bolsas para envasar el hielo.
texts.en:
Narda, 49, is separated from the father of her children: Alvaro, 16, and Keyler, 12.  She lives in her mother's house with her mother and her two children, who are her motivation to keep working.

She has a business selling ice, which she distributes to her neighbors who have drink businesses.  She makes her deliveries to homes or to the sales post.  She has a good customer base because of the heat in this area.  She also has a business selling shaved ice and bananas in the front of her home.  For these businesses, she relies on a freezer that her brother gave her.  He also gave her the initiative to start up her own business more than 3 years ago.  She is grateful for this activity, because it allows her to be in her house and have free time to tend to her mother, who is in bad health, and she also gets an income to help pay the expenses for the house and for her children.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the loan and the opportunity to make progress with her business.  She is committed to making her payments on time and having a good credit record.  In addition, she feels good about her communal bank, because she knows all of the members and she considers them to be good people.

With the sum of 1,000 Peruvian soles she requests, she will invest in the purchase of carbonated beverages at wholesale to expand her business.  She will also buy more bananas and bags for packaging the ice.

loans.use: to buy drinks and ice to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen is 30 years old and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two dependents. Aileen owns and operates a private service transport to earn a living. She has been engaged in this type of business for 4 years. She earns 5,000 each month in this line of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 at GDMPC to purchase vehiche spare parts and accessories. Aileen has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Aileen hopes to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase vehiche spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida tiene 63 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy dinámica, con deseos de progresar. Su pareja es Wilfredo, quien se dedica al servicio de guardianía y seguridad, y es el padre de sus siete hijos. Ellos viven con el último, Keny de 22 años. Su casa es propia.
Su actividad es la venta de golosinas y dulces en un puesto que implementó en su vivienda con un capital inicial que le dio su pareja, primero comprando en pequeñas cantidades y gracias a la cogida que tuvo logró vender todo, animándola a volver a comprar continuando con su negocio hasta la actualidad. Se inicio hace más de 6 años y ahora cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo en la atención a  los clientes, durante sus ratos libres. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la buena acogida y demanda que tiene sus productos. Le gusta lo que hace por la atención a los clientes, ya que así se socializa con sus vecinos y puede intercambiar ideas, además del ingreso económico que le sirve para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que muchas veces con el ingreso que tiene su pareja no les alcanzaba, teniendo dificultades para solventar los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, con las ganancias desea terminar de construir su casa y habilitar habitaciones para ponerlas en alquiler, generándose mayores ingresos económicos.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo. Desea seguir contando con ese apoyo, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de golosinas para surtir su puesto, considera que así tendrá mayor preferencia de sus clientes. También adquirirá madera para terminar de construir los cuartos en su casa para ponerlos en alquiler.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 63 and is a very hard-working and dynamic woman with desires to get ahead.  Her husband is Wilfredo, who makes a living through being a security guard.  He is the father of her 7 children.  They live with the youngest, Kenny, 22, in their own home.

Her business is selling candies and sweets at a stand that she put in her home with initial working capital that her husband gave her.  She first bought her products in small quantities, and she was able to sell all of it, which motivated her to keep buying and to continue with her business.  She started more than 6 years ao, and now she has her son's support in attending to the customers during his free time.

She considers her business to be rather profitable due to the demand for her products.  She likes what she does because she gets to attend to her customers, which means socializing with her neighbors and exchanging ideas.  The economic income also helps her support her husband with their home's expenses, since many times the income that he makes doesn't cover everything, and they have had difficulties paying for all of their expenses and their children's educational costs. By seeing the good results that she has had, she hopes to use her profits to finish her home and to fix up rooms to rent out, which will generate more economic income.

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She is happy and thankful for the financial support that she receives.  She hopes to keep having it, which is why she promises to make all of her payments.  With the requested amount of 1,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of candy to supply her stand.  She thinks that this will let her be more preferred by her customers.  She will also buy wood to finish building the rooms in her home to rent them out.

loans.use: to buy candy for her stand.

loans.name: Anamer

texts.en:
Anamer is 41 years old and lives in Basirang, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She's a widow and the mother of four dependents. Anamer owns and operates a motorcycle taxi service to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month in this work. 

Anamer has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase a brand new motorcycle to be used in her business. Anamer is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Anamer hopes to purchase more motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase a brand new motorcycle to be used in her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 62 years old and married with 11 children. With 1 child in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for 22 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent and groceries. 

In the future, Alicia would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.es:
La señora Lulú, es socia del banco Comunal  “Las Lomas De Yarina", de Distrito De Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 56 de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos, 4 de ellos  son mayores de edad y 2 están a su cargo.
Lleva 12 años trabajando con los préstamos que Manuela Ramos le ha concedido para su negocio de alquiler de mototaxis.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles tiene planeado hacer reparar las moto taxis y darles mantenimientos, además comprará: 1 juego de catalinas, 1 piñón, cambiara los frenos, 2 bujías, 1 cadena, 2 cámaras, 1 litro de aceite,  2 intermitentes y el pago de mano de obra del mecánico.
Su esposo trabaja con uno de las moto taxis y ese dinero está designado para  los gastos de la casa. Lulu está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por todos los préstamos otorgados  estos años.
texts.en:
Lulu is a member of the “Las Lomas De Yarina” communal bank of the Yarinacocha district, within the De Ucayali department.  She’s 56 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom are adults and two who she still supports.

She’s been working with loans from the Manuela Ramos Movement for 12 years and has managed to rent mototaxis for her business.

With the money from this new loan of 1,500 PEN, she plans to repair her mototaxis and perform maintenance.  She will also buy a set of sprockets and a gear, change the brakes, two spark plugs, a chain, two cameras, a liter of oil, two switches, and pay for a mechanic.

Her husband works one of the mototaxis and that money is intended for the household expenses.  Lulu is very grateful to Manuela Rosa for all the loans granted in previous years.

loans.use: to buy repair parts.

loans.name: Bounkiling Dialocoto Group

texts.fr:
CES MEMBRES HABITENT DANS LE MÊME VILLAGE QUE LES AUTRES MEMBRES. LE BANC VILLAGEOIS EST CRÉÉ LE 01 JUIN 2006. L ACTIVITÉ PRINCIPALE DES MEMBRES EST LE PETIT COMMERCE.

MADAME BINTA QUI EST A LA DROITE DE LA PHOTO LEVANT LA MAIN ET L EMPRUNTEUR EN VEDETTE. ELLE EST MARIÉE ET MÈRE DE SIX ENFANTS DONT QUATRE GARÇONS ET DEUX FILLES. ELLE ÂGÉE DE 45 ANS.

ELLE VA S APPROVISIONNER EN HUILE DE PALME ET EN GRAINE D ARACHIDE QU ELLE TRANSFORME EN PATTE D ARACHIDE DANS LES MARCHES HEBDOMADAIRE DE LA ZONE. POUR REVENDRE DANS SA LOCALITÉ.

ELLE VA ACHETER 20 LITRE D HUILE DE PALME ET 50 KILO GRAMME D ARACHIDE QU ELLE TRANSFORME EN PATTE D ARACHIDE QU ELLE RENOUVELLE TOUS LES DEUX MOIS.

ELLE VEUT ASSURER LES FRAIS CONCERNANT LE MARIAGE DE SON FILS, ELLE SOUHAITE ACHETER UN LIT.
texts.en:
These members live in the same village as the other members. The "banc villageois" was created on June 1, 2006. The main work of the members is small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Binta, at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is married and a mother of six children, four boys and two girls. She is 45 years old. 

She is going to stock up on palm oil and peanuts, which she processes into peanut butter at the local weekly markets for resale in her town. 

She is going buy 20 liters of palm oil and 50 kg of peanuts, which she processes into peanut butter. She repeats this every other month. 

She wants to be sure to cover her son's wedding expenses. She would like to buy a bed.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and peanuts

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Desde Isla Trinitaria sector sur de Guayaquil nos saluda Marilú. Tiene 54 años está casada con Sabino Domínguez quien es comerciante ambulante. 
Su trabajo consiste en recorrer con sus productos diversos sectores de la ciudad. Hace 10 años que decidió realizar la venta de abarrotes  para generar ingresos ya que no encontraba trabajo. Con un capital reunido decidieron reformar su casa abriendo un local en la parte delantera y empezaron a comprar varios productos. Junto a su esposo empiezan su labor desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Mientras Sabino recorre ella atiende el local y su casa. Marilú  tiene 5 hijos de 28, 30, 33, 35 y 37 años quienes son independientes y trabajan por cuenta propias. Le gustaría con el crédito incrementar su negocio comprando mercadería como arroz, venta, confetis y colas. A futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio logrando así su que su esposo no deambule y descanse.
texts.en:
From the Isla Trinitaria area, south of Guayaquil, Marilú greeted us.  She is 54 and married to Sabino Dominguez who is a traveling merchant.  His work consists of taking her products through various sections of the city.  It has been ten years since she decided to sell groceries in order to make an income since she could not find work.  With accumulated capital they decided to renovate their house by opening a small shop in the lower level and then began to buy various products.  She and her husband begin their work at 7 in the morning and work until 10 at night.  While Sabino goes out, Marilú tends to the shop and house.  

Marilú has five children of the ages 28, 30, 33, 35, and 37, all of whom are independent and work on their own.  She would like to increase her business with the loan by buying merchandise to sell like rice, candy, and soda.  In the future she would like to expand her business like this so that her husband can rest and not walk around so much.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and candy.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is married, 51 years of age, and lives in San Juan, Panaon, Misamis Occidental together with her two kids. Violeta is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 5 years and she earns 10,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. Violeta's business is very stable in her community. She joined GDMPC in 2008. In the future, Violeta will use her income to support her two kids in their studies until they finish college and also with their daily needs. Violeta wishes that their business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store

loans.name: Bounkiling Dialocoto Group

texts.fr:
CES CLIENTS SONT MEMBRES DU BANC VILLAGEOIS CRÉE LE 08 JUIN 2006. ELLE HABITENT LE MÊME QUARTIER ET LEUR ACTIVITÉ PRINCIPAL ET LE PETIT COMMERCE.

MADAME TAMARTA QUI EST A LA DROITE DE LA PHOTO LEVANT LA MAIN ET L EMPRUNTEUR EN VEDETTE. ELLE MARIE ET MÈRE DE TROIS ENFANTS DONT UN GARÇON ET DEUX FILLES. ELLE EST ÂGÉE DE 24 ANS.

ELLE COMPTE ACHETER AVEC CE PRÊT UN RÉFRIGÉRATEUR POUR VENDRE DE LA GLACE, DES JUS ETC..

ELLE VA ACHETER EN QUANTITÉ DU PAIN DE SINGE, DU BISSAP, DU SUCRE ET DES PRODUITS QUI SONT EN SAISON POUR MIEUX SATISFAIRE SA CLIENTÈLE.

AVEC LES BÉNÉFICES ELLE COMPTE PAYER LA SCOLARITÉ DE SES ENFANTS, ET COMPLÉTER LE REMBOURSEMENT DU RÉFRIGÉRATEUR
texts.en:
These clients are members of the Banc Villageois created on June 8, 2006. They all live in the same neighborhood and their main activity is small-scale trading.

Tamarta, who is on the right-hand side of the photograph with her hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is married and mother of one son and two daughters. She is 24 years old.

With this loan, she plans to buy a refrigerator to sell ice cream, juices, etc...

She will buy baobab fruit, bissap, sugar, and in-season products in bulk to better satisfy her customers.

With the profits, she plans to pay for her children's education and pay back the loan for the refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Montagne Nord 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Montagne Nord 2 existe depuis le 28 mars 2008. Le groupe PC 01 est composé de vingt six femmes qui sont issues du même quartier et sont pour la plupart des commerçantes. 



Alla l'emprunteuse vedette est âgée de 34 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant et mène une activité de commerce d'habits et de bijoux; elle a une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout tout à fait à droite la tête couverte d'un châle noir et a levé la main gauche.


Elle se rend dans la capitale pour acheter des jeans, body, chaussures, boucles d'oreilles etc..... et revend dans sa localité.


Son prêt lui servira à se procurer au moins 10 jeans,10 body et 5 paires de chaussures.


Elle aide son frère pour les besoins de la famille en nourriture, se prend en charge et augmente son épargne.
texts.en:
The Montagne Nord 2 Banc Villageois was created on March 28, 2008. The PC 01 group is made up of 26 women who are all from the same neighborhood and most of whom are shopkeepers.

Alla, the featured borrower, is 34 years old, single, and has no children. She runs a business selling clothing and jewelry. She is very experienced. In the photograph, she is the one standing all the way to the right wearing a black shawl around her head and raising her left hand.

She goes to the capital to buy jeans, leggings, shoes, earrings, etc...and she resells them in her town.

She will use her loan to buy at least 10 pairs of jeans, 10 leggings, and 5 pairs of shoes.

She helps her brother provide food for the family, takes responsibility for herself, and is increasing her savings.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry intended for resale

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 46 years old and married with 6 children.  With 5 children in school, Charito works very hard to provide for them.

Charito runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Charito has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, shampoo and groceries. 

In the future, Charito would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jerlissa

texts.es:
Jerlissa tiene 30 años, es una mujer de muchas ilusiones para su futuro, tiene muchas ganas de progresar, además es alegre y amable con las personas. Su pareja es Denis, quien se dedica al comercio y es el padre de sus dos hijos: Jordi de 9 y Denis de un año. Juntos habitan en la casa que lograron comprar con sus ahorros mutuos.
Su actividad es la crianza y venta de pollos. Acondicionó un espacio en su terreno donde construyó un galpón con capacidad para 200 pollos, los que vende al por mayor a los comerciantes de su localidad, también tiene dos cerdos. Paralelamente tiene un negocio, en sociedad con su pareja, de la venta de artículos eléctricos. Se inició hace más de 2 años con un capital propio, fruto de los ahorros mutuos con su pareja, más un préstamo particular. Considera su negocio rentable porque logra acabar en vender todos los pollos que están listos para la venta diariamente. Antes de empezar con sus negocios tenía  problemas económicos para solventar los gastos de su familia. Por tanto, viendo la mejora económica que ha logrado hasta el momento, desea continuar con sus negocios.

Este es su préstamo número dos con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de 200 pollos bebé, más alimentos balanceados, en sacos, para su alimentación.
texts.en:
Jerlissa is 30 years old, a woman with many dreams for her future, has a drive to progress, and is friendly and kind to people. Her partner is Denis who is a merchant and father of her children. Together they live in a house they were able to purchase with their mutual savings.
She raises and sells chickens. She used a piece of land in her home to build a shed capable of keeping 200 chickens. She sells them wholesale to merchants in her area. She also sells pigs and has a business with her husband selling electronics. It started more than 2 years ago with a small amount of money saved up between her and her husband and a loan. She considers her business to be profitable because she just sold all of her chickens that are ready to sell daily. Before starting their businesses they had difficulty covering their household expenditures. As of now, after seeing the financial improvement she has made she wishes to continue working.
This is her second loan with the MFP institution. She's very happy in knowing that she will have financial support because she will be confident in continuing with her business. She also likes being a part of the communal bank because the members are responsible and very solid people. With the requested loan of 1500 Peruvian soles she will buy 200 chicks, balanced feed in sacs for their nutrition.

loans.use: buy 200 chicks, balanced feed in sacs for their nutrition

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa tiene 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está separada del padre de sus dos hijas: Melisa de 13 años y Mishel de 3 años. Vive con ellas, dos cuñadas y su suegra, en la casa los padres de su ex pareja.  
Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, los que compra semanalmente en los centros de abastos y luego los vende de manera ambulatoria recorriendo las calles de su localidad. También vende ropa que trae desde la capital. La mayoría de estos productos los vende al crédito, notando así mayores ganancias. Se inició hace más de 5 años con un capital propio, comprando en pequeñas cantidades que fue aumentando viendo la demanda de sus productos. Comenzó por idea de su cuñada, quien la animó a entrar en el negocio. Considera que es bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, logrando acabar todo lo que vende, ya que se hizo muy conocida en su localidad. Antes de empezar con su negocio tuvo dificultades económicas, ya que los gastos aumentaron con la llegada de su segundo hijo y ella tiene el deseo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación, además de apoyar a su suegra con los gastos de la casa. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está consiguiendo, desea continuar con su negocio y con sus ganancias comprar su propia casa, donde desea abrir una bodega de abarrotes.

Este es su préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además se siente a gusto con su banco, pues le gusta el apoyo que brindan a las personas con deseos de superación.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de ropa de variados modelos y tallas que traerá desde la capital, buscando conseguir precios cómodos. También adquirirá abarrotes para su otro negocio.
texts.en:
Melissa, 32, is a hard-working and determined woman with much desire to get ahead in life.  She is separated from the father of her two daughters: 13-year-old Melisa and 3-year-old Mishel.  She lives with them, two sisters-in-law, and her mother-in-law in the house belonging to the parents of her former partner.

She makes a living selling groceries in general, which she buys weekly at the wholesale centers and later sells them while traveling through the streets of her town.  She began this about five years ago with her own capital, buying in small amounts that grew as she saw the demand for her products.  It began as an idea from her sister-in-law who was excited to enter the business.  She considers it profitable enough for the earnings that it leaves her; she manages to sell all that she offers since she has become well-known in her town.  Before beginning her business she had financial difficulty because the expenses grew with the arrival of her second child and she wanted to offer them a better quality of life and a better education, in addition to helping her mother-in-law with the household expenses.  Therefore, seeing the good results that she is getting, she wishes to continue with her business and would like to use her earnings to buy her own home, where she wishes to open a small grocery store.

This is her second loan with the MFP institution.  She is very happy knowing that she will have financial support since this way she will feel sure about moving forward with her business.  Also, she feels at ease with her bank because she likes the support they offer to people with the desire to improve.  With the requested amount of 1200 nuevos soles she will invest in purchasing clothing of various styles and sizes brought from the capital, while seeking to get affordable prices.  She will also acquire groceries for her other business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for traveling sales and clothing brought from the capital.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул 36 лет, замужем, воспитывает  4 детей. В 2011 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи,  Нургул начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Нургул сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Нургул  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует частично вложить в закуп стройматериалов для ремонта дома, и часть – в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nurgul is 36 years old, married, and she is raising four children. In 2011, in search of an additional source of income for her family, she started her own business selling food products.

Through persistence and hard work, Nurgul was able to develop her business and she now makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  

Her inventory is currently limited, and this is why she has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS).  

She plans to use part of her profits from this loan to buy materials to repair her home, and part for business development.

loans.use: to expand her range of food products

loans.name: Duo San Francisco Group

texts.es: Duo San Francisco. este Duo esta Integrado por la señora Sandra de 23 años de edad ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años,ella se dedica a la siembra de Maiz,frijol,tomate,y guicoyitos, ella nos comenta que en esta actividad se nececita de mucho capital,ya que la siembra nececita de un cuidado especial para que no les entre la plaga o la enfermedad,ya que si una de estas dos cosas le afecta a la siembra se puede perder la cosecha,es por eso que ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes,espera que nuevamente le puedan ayudar con este credito.
texts.en:
Sandra, 23, is part of the "Duo San Francisco" group. She has been farming for several years. She grows corn, beans, tomatoes and guicoyitos (type of squash). 

She tells us that in this business you need a great deal of capital, as the crop needs special care so that pests or disease don't get in.
