If one of these two things affect the crop, the harvest can be lost. This is why she is applying for this loan to buy manure and fertilizers. She hopes that with this loan, they can help her again.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana, es socia del Banco Comunal Las Lomas De Yarina del Distrito De Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos menores en edad escolar.
Lleva un año trabajando con los préstamos que Manuela Ramos le ha concedido para poder aumentar su negocio de venta de ropas, sus amistades son sus principales clientes y los visita cada vez que renueva su mercadería.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 docenas de polos de hombre, 1 docena de pantalones de vestir, 1 docena de blusas, ½ docena de shores, ½ docena de polos para niños.
De esta manera puede contribuir con los gastos de la casa, su esposo se desempeña como empleado público. Manuela Ramos ha sido su principal aliado económico para el crecimiento de su negocio de esa manera podrá asegurar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana is a member of Communal Bank Yarina Hills of the Yarinococha district, Ucayali department. She is 43-year-old, married, and has four small children who are in school. 
She has been working for a year with a loan Manuela Ramos offered her to grow her clothes selling business. Her main clients are friends and they visit her every time she has new merchandise.
With the $2,500 Peruvian Soles loan she will buy 2 dozen polos for men, 1 dozen dress pants, 1 dozen shirts, ½ dozen shorts, and ½ dozen polos for children.
This way she can contribute more with household expenditures. Her husband is a public worker. Manuel Ramos is her main economic ally for increasing her business and that way she can ensure her children's education.

loans.use: buy polos for men, dress pants, shirts, shorts, and polos for children

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru:
Алмакан 48 лет, замужем, имеет 7 детей. Алмакан  в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2002 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 25,000 сом (KGS). Купив в начале 1 корову и 10 голов мелкого скота, в хозяйстве Алмакан на сегодняшний  день имеется  7 коз с приплодом, 10 овец,  2 коровы с телятами, что приносит ей около 20,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алмакан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Алмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Almakan is 48 years old, married, and has seven children.  She has been working in animal husbandry since 2002, starting her business with an initial amount of 25,000 som (KGS), and providing her family with its main source of income.

She initially bought a cow and 10 head of small livestock, but she now has 7 goats and their kids, 10 sheep and 2 cows with their calves.  She makes about 20,000 som per month from the sale of milk and dairy products.

In order to further expand her business, Almakan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy additional head of cattle.  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into further expanding her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Hans Buchanan

texts.es: Hans Buchanan, tiene 45 años de edad, casado desde hace 9 años, tiene 1 hija de 9 años de edad, vive en una aldea del sector Lopez Arellano, Choloma, Cortes. El señor Hans, tiene un negocio de venta de pizza cacera, que las prepara junto con su esposa en casa, desde hace mas de 2 años. A este negocio le dedica 9 horas diarias. Su venta es ambulante, entrega a domicilio y por pedidos, las distribuye en una bicicleta, la pizza se vende bastante en la zona, ya que se consume a cualquier hora. Ha establecido buena clientela con los niños de las escuelas de la zona quienes las comen como merienda. Esta solicitando un segundo  préstamo para abastecerse de ingredientes que utiliza para la elaboración de pizzas, principalmente la harina que la compra en cantidades grandes porque sale barato y se ahorra dinero. Su sueño es llegar a tener un local fijo donde vender pizzas, y crecer en el negocio para ayudar a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en:
Hans Buchanan is 45 years old and has been married for nine years. He has a nine-year-old daughter and lives in a neighborhood in the Lopez Arellano section of Choloma, Cortes.

Sr. Hans has a business selling handmade pizzas that he and his wife prepare from their home. He has been in business for more than two years. Hans spends nine hours a day working at his business. His sales require travel since he takes orders for home delivery and then distributes his products by riding a bicycle. His pizzas sell well throughout the area since they can be eaten at any time. Hans has established a good customer base, especially among the local school children who like to eat pizzas as an afternoon snack.

He is requesting a second loan so that he can restock with ingredients for making pizzas, mainly flour in large quantities because he can save some money by purchasing at a lower price. His dream is to have an established location where he can sell pizzas, thus allowing him to grow his business so that he can help his daughter with her studies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for making pizzas.

loans.name: Greisi

texts.es:
La señora Greisi es socia del Banco Comunal "Las Lomas de Yarina" del distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad en etapa escolar.
Es una de las socias fundadoras de este Banco Comunal y con el préstamo que le brinda seguirá  trabajando para apoyar a su esposo.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 docenas de camisetas deportivas para hombre, 2 docenas de shores deportivos, 1 docena de camisas de vestir, 1 docenas de pantalones  de vestir, 1 docenas de polos para niños, ½ docena de blusas.
Su esposo es profesor de profesión y es el encargado de mantener el hogar, el negocio que ella tiene le sirve para solventar los gastos de educación de su hija mayor.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por brindarle los préstamos cada vez que lo ha solicitado.
texts.en:
Sra. Greisi is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Lomas de Yarina" (The Hills of Yarina), which is in the District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old, married, and has two young children who are of school age.

Greisi is one of the founding members of her Communal Bank. The loan that has been given to her will allow her to continue working in order to support her husband. Her new loan of 2,500 PEN will be used to buy 2 dozen sports T-shirts for men, 2 dozen sports shorts, 1 dozen dress shirts, 1 dozen dress slacks, 1 dozen children's polo shirts, and ½ dozen blouses.

Her husband is a teacher by profession and is in charge of maintaining their household. Greisi's business helps to cover the educational expenses of her oldest daughter. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing the loans each time she submits a request.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en: Erlyn is 41 years old and married with two children who attend school. Erlyn works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery stock to sell. Erlyn has been in this business for  two years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Erlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is married and works hard, running a retail salt and fermented fish business in the Philippines for 10 years. She earns additional income from a sari-sari (convenience) store. Gloria requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, 30, is married and has four 4 children. She resides in San Juan, Panaon, Philippines. For two years, Arlene has owned and operated a retail store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP from her business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Recently, Arlene joined GDMPC. In the future, Arlene wants to build a house and see that her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en: Lorelie is 54 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family. For seven years, Lorelie has run a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other miscellaneous items. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery stock to sell. In the future, Lorelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Alex Noel

texts.es:
Alex Noel tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en una colonia cercana  a la ciudad de Olanchito, Yoro.

alex anteriormente se dedicaba  a la venta de granos basicos y hace un año dedicio establecer un negocio de comidas rapidas como baleadas, sandwish, tajaditas con carne, pollo frito con tajadas, y golosinas como refrescos, jugos, churros y dulces etc. este negocio lo tiene en la cafeteria de un colegio de la ciudad y le apoya su esposa en la elaboracion de los alimentos.este prestamo que solicita de 15,000.00 Lempiras es para surtir de insumos necesarios para la elaboracion de
texts.en:
Alex Noel is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and son in a subdivision near the city of Olanchito, Yoro.

Alex previously sold basic grains, but he decided a year ago to establish a fast food business. He serves "baleadas" (Honduran stuffed tortillas), sandwiches, meat with plantain chips, and fried chicken with plantains. In addition, he offers sweets such as soft drinks, juices, donuts, candy, and other items. His business is located in a school cafeteria and his wife helps with preparing the food.

Alex is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL so that he can restock his business with the necessary supplies for preparing food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for preparing fast food.

loans.name: Marvenus

texts.en: Marvenus is married and has a pedicure/manicure business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. Marvenus has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her pedicure/manicure business, which she has operated for two years. She earns additional income from clothing sales. In the future, Marvenus would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her pedicure/manicure business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth, 38, is married with six children and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store. Lilibeth has repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. Lilibeth aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 59 years old, married and has nine children, one who is in school.  Amparo is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been raising pigs for 10 years and has borrowed from NWTF four times to sustain it.

In the future, Amparo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 41 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de progresar, además de ser alegre y amable. Está separada del padre de sus tres hijos y actualmente vive con dos de ellos (Jail de 19 y Nicker de 15 años), con su hermano y su madre, en la casa de esta última.
Su actividad es la venta de golosinas y dulces, además de refrescos de diversos sabores regionales. Sus productos le llegan semanalmente de la distribuidora y los vende desde una mesita que instala en el frontis de su vivienda. Se inició hace más de 5 años con un capital propio, contando con la ayuda de su madre e hijo en la atención, ocasionalmente. Considera a su negocio rentable, por las buenas ganancias que le deja, siendo un ingreso adicional para las necesidades del hogar. Antes de empezar con su negocio, tenía dificultades económicas, ya que el precio de los alimentos sube constantemente y sus ingresos no les alcanzaban. Logrando superar estos problemas y viendo la acogida que tiene su negocio desea continuar y mantenerlo. Además desea ampliarlo con la venta de helados. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal por la ayuda que vienen brindando a  las personas con deseos de progresar.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de golosinas para la venta en su mesita.  Desea comprar estos productos al por mayor para surtir su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Reyna is 41 years old. She is a very nice and cheerful woman with a strong desire to progress in life. She is separated from the father of her three children, and she currently lives in her mother’s house with her brother, her mother and two of her children (Jail, 19 and Nicker, 15).
She sells candies and sweets, as well as regional soft drinks of different flavors. She weekly purchases her products from a supplier and she sells them arranging them on a small table just outside her house. She started more than 5 years ago with her own working capital, and her mother and her children occasionally help her running the stall. She thinks her activity is profitable because of the good money she makes, an additional income for her household’s necessities. She has had economic difficulties before starting her activity, as she did not make enough money to face the continue raise ion the prices of food; she now wants to carry on her activity in order to solve these problems and because of the good response her activity receives. She also wants to expand her activity by selling ice-creams as well.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she hopes she will succeed in complying with her goals. She also says she likes her Communal Bank for the help they offer to people wanting to progress in life.
She has requested a loan of 1000 PEN, and she will use it to buy candies to sell in her stall. She wants to buy these products at wholesale price to stock up her inventory and improve her earnings.

loans.use: To buy candies at wholesale price.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
La señora Olga María es socia del Banco Comunal” Las Lomas De Yarina” del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, todos con familia.
Es re ingresante al Banco Comunal, pues necesitaba un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella sale a ofrecer sus productos y visita a sus clientas.

Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 2 shampoo, media docena de lápices labiales, 3 perfumes para caballeros, 2 colonias para damas, 1 estuche de collar y aretes, 12 esmaltes para uña, 1 rubor, crema para manos, 2 sombras, 2 lápiz delineadores.  
Gracias a Manuela Ramos obtuvo un capital para trabajar y darles a sus hijos la educación que necesitaban.
texts.en:
Olga María is a member of “Las Lomas de Yarina”, a Communal Bank located in the Yarinacocha district, in the Ucayali department. She is 53 years old, and she is a single mother of 3 adult children, who live with their own families.
She has rejoined the Communal Bank because she needed a new loan to invest it in her activity. She sells beauty products door to door, going to her customers’ houses.

This new loan of 1,500.00 PEN will be used to buy 2 shampoos, half a dozen of lipsticks, 3 perfumes for men, 2 colognes for women, 1 set of jewellery (necklace and earrings), 12 bottles of nail polish, 1 blusher, hand cream, 2 eye shadows and 2 eyeliners.
Through Manuela Ramos she has received some working capital to carry on her activity and to provide her children with the required education.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfumes and shampoos.

loans.name: Leilita

texts.es:
Leilita tiene 64 años, está casada con Raúl, quien se dedica a la pesca y es el padre de sus cinco hijos. Vive en compañía de su esposo y su hijo de 29 años, que aún es soltero, ya que sus otros hijos son mayores de edad e independientes.
Su negocio es la venta de bebidas heladas, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con la ayuda de su esposo. Empezando hace 5 años con la compra en pequeñas cantidades y de una sola marca, puso su letrero en la puerta de su casa para hacer su publicidad y con el tiempo, logró hacerse conocida en su barrio. En la actualidad ha incrementado y variado el stock de sus productos comprando en mayor cantidad y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola.
Considera rentable su negocio pues tiene bastante demanda por lo caluroso de la zona. Le gusta, pues le permite tener una ocupación en casa y un ingreso económico, así como el tiempo libre que le deja para hacer otras actividades. Pero lo que no le gusta es cuando llueve muy seguido, pues baja la venta. Pero eso no la desanima y sigue en su negocio, pues sabe que no tiene pierde, ya que tiene una regular clientela que le consume muy seguido sus productos.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera cumplir con sus metas. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus compañeros y considera que son personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de bebidas gasificadas en mayor volumen y precios más bajos, buscando variedad de sabores y marcas al gusto de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leilita is 64 years of age and is married to Raúl, who is a fisherman and father to their five children. She lives with her husband and 29-year-old son, as her other children are adults and independent.


Leilita works selling cold drinks, and she has a refrigerator which she bought with the help of her husband. She started five years ago buying small quantities of a single brand, and put a notice on the door of her house to advertise her business. Over time, she became well-known in her neighborhood. She has now increased and varied her stock of products by buying larger quantities, and to date has run her business herself.


Leilita thinks that her business is profitable as she has a lot of demand because the area has a very hot climate. She likes her job, as it allows her to work at home and gives her financial income, as well as free time to carry out other activities. What she doesn’t like, however, is when it rains continuously, as this lowers her sales. This doesn’t put her off though, and she continues with her business, as she knows that it doesn’t incur losses and she has regular customers who buy her products on a regular basis.


This is Leilita’s third loan with the MFP institution, and she hopes to meet her goals. She also says that she feels happy with her communal bank, as she knows her colleagues and thinks that they are responsible people. She has requested 1,000 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy a larger volume of sodas at lower prices, looking for a variety of flavors and brands to satisfy her customers’ tastes.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale drinks.

loans.name: Hortencia Luz

texts.es: Hortencia tiene 59 años de edad y vive en Duran. Ella tiene un taller de confección y venta de colas en su domicilio. El negocio lo empezó desde muy joven cuando aprendió la costura por él desea de ayudar contribuyendo con su familia. Hace 12 años que realiza la confección de manera particular y le ha dado buenos resultados, como se separo de su esposo tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y esta actividad constituyo su forma de vida. El trabajo lo realiza sola porque a sus clientes le gusta su trabajo y lo prefiere así ya que brinda mejor calidad. Realiza todo tipo de vestuarios como camisas, ternos, vestidos, uniformes dependiendo de lo que solicitan. Hortencia nos comenta que ahora vive sola ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad y con familia. De momento su mayor problema es la competencia que si tiene por eso da el mejor servicio para que los clientes regresen. Con el crédito piensa comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Hortencia is 59 years of age and lives in Duran. She has a business in her home where she makes and sells clothes. She started this business at a very young age when she learned how to sew, as she wanted to help by contributing to her family. 

For the past 12 years Hortencia has had a private business making clothes, which has given good results. As she is separated from her husband, she is responsible for her children and this business is her way of life. She works alone as her customers like her work and prefer her, so this ensures better quality. She makes all kinds of clothing such as shirts, suits, dresses and uniforms, depending on what her customers request. 

Hortencia says that she lives alone now as her children are adults and have their own families. Right now her main problem is the competition she has, and she therefore gives the best service so that her customers return. She plans to use the loan to buy construction materials to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Musy

texts.es:
Musy tiene 22 años, es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, así como amable y alegre. Es soltera, vive en compañía de sus padres y tres hermanos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas desde su casa, contando para ello con una refrigeradora. Se inició hace dos años con un capital propio, fruto de sus ahorros comprando en pequeñas cantidades las bebidas y en la venta de carbón con su padre. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda de las bebidas en la zona de calor donde vive, tiene buenas ganancias. Gracias a esto desea continuar con su negocio y ampliarlo para que en un futuro tenga una distribuidora de bebidas gaseosas. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP. Está agradecida con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso, se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, para tener un buen record crediticio. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus miembros y los considera buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más bebidas gaseosas a precio por mayor. También adquirirá más carbón para vender en el puesto que tiene su padre en el mercado.
texts.en:
Musy is 22 years of age. She is an enterprising and dynamic woman, as well as being friendly and happy. She is single, and lives with her parents and three siblings.


She works selling drinks from her home, and has a refrigerator to do so. She started this business two years ago with her own capital, which she obtained from her savings, buying small quantities of drinks and selling coal with her father. She thinks that her business is fairly profitable because of the demand for the drinks in the hot area where she lives, and she makes a good profit. Thanks to this she wants to continue with her business, extending it so that she can have a soda distribution business in the future.

This is Musy’s second loan with the MFP institution. She is grateful for the financial support given, which helps her progress with her business. She is therefore committed to being punctual with her loan repayments, so that she has a good credit history. She also feels good about her communal bank, as she knows the members and thinks they are good people.


With the requested loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, Musy plans to buy more sodas at wholesale prices. She also wants to buy more coal to sell in her father’s stall in the market.

loans.use: To buy drinks and coal for sale.

loans.name: Bukhavakhan

texts.ru:
Бухавахан  41 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. Бухавахан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки овец. На сегодня  хозяйство Бухавахан насчитывает 2 коровы и 2 теленка, также Бухавахан предоставляет услуги общепита, продавая еду на местном рынке. Доход от бизнеса составляет около 6,000 сом в месяц.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бухавахан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Бухавахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Bukhavakhan is 41 years old, married and the mother of two children. As a main source of income for her family, Bukhavakhan has been working with livestock breeding since 1995, having started this business with the purchase of sheep. Currently Bukhavakhan has two cows and two calves on her farm, and she also provides a food service, selling food at the local market. The income from the business is around 6,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Bukhavakhan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. Bukhavakhan plans to invest the income from the loan in further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Bunisa

texts.ru:
Бунисе  59 лет, вдова, имеет  4 детей. 30 лет назад, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Буниса начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Начав с покупки теленка, благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Буниса сумела развить свой бизнес, приобретя 8 голов крупного рогатого скота. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Буниса обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и теленка .  Доходы от кредита Буниса планирует вложитьв развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Bunisa is 59 years old, a widow, and has four children. 30 years ago, in the search of a source of income for her family, Bunisa started her business of livestock breeding. Having started with the purchase of a calf, Bunisa was able to develop her business thanks to persistence and hard work, acquiring eight heads of cattle. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Bunisa turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a cow and a calf. Bunisa plans to invest the income from the loan in developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Asylbu

texts.ru:
Асылбу  - участник группы «Тахмина», ей 50 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей. Асылбу на протяжении 10 лет работает техничкой в музее села Чолпоната. В 1991 году, в поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Асылбу начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. На сегодня  хозяйство Асылбу насчитывает 1  теленка,1 корову, 1 козу, а также Асылбу обрабатывает 0,70  га земли, где выращивает картофель. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асылбу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Асылбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Asylbu is a member of the "Takhmina"-group. She is 50 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children. Asylbu has worked with maintenance at a museum in the Cholponata village for more than 10 years. In the search of additional income for her family, Asylbu started working with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation in 1991. Currently, Asylbu's farm includes one calf, one cow, one goat and she also cultivates 0.70 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Asylbu turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. Asylbu plans to invest the income from the loan in further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Chynarkan

texts.ru:
Чынаркан - участник группы «Тахмина», ей 39 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей.  Чынаркан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодня в хозяйстве Чынаркан имеется 2  телят, 10 овец, 2 козы, 6 ягнят, 3 головы крупного рогатого скота. Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). Также, Чынаркан ежегодно обрабатывает 1,2  га земли,  где выращивает в основном картофель и кукурузу. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Чынаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Chynarkan is a member of the "Takhmina"-group. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four children. As a main source of income for her family, Chynarkan works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. Currently Chynarkan has two calves, ten sheep, two goats, six lambs and three heads of cattle at her farm. The monthly income from selling milk is 4,000 som (KGS). In addition, Chynarkan cultivates 1.2 hectares of land every year, where she mainly grows potatoes and corn. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Chynarkan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of young livestock. Chynarkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.ru:
Тахмина  - лидер группы «Тахмина», ей 37 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей.  Тахмина работает в сельской управе села Чолпоната на должности расчетного  бухгалтера  и качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством. На сегодня в хозяйстве Тахмины имеется 2 коровы, небольшой сарай, где имеются все необходимые условия для содержания скота. Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока составляет 4,000 сом (KGS).
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тахмина обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Тахмина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Takhmina is a leader of the "Takhmina" group. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of four children. Takhmina works as an accountant in the rural council of the Cholponata village, and as an additional source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding. Currently Takhmina's farm has two cows and a small barn, with all the necessary conditions for livestock. The monthly profit from selling milk is 4,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Takhmina turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of young livestock. Takhmina plans to invest the income from the loan in further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира - участник группы «Тахмина», ей 38 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей.  Замира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодня в хозяйстве Замиры имеется 5 овец, 4 ягнят,  2 головы крупного рогатого скота. Также Замира ежегодно обрабатывает  0,60  га земли,  где выращивает в основном картофель и  пшеницу.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zamira is a member of the "Takhmina" group.  She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture and provides her family with its main source of income.  She currently owns 5 sheep, 4 lambs, and two head of cattle. 

Each year, Zamira also works on 0.60 hectare of land, on which she grows mainly potatoes and wheat. In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to purchase young livestock.   She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Rosa Narcisa

texts.es: Rosa vive en Paraíso de la Flor donde tiene un cyber. Tiene 42 años y se encuentra casada con Carlos quien es chofer profesional y trabaja en la Metrovía, sistema de transporte urbano masivo de Guayaquil. Tienen 5 hijos quienes están en época estudiantil en escuelas fiscales. Rosa nos comenta que empezó el negocio cuando compro una computadora para uso de sus hijos ya que por el sector no había donde alquilarla. A partir de ahí viendo la oportunidad adecuado en su domicilio la sala haciéndola un local. Con eso decidió comprar otro maquina y abrió el cyber, de inmediato vio resultados tanto así que ahora cuenta con 5 computadoras, escáner y copiadora. La atención del negocio la maneja junto a su hijo, el en las mañanas y ella en las tardes. De momento nos informa que su mayor problema es la delincuencia y la señal que a pesar de todo es muy baja. Con el crédito espera comprar otras computadoras para aumentar el negocio con lo que mejorarían sus ingresos y así arreglar su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa lives in Paraíso de la Flor where she has an internet cafe. She is 42 years old and is married to Carlos, a Metrovia driver, which is a massive urban transport system in Guayaquil. She has 5 children who are in public schools. Rosa tell us that she started her business when she bought a computer for her chilrden to use, since in her there was no place to rent one. From there she began to see the opportunity to set up a locale in the living room of her house. So she decided to buy another computer and opened the internet cafe. She saw inmediate results and now has 5 computers, a scanner and a copier. She tends the store with her son. He works mornings and she works afternoons. She tells us that right now her biggest problem is crime and the wireless connection, which despite everything is very low. With the loan she hopes to buy more computers to grow her business with which she will increase her income and fix up her home.

loans.use: to buy computers

loans.name: Abashizehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Régine fait partie du groupe Abashizehamwe et   habite à Cibitoke. C’est une veuve de  53 ans. Elle a 7 enfants âgés de 11 à  30 ans.

Elle fait le commerce des produits  vivriers (manioc, haricot, maïs,…) depuis 12 ans.

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité des produits vivriers (manioc, haricot, maïs,…), à revendre pour gagner plus.  

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  mettre en place une boutique alimentaire.
texts.en:
Régine is a member of the Abashizehamwe group and lives in Cibitoke. She is a 53-year old widow. She has seven children aged between 11 and 30 years old.

She has been a trader of food crops for 12 years (cassava, beans, corn, etc).

She is seeking her sixth loan from Turame. With the money she gets from KIVA, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of food crops, (cassava, beans, corn, etc.), that she can sell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of food crops (cassava, beans, corn, etc.) that she can sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel es socia del Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo menor de edad.
Son tres años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela  Ramos  y se dedica  a la venta  de bebidas gaseosas, esto lo realiza en su casa, eso le permite estar más tiempo con su hijo, el 100% de su ganancia es para solventar los gastos de su pequeño hijo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 jabas de gaseosa personal, 2 paquetes de agua mineral, 2 jabas de gaseosa de un litro, 2paquetes de gaseosa de 3 litros, 1 caja de gaseosa inca cola gordita, 3 paquetes de pepsi cola.
Seguirá trabajando con Manuela Ramos porque más adelante quiere tener un negocio más grande el cual le permita criar a su hijo y cubrir todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, a Communal Banks located in the Yarinacocha district, in the Ucayali department. She is 26 years old, she is single and she has a young son.
She has been working with the loan from Manuela Ramos for three years; she sells fizzy drinks in her house, and this allows her to spend more time with her child. She spends everything that she earns for the necessities of her small son.
With her new loan of 1,000.00 PEN she will buy 3 crates of soda in individual bottles, 2 packets of mineral water, 2 crates of 1 liter bottles of soda, 2 packets of 3 liter bottles of soda, 1 box of Inca Cola and 3 packets of Pepsi Cola.
She will keep on working with Manuela Ramos because in the future she wants to run a bigger activity that will help her in caring for her son and in providing him with everything he needs.

loans.use: To buy fizzy drinks and mineral water.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 67 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2  hijos.  Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope. La mayor parte de centros poblados de este distrito está considerada como zona rural con altos índices de pobreza, su calidad de vida es bastante precaria y limitada, en el centro poblado en donde vive Carlos, sus vecinos sólo cuentan con agua potable, mas no con electricidad. 

Carlos se dedica a la comercialización de animales en especial de ganado  porcino y caprino. Los cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres hace varios años por lo que conoce el negocio a la perfección. El realiza sus ventas en los caseríos de Mórrope y también realiza entregas desde su domicilio, durante todos estos años Carlos ha adquirido clientela fija para su negocio.  Además cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de la agricultura. 

Carlos desea adquirir alimento balanceado para que sus animales se desarrollen correctamente y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Por ello está solicitando un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles  a Edpyme Alternativa. 

Carlos es una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora, en el lugar en donde reside, sus vecinos dan muy buenas referencias de el. Anteriormente el ha tenido un préstamo financiado a través de Kiva. El se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que colaboraron con el en aquella oportunidad. Ya que le permitieron en su momento realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is 67 years old, married and has 2 children. He lives in his own home, located in a rural area of the Mórrope district. Most of the populated areas of this distrcit are considered to be rural with high rates of poverty. Its quality of life is precarious and limited. In the area where Carlos lives, the residents have potable water, but no electricity. 

Carlos sells animals, especially cattle, pork and goats. He raises them in pens located behind his house. He learned this activity from his parents several years ago and he knows the business perfectly. He sells in the towns of Mórrope and also makes deliveries from his home. During all this time, Carlos has acquired regular customers for his business. He also makes additional income with agricultural products.. 

Carlos wants to acquire balanced feed so that his animals can develop properly and be sold at a better price. For this, he is asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. 

Carlos is a very responsible and hardworking person. Where he lives, his neighbors give very good references for him. He has had a loan from Kiva before. He is very grateful to the people that cooperate with him with this opportunity, since they have allowed him to make improvements on his home.

loans.use: to acquire balanced feed so that his animals can develop properly and be sold at a better price.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 45 años, ella es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, que le gusta el trabajo. Está separada hace 6 años del padre de sus dos hijos: Jonatan de 23 años y Jennifer de 17 años. Actualmente vive con sus hijos en una casa alquilada.
Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapato para damas, caballeros y niños. Se inició hace dos ñaos con un capital propio que le envío a un familiar en Lima (ciudad capital), quien a su vez le envío la mercadería. En la actualidad ella misma realiza los viajes a Lima y escoge personalmente los mejores modelos de ropa.  Ofrece su venta al contado y otras veces al crédito, a 15 días. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite contar con tiempo libre para emplearlo en otras actividades. Al contrario, comenta que no le gusta cuando algunos de sus clientes no cumplen con los pagos de sus créditos, pero a pesar de eso tiene planes de abrir una tienda de ropa en alguna zona comercial de su ciudad.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el anterior crédito que tuvo. Y le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de ropa variada, además de zapatos de damas, buscando precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras.
texts.en:
Maritza is 45 years old, she is a an entrepreneurial and dynamic woman and she enjoys her work.  She has been separated for 6 years from the father of her children (Jonatan is 23 years old and Jennifer is 17). She now lives with her children in a home that they rent.  She sells clothing and shoes for women, men, and children.  She began her business 2 years ago and sent money to relatives in Lima so that they could purchase and send her merchandise.

Now she travels herself to Lima so that she can personally choose the best styles of clothing.  She accepts cash and sometimes credit, but it must be paid within 15 days.  She likes her work and the fact that it allows her to have free time to do other activities.  However, she does not like when her customers don't comply with the payment agreement, but despite of this, she has plans to open a clothing store in a commercial area of the city.

This is her second loan from MFP and she hopes to use it to continue working toward her goals.  She promises to comply with the payment schedule like she did with the last loan that she had.  She is also happy to be a part of the community bank because all of the people there are responsible and supportive.

With this loan of 1000 soles, she will invest in the purchase of various clothes and women's shoes, and she will search for volume discounts for her purchases.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to make and sell traditional folk weavings, and to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr:
Consolatte fait partie du groupe Maombi elle habite à Cibitoke. Elle a  27 ans et est mariée à Claude, cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont  4enfants, âgés de 1  à  7 ans.

Elle  fait le commerce de manioc depuis  5ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de manioc, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  changer d’activité  et voir ses enfants  terminer les études et vivre aisément.
texts.en:
Consolatte is a member of the Maombi group and lives in Cibitoke. She is 27 years old and is married to Claude, a farmer. Together they have 4 children, aged between 1 and 7 years old.

She has been a trader of cassava for 5 years.

She is seeking her sixth loan from the microfinance institution Turame. With the money she gets from KIVA, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of cassava that she can sell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to change her business activity and see her children finish their studies and live comfortably.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of cassava that she can sell in order to earn more

loans.name: Bikorwa Group

texts.fr:
Rose fait partie du groupe Bikorwa et elle habite à Cibitoke. Elle a 28 ans et est mariée à Etienne, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés de 1  à  9 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de sorgho depuis  6 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de sorgho, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait construire une maison dans sa parcelle et voir ses enfants continuer et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Bikorwa group and lives in Cibitoke. She is 28 years old and is married to Stephen, a driver. Together they have five children, aged between 1 and 9 years old.

She has been a trader of sorghum for 6 years.

She is seeking her first loan with the microfinance institution Turame. With the money she gets from KIVA she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of sorghum that she can sell to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to build a house on her plot of land and see her children continue and complete their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of sorghum that she can sell to earn more.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María Santos tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Caracucho del distrito agrícola de Mórrope. El distrito es considerado como uno de los distritos más pobres de la región Lambayeque, la mayor parte de sus pobladores carecen de servicios básicos. 

María Santos se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores y aves de corral, ella los cría en corrales acondicionados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, alimentándolos con productos balanceados y granos. Quincenalmente negocia sus animales con los comerciantes que recorren la zona en donde vive. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. El es agricultor. 

María Santos desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y con alimentos, por ello ha solicitado un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa con los que pueda lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora, sus vecinos le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
María Santos is 35 years old, married, and lives with her family in the hamlet of Caracucho, located in the agricultural district of Mórrope.  The district is considered one of the poorest in the region of Lambayeque, where the majority of the residents lack even basic public services.

María Santos dedicates herself to raising and selling small farm animals and poultry.  She raises them in corrals located behind her house, and gives them balanced feeds and grains.  Every two weeks, she negotiates the sale of her animals with the merchants that travel the zone in which she lives.  She uses the income she earns from this activity to help her husband, who is a farmer, support the family.

María Santos wants to expand her business with the purchase of more animals and feed.  This is why she has requested a loan of 1200 Peruvian soles through Edpyme Alternativa, in order to meet her objective.  She is very responsible, works hard and is well liked by her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed so she can expand her business of raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Luzmila Monje

texts.es: Luzmila de 56 años, tiene una casa de cemento con la que cuenta con agua, luz, alcantarillado y caminos pavimentados es uno de los pocos sectores que tiene esta facilidades ya que esta ubicada en los Vergeles zona que pertenece a las Orquideas. Empezó con esfuerzo y dedicación con su negocio hace 5 años atrás, vende productos de bazar, cosméticos y perfumería. Actualmente vive sola ya que sus hijos  son mayores de edad. Luzmila nos cuenta que recibe el apoyo de sus hijos para sus gastos pero no le gusta depender de nadie es por ese motivo que inicio su venta. Además quiere sentirse útil y verse activa. Trabaja sola recorriendo varios sectores sin hora ni horario establecido. Eso es lo mejor de ser independiente ya que maneja sus horarios sin problemas. Con el crédito piensa comprar ropa, bisutería y cosméticos que es lo que más vende por su precio. Espera continuar vendiendo mas cada día sin problemas como lo ha venido haciendo.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 56 years old and she has a cement house with water, electricity, plumbing, and paved roads and her house is in one of the few areas with these facilities in the Vergeles region of Orquideas.  5 years ago, with hard work and dedication, she began her business selling miscellaneous items, cosmetics, and perfume.

She now lives alone because her children are adults.  Luzmila tells us that she receives the support of her children for her household expenses, but she doesn't like to depend on anybody, and so this is why she began her business.  Additionally, she wants to feel useful and to be active.

She works alone in various areas without a fixed schedule.  She is happy to be independent and she manages her schedule without any problems.  With this loan she will buy clothing, jewelry, and cosmetics, which are the products she sells the most.  She hopes to continue selling more items every day, like she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy clothing, jewelry, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Estefana

texts.es: la Señorita estefana,de 41 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales(gallinas ponedoras de huevos)de esta fuente es que ella obtiene sus ingresos para ayudar a los gastos de su hogar ya que vive con sus padres, ella tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de alimentos(concentrado)para sus gallinas, y tambien de la misma forma comprar mas gallinas, ella espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito que esta solicitando y asi de esa forma seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: Estefana is 41 years old.  She raises and sells animals (egg laying hens).  This is how she earns money to help with the household expenses (she lives with her family.)  For 6 years she has done this work.  She is seeking a loan so that she can buy food (concentrate) for the hens and she will also buy more hens.  She hopes that she can receive help with the loan she is seeking so that she can continue running her business.

loans.use: to raise and sell animals - and to buy food for them.

loans.name: Linia Ines

texts.es:
Libia es una joven de 33 años de edad, vive en la linda ciudad de Pisco, la cual se caracteriza por su agricultura, la pesca sus hermosas playas, sus atractivos turísticos como son Las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de Paracas. Cuando Libia tiene un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear, sobre todo porque ella nos comenta que siempre hay que despejarse de los problemas y los inconvenientes que se presentan, asimismo le gusta en algunas oportunidades preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Cau Cau”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Hotelería y Turismo.

Con el día a día Libia trabaja en su negocio de Bazar en el cuan vende de productos para el hogar, regalos, adornos, peluches, entre otros, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes de manera diaria; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece productos muy bonitos y originales.

Libia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le  han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como adornos, peluches, vasos, relojes, ropa, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá tener mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir trabajando día a día en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder estudiar la carrera de Hotelería y que su negocio sea más grande”.
texts.en:
Libia is a young 33 year old woman. She lives in the beautiful city of Pisco, which is characterized by agriculture, fishing, and its beautiful beaches. It's tourist attractions are the Islas Ballestas and the Candelabro de Paracas. When Libia has free time, she likes to go out and about. She tells us that you have to clear your head of the problems and inconvineinces that occur. Sometimes she also likes to cook one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Cau Cau”. Due to the few resources that she has, she was only able to study up to the fifth grade of secondary school, but she would have liked to study Hospitality and Tourism. 

Day to day Libia works at her variety store where she sells products for the home, gifts, ornaments, stuffed animals, and more. She works at her business around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 30 customers daily. She thinks that it is going well for her at her business because she is very friendly to the customers and offers very attractive and original products. 

Libia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have offered her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as ornaments, stuffed animals, glasses, watches, clothing and more. This way she will be able to buy a wider variety of products to offer her customers. This will allow her to improve her income and keep working day to day seeking to make her biggest dream come true: "being able to study Hospitality and for her business to be bigger."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (ornaments, stuffed animals, watches, clothing and more).

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Caroline is 44 years-old and has four children who are in school.

Caroline has a local eatery business in the Philippines. Caroline requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Caroline has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Caroline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 33 year-old Kadiatu.  She is married, and has four children aged 17, 14, 11 and six years. In 2007, Kadiatu established her plastic shoes and  seasoning sales business. She began her business to help her support her children's education. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more plastic shoes for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to acquire a shop, to build a house for her family and educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic shoes for her business

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Memuna.  She is married and has three children aged 17, 14 and 10. In 2007, Memuna established her timber business. She began her business through an apprenticeship and as a means to enhance her independence. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 930,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. 

Memuna has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more timber. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL.  

In the future, Memuna plans to own a timber processing business and to educate her children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Jonny Diana

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Parcona es conocido por su clima cálido, así como también la generosidad de sus pobladores, también  podemos encontrar el bosque de piedras, el cual son formaciones rocosas en forma de animales y personas. Diana es madre de 3 pequeños a quienes  quiere muchísimo y por quienes trabaja al igual que su esposo para darle una vida digna y sobre todo con mucha humildad. Cuando Diana tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho ver televisión sobre todo sus novelas, en ocasiones le gusta preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima Carapulcra. Diana debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería.

Con mucho entusiasmo Diana trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 5 horas diarias, ella recorre las casas de sus vecinas y amigas de su barrio y también ofrece sus productos en el mercado de su barrio como recorredora, puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y le gusta su trabajo.

Diana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como casacas, chompas, buzos, entre otros, así ella podar tener más productos para ofrecer y sus clientes tendrán más variedad de productos para escoger, de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando día a día con todo el entusiasmo que la caracteriza para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y seguir creciendo cada día”.
texts.en:
Diana is a very hard-working and enthusiastic woman who lives in the district of Parcona, Ica, Perú.  The district of Parcona is known for its warm climate, as well as for the generosity of its townspeople.  We can also find the stone forest here, which has rock formations in the shapes of animals and people.  Diana is the mother of 3 small children who she loves very much; she and her husband work hard to provide a dignified and humble life for them.  When Diana has a little free time, she enjoys watching television, especially soap operas.  On occasion, she likes to prepare one of her favorite dishes, the delicious Carapulcra.  Due to her parent’s lack of financial resources Diana was only able to study until fifth grade, but would have liked to study Nursing.

Diana works enthusiastically about 5 hours per day in her business selling clothing.  She visits the houses of her neighbors and friends, and also offers her products in her neighborhood’s market.  She can tend to almost 20 customers during the day; her business is growing because she is very friendly with customers and enjoys her work.

Diana is very thankful for the Kiva loans since, thanks to the help they provide, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business such as jackets, sweaters, and track suits, among other items.  This will allow her to have more products to offer and give her customers a greater variety of goods to choose from.  It will help improve her income and allow her to continue working every day with the enthusiasm that characterizes her to make her greatest dream a reality: “To provide a good education for my children, and to continue growing each day”.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (jackets, sweaters and track suits, among other items).

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Loreta works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Loreta is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

Loreta has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio is from Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years-old. Bonifacio is married and has one child. To make a living, Bonifacio owns and operates a business venture, primarily operating motorcycle transport services. Bonifacio has been in his business for four years and earns 5,000 a month from these activities. In 2011, Bonifacio joined GDMPC. Bonifacio is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP that will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emilie is 35 years-old and has one child who is in school.

Emilie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Emilie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish to sell.

She has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Namera

texts.en:
Namera is 47 years old, married, and has five children who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.  Namera runs a jewelry retail business in the Philippines and requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.  She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as necklaces, bracelets, pendants, etc. 

In the future, Namera would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, a 42-year-old married mother of four, earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, a venture she has been involved in for 12 years. She earns additional income from fish vending.

Vilma is requesting a loan of PHP 50000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario, a married woman who works hard to support her family, has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 10 years. Now requesting a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other equipment, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Magali Del Pilar

texts.es:
Magali es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y con sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la calidad de vida de la población de esa zona es humilde y muchos no cuentan con los servicios básicos.  

Se dedica desde hace un año a la preparación y venta de alimentos, especialmente pollo frito y postres caseros.  Ella prepara estos alimentos en su domicilio y los vende ahí mismo a sus vecinos y conocidos, ocasionalmente los vende en casa de sus suegros. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades le sirven para ayudar a su esposo, que es peón agrícola, en los gastos del hogar. 

Magali desea adquirir insumos para poder preparar más alimentos y así ampliar su nivel de ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer bastante emprendedora y trabajadora, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Magali is a 32-year old homemaker who lives with her husband and three children in one of the towns within the agricultural region of Tambogrande.  The quality of life of the residents of this area is humble, and many do not have even basic public utility services.

For the past year, she has dedicated herself to preparing and selling food, especially fried chicken and homemade desserts.  She makes the food in her home, and sells them right there to neighbors and acquaintances, also occasionally selling from her in-law’s house.  The income she makes from these activities helps her husband, who is a farm laborer, with the household’s expenses.

Magali would like to buy supplies to make more food and, therefore, increase her sales levels.  For this reason, she has turned to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles to help her reach her goal.  She is very entrepreneurial, a hard worker, and highly regarded by those who know her.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making more food and increase her level of sales.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 46 years old, married, and has seven children, two who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 29,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Juvy has been raising pigs for five years and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Nena

texts.en:
Ma. Nena, a 47-year-old married mother of three, works very hard to provide for her family. For 10 years she has been operating a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Now requesting a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, in the future Ma. Nena would like to build and expand her business to secure its financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel tiene  68  años de edad, es separado, y vive junto a sus hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, ubicado en la región Piura. La zona es bastante humilde y sus viviendas son de material rústico, solo cuentan con electricidad.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de quince años. Por un lado posee un terreno de cultivo en donde ha instalado el cultivo de Limón, el cual cosecha con regularidad y por otro lado posee aves de corral en su vivienda, las cuales también comercializa entre sus vecinos. Con estos ingresos el sostiene la economía de su familia. Sus hijos mayores le ayudan en el mantenimiento y cosecha de su sembrío de limón.

Juan Manuel desea adquirir fertilizantes para su plantación de limón, asimismo desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo llevando a cabo varias acciones como la extracción de hierbas dañinas, con esto el se asegura una mejor productividad en su parcela. Para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 4000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is 68 years old, separated, and lives with his children in one of the rural towns within the agricultural district of Tambogrande, located in the Piura region.  This is a poor area, where homes are built from rustic materials and residents only count on electrical services.

For more than fifteen years, he has dedicated himself to work associated with agriculture.  On the one hand, he has farmland where he has planted a lemon crop that he harvests regularly.  On the other, he has poultry that he also sells among his neighbors.  His older children help him with maintaining and harvesting the lemon crop.

Juan Manuel would like to buy fertilizers for his lemon plantings.  Likewise, he wants to provide maintenance for these, such as harmful weed removal to assure a greater production on his parcel.  To meet his goal, he has requested a loan of 4000 Peruvian soles through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
As a married motherr of 12 children, Adelaida works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane and rice.

Adelaida, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF, is requesting a new loan for PHP 12000 to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 27,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 12 years and earns additional income through clothing sales.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to buy a tricycle in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Isata, a married mother of three children aged seven, four, and two years. In 2007, Isata established her plastic dishes business both to earn a living and to enhance her independence. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 720,000 each month.

Isata is now requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy plastic dishes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000.

In the future, Isata plans to own a house and to rent a store in a more strategic area. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic dishes.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria tiene 50 años de edad y vive en Playas. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de víveres y artículos de bazar. El negocio lo empezó hace 15 años atrás cuando se separo de su esposo. Nos cuenta que siempre fue ama de casa y como no había trabajado nunca le fue imposible encontrar trabajo sin referencias. Con ayuda de sus familiares abrió la tienda en la cual tenía pocos artículos, a medida que aumento su clientela fue comprando más productos y poco a poco ha ido aumentando su negocio. El local está ubicado en su domicilio por lo que lo atiende ella todo el día de lunes a domingo. Nos cuenta que al principio fue muy duro ya que tuvo que aprender muchas cosa y sobre todo ganar la confianza de sus proveedores para poder tener créditos, gracias a Dios a quedado muy bien en sus pagos. Como todos sus hijos son mayores de edad vive sola pero si la visitan con regularidad. Con el crédito que solicita va a comprar más productos para ofrecer variedad y aumentar sus ventas. Maria tiene en mente como meta futura construir en su casa varios departamentos para alquilar
texts.en: Maria is 50 years old and she lives in Playas. She runs a shop where she sells food and general store products. She started her activity 15 years ago when she separated from her husband. She told us that she had always been a housewife, and as she had never worked before it was impossible for her to find a job without references. Thanks to her family’s help she opened her shop with few items; she then bought more products as the number of her customers increased, and little by little she has improved her activity. The shop is located in her house, and so she works there all day, Mondays to Sundays. She told us that at first things have been very hard and that she had to learn many things, especially how to win her suppliers’ trust in order to obtain loans, and she thanks God because she has been very good with her repayments. She lives alone because her children are adults, but they regularly come and visit her. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products to offer a wider variety to her customers and to increase her sales. In the future, Maria hopes to build some flats in her house in order to rent them out.

loans.use: To buy food, rice, sugar and home products for her store.

loans.name: Cintia Marilin

texts.es:
Cintia tiene 27 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y a su hija en una de las zonas rurales del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situado en la región Piura. La zona está poblada en su mayoría por agricultores y ganaderos, son gente muy trabajadora, su nivel de vida es bastante precario, solo cuentan con energía eléctrica. 

Ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza y venta de ganado menor, como ovejas, pavos y gallinas. Cintia cría sus animales en ambientes especialmente acondicionados en su domicilio, los alimenta con alimento balanceado, granos y pastos naturales y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes y a los vecinos del lugar. El negocio le brinda ingresos mensuales, los cuales utiliza para ayudar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. El es “mototaxista” (transportista que se vale de un vehículo pequeño motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta a la que se anexa una cabina en la que usualmente se transporta carga o pasajeros). 

Actualmente Cintia desea adquirir alimento balanceado para brindar una mejor crianza a sus animales y obtener mejores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y confiable. Anteriormente ha solicitado un préstamo en Kiva y se encuentra agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron.
texts.en:
Cintia is 27 years old, and she lives with her husband and her daughter in a rural area of Tambogrande, an agricultural district of the Piura region. The inhabitants of the area are mainly farmers and livestock breeders: this is a very hard-working community, and their standard of living is very poor, electricity being the only commodity.

Cintia has been engaged in breeding and selling small animals, such as sheep, turkeys and chickens for many years. Cintia raised her animals at home, in especially fit out pens, and she feeds them with balanced animal feed, grains and natural fodder; once they have reached a good size she sells them to shopkeepers and to neighbors of her area. This activity grants her a monthly income that she uses to help her husband in supporting their family’s economy. Her husband is “mototaxista” (he drives a small motorized vehicle, i.e. a motorcycle with an attached cabin generally used to transport goods or passengers).

Cintia currently wants to buy balanced animal feed to better care for her animals and so to get a better income from her sales. For this reason she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN. She is a reliable and rather responsible woman: she has previously requested a loan through Kiva and she is grateful to the people who have supported her.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed for her animals.

loans.name: Warakoze Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne fait partie du groupe Warakoze et   habite à  Kayanza. Elle est âgée de  45 ans et est mariée à Jérôme, commerçant de chèvre et lapin. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants, âgés  de 13  à 27ans. Seul cadet étudie et vit sous le toit de ses parents.

Elle  fait le commerce de bière Primus et de la bière locale depuis  13 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  pour la préparation de beaucoup de litres de bière locale, à  vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  continuer son commerce et les gaines du commerce contribueront à la satisfaction ses besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member of the Warakoze group and lives in Kayanza. She is 45 years old and is married to Jerome, a goat and rabbit merchant. The couple have 7 children together, aged between 13 and 27 years old. The youngest son is the only child who goes to school and still lives with his parents.

Jeanne has been selling Primus beer and local beer for 13 years. This is her 8th loan with Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored credit will increase her capital and she will buy a large quantity of bananas with which to make many litres of local beer for resale, so that she can earn more money. In the coming years, she would like to continue with her business and use the profits to contribute towards taking care of the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas with which to make local beer.

loans.name: Santos Florindo

texts.es:
Santos  tiene 33 años de edad, es  casado, tiene 3 hijos  y vive en el Municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Santos hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de caña de azucar. Santos manifiesta que empezó a trabajar con media manzana, y de la primera cosecha que saco elaboro productos alimenticios como Dulce de azúcar, jugo de caña y batidos para vender, dice que se motivo bastante porque sus ventas fueron muy rentables.  Con el tiempo el fue superándose y ahora cuenta con 2 manzanas de caña cultivadas. 
El solicita un préstamo con ODEF, de 5,000 lempiras para sembrar caña y comprar  fertilizante y mejorar el mantenimiento de los cultivos para lograr sacar mejores cosechas.
Su plan es seguir trabajando y comprar más tierras y poder extender sus cultivos y tener un rendimiento económico que le resuelve todos sus problemas económicos  en el  futuro.
texts.en:
Santos, age 33, is married and has three children. He lives in the Taulabe municipality in Comayagua.

Santos started farming ten years ago.  Specifically, he grows sugar cane.  Santos says that he started to work with half a “manzana” (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres).  He used the first harvest that he got to make food products like fudge, sugar cane juice, and smoothies to sell.  He says that this motivated him because it was very profitable.  In time he was improving, and he now has two manzanas of sugar cane cultivated.

He is requesting a loan from ODEF for 5,000 lempiras to plant sugar cane, to buy fertilizer, and to improve the maintenance of the crops.  He will do this to get better harvests.  His plan is to continue working, to buy more land, to extend his crops, and to have a yield that will solve all of his financial problems in the future.

loans.use: to plant sugar cane, to buy fertilizer, and to improve the maintanence of the crops.

loans.name: Rukundo Ii Group

texts.fr:
